Short Update: Enhancement to Node: Open Source Code
Long Update: Variable dm_exposure identifies the name of the exposure variable

Short Update: Enhancement to Node: Open Source Code
Long Update: Variable dm_offset identifies the name of the offset variable

Short Update: Enhancement to Node: SAS Code
Long Update: Macro dm_exposure is available on the Macros pane

Short Update: Enhancement to Node: SAS Code
Long Update: Macro variable dm_exposure identifies the nliteral name of the exposure variable

Short Update: Enhancement to Node: SAS Code
Long Update: Macro variable dm_offset identifies the nliteral name of the offset variable

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: ERCOMPSTORE
Long Update: The REGRESSLIMIT= suboption of the MAXELEMENTTYPECOUNTS= option specifies the maximum number of element values to store for the specified element type in the COMPOUNDTYPE statement

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: ERCOMPSTORE
Long Update: The EXCLUSIONREGRESSLIMIT= option specifies the maximum number of element values to store for computing compound exclusions. This limit is applied to each compound exclusion rule unless you specify a different limit by using the REGRESSLIMIT= suboption of the MAXELEMENTTYPECOUNTS= option in the COMPOUND statement

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: fairAITools
Long Update: The assessBias action generates a new GroupInfo table when the sensitive variable has a user-defined format

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: fairAITools
Long Update: The new mitigateBiasGradientSVM action enables you to train a support vector machine (SVM) while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: fairAITools
Long Update: The new mitigateBiasNeuralNet action enables you to train a neural network model while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: rteng
Long Update: The createCompoundStore action now includes an exclusionRegressLimit parameter and a regressLimit subparameter of the maxElementTypeCounts parameter. They enable you to specify the maximum number of element values to store for computing compound exclusions. The exclusionRegressLimit parameter value is applied to each compound exclusion rule unless you specify a different value in the regressLimit subparameter

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: NOMINALDR
Long Update: The procedure now supports a new method
Example Link: to perform dimension reduction of nominal variables

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: ASSESSBIAS
Long Update: The procedure generates a new GroupInfo table when the sensitive variable has a user-defined format

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: nominalVarsDimReduction
Long Update: The new lpca action enables you to perform dimension reduction of nominal variables by using logistic principal component analysis (LPCA)

Short Update: New report Bias Mitigation Metrics is available on the Fairness and Bias tab
Long Update: New report Bias Mitigation Metrics is available on the Fairness and Bias tab in the Results view for the supervised learning nodes. This report displays one or more key fairness statistics for each variable that is selected for bias assessment

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: SVMACHINE
Long Update: The new MITIGATEBIAS statement enables you to train a support vector machine (SVM) while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: recommenderEngine
Long Update: The new itemBased parameter in the recKnn action enables you to choose between a user-based and an item-based nearest-neighbor model. When you set this parameter to False
Document Link: recommendations are generated on the basis of shared interaction patterns between users. When you set this parameter to True
Example Link: recommendations are generated on the basis of an item similarity search

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: recommenderEngine
Long Update: The default value of the boundObj parameter in the recDtos action has changed to True to improve the performance of this action. Also
Document Link: you can now use flexible user feature input columns to score your recommender engine model; that is
Example Link: the input scoring data set does not need to have all the user features that the training action uses

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: fairAITools
Long Update: new mitigateBiasGradientBoostTree action
Document Link: The new mitigateBiasGradientBoostTree action enables you to train a gradient boosting tree model while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: Enhancement to PROC: GRADBOOST
Long Update: new MITIGATEBIAS statement
Document Link: The new MITIGATEBIAS statement enables you to train a gradient boosting tree model while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: New PROC: LIME
Long Update: This new procedure implements the local interpretable model-agnostic explanations (LIME) method. It enables you to explain how a machine learning model behaves near a specific query observation

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: NNET
Long Update: The new MITIGATEBIAS statement enables you to train a neural network model while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: New Action Set: nominalVarsDimReduction
Long Update: The Nominal Variables Dimension Reduction action set is now available. The new mca action enables you to perform dimensionality reduction for nominal variables

Short Update: New Proc: NOMINALDR
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to perform dimensionality reduction for nominal variables

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: ASTORE
Long Update: now enables you to score multiple correspondence analysis (MCA) models that were trained using the NOMINALDR procedure or the nominalVarsDimReduction.mca action

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: ASTORE
Long Update: This procedure now enables you to score deep learning text classification models that were trained using the TEXTBERT procedure. The SETOPTION statement also includes two additional options
Example Link: when you score a model that was trained using PROC TEXTBERT

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: ASTORE
Long Update: The SETOPTION statement now includes an AGGREGATION_METHOD option when you score a model that was trained using the recKnn action

Short Update: New Proc: FPCASCORE
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to apply a previously trained functional principal component analysis (FPCA) model to new functional data in order to compute functional principal component scores. For example
Document Link: you can use it to project new functional observations onto the computed functional principal components for analysis and prediction

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: RECENGINE
Long Update: This procedure now supports the BOUNDOBJ option in the DTOS statement when you use the data translation with optimal step size (DTOS) method. This option can significantly improve the performance of the DTOS method

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: RECENGINE
Long Update: This procedure now enables you to train an explicit feedback model by specifying a target variable in the TARGET statement that includes users’ explicit ratings of items

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: RECENGINE
Long Update: The new CONTEXT statement accepts context features from the input variables that can be used when you specify the METHOD=BPR option. Context features are transaction features such as the time or amount that is spent in the transaction

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: RECENGINE
Long Update: The procedure now accepts user features and item features that you can use to train a recommender engine model when the selected method is data translation with optimal step size (DTOS)

Short Update: New Proc: FPCA
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to perform functional principal component analysis (FPCA) on dense
Document Link: regularly spaced functional data. For example
Example Link: you can use it to perform dimensionality reduction and feature extraction on functional data

Short Update: Network Python API
Long Update: You can now take advantage of SAS Viya Network capabilities by using a native Python interface. The API includes a number of graph theory and network analysis algorithms that can augment data mining and machine learning approaches

Short Update: New Action: fairAITools.mitigateBiasForest
Long Update: he new mitigateBiasForest action enables you to train a forest model while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: FOREST
Long Update: The new MITIGATEBIAS statement enables you to train a forest model while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: New Proc: SHAPLEY
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to estimate Shapley values to explain variable importance for an observation on the basis of a reference data set. PROC SHAPLEY supports two Shapley value estimation algorithms: Kernel SHAP and HyperSHAP

Short Update: New Proc: ERUPSERT
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to add
Example Link: or update data in a compound store. You can optionally output the entities that were formed after modifying the compound store. Otherwise
Release: the data will exist in the compound store for future queries

Short Update: New Proc: ERCOMPSTORE
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to create a compound store
Document Link: which is a collection of tables that store compound
Release: and entity information. You can configure how entities are defined by specifying element

Short Update: New Proc: ERQUERY
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to query a compound store to find all entities and networks that correspond to one or more specified documents. You can specify statements and options that affect how the entities and networks are formed

Short Update: New variable type: Geolocation
Long Update: You can now specify a geographically encoded variable using the new geolocation variable role

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: new parameter for recKnn
Long Update: The recKnn action now includes a target parameter
Document Link: which enables you to train the recommender model by using explicit user responses

Short Update: New Proc: SMOTE
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to use the synthetic minority oversampling technique (SMOTE) to generate synthetic tabular data. SMOTE is an oversampling method that addresses the issue of imbalanced data sets for machine learning modeling

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: MWPCA
Long Update: You can now calculate angle changes by using multiple principal components. To do these calculations
Document Link: you specify the NPCUSED= and WARMUPSIZE= options in the OUTPUT statement

Short Update: Enhnacement to Action Set: robustPca
Long Update: In the moving windows principal component analysis (mwpca) action
Document Link: you can now specify the number of principal components to use for computing angle changes. You can also specify the number of observations to use in warmup steps when multiple principal components are used

Short Update: The values for Number of ROC cutoff values in global settings and project settings have been extended
Long Update: The values for Number of ROC cutoff values in global settings and project settings have been extended to include values 5000
column9: and 500000. The higher values enable a more accurate Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curve and ROC-based statistics for rare-event-based data in SAS Visual Data Mining and Machine Learning. However
column10: specifying a higher number of ROC cutoff values results in a longer run time
column11: especially when the training table is large

Short Update: Enhanced Proc: GPREG
Long Update: You can now specify the APPLYROWORDER option in the PROC GPREG statement to use a data distribution and row order as determined by a previous partition action call. This option enables you to get reproducible regression results

Short Update: Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS) Is Now Supported
Long Update: ADLS is now supported by SAS Visual Machine Learning. Starting with this release
Document Link: users can use an ADLS caslib as a data source

Short Update: Enhanced Action Set: recommenderEngine
Long Update: You can now specify the boundObj parameter in the recDtos action to use an upper bound of an objective to find the descent direction and optimize the step size to minimize the objective

Short Update: Improved sorting for projects in SAS Model Studio
Long Update: Using the table view on the Projects page
Document Link: you can sort the list of projects by clicking the column header. For example
Example Link: you can sort the projects by the project name or the date on which the project was last modified. Beginning with this release
Release: when you return to a new session in Model Studio

Short Update: New Action Set: fpca
Long Update: The new functional principal component analysis (FPCA) action set is a powerful suite designed for advanced analysis of dense
Example Link: The new functional principal component analysis (FPCA) action set is a powerful suite designed for advanced analysis of dense
Release: regular functional data. This action set includes two key components: the fPca action for FPCA training and the fPcaScore action for FPCA scoring. The fPca action enables you to perform functional principal component analysis
column8: capturing essential patterns in complex functional data structures
column9: and the fPcaScore action provides efficient capabilities for scoring the new data set against the trained functional principal component

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: FASTKNN
Long Update: a new graph-based approximation method has been added
Document Link: A new graph-based approximation method has been added. Also
Release: including cosine distance and inner product distance
column8: have been introduced for nearest-neighbor calculations

Short Update: Enhancement to Action Set: fastknn
Long Update: a new graph-based approximation method has been added
Document Link: A new graph-based approximation method has been added. Also
Release: including cosine distance and inner product distance
column8: have been introduced for nearest-neighbor calculations

Short Update: New Proc: EXTRACTOBJECTS
Long Update: This new procedure efficiently extracts detected objects from images by using bounding box information. You use this procedure for two primary modes of extraction: highlighting detected objects directly within the input images and cropping the detected objects for separate analysis or display

Short Update: New Proc: PROCESSMEDIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure performs basic processing of two-dimensional (2-D) and three-dimensional (3-D) biomedical images. You use this procedure for processing methods that include clamping

Short Update: New Proc: AUGMENTIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to enhance an image data set by creating modified versions of images. Training machine learning models on augmented images allows them to perform better on unseen data and reduce the risk of overfitting

Short Update: Enhancement to rteng Action Set: The new summarizeCompoundStore action enables you to summarize data properties for a compound store
Long Update: The new summarizeCompoundStore action enables you to summarize data properties for a compound store

Short Update: Enhancement to recommenderEngine Action Set: You can now specify the userFeatureTable and itemFeatureTable parameters to train the Bayesian personalized ranking (BPR) with the factorization machine (FM) model
Long Update: You can now specify the userFeatureTable and itemFeatureTable parameters to train the Bayesian personalized ranking (BPR) with the factorization machine (FM) model

Short Update: Deprecated property Perform clustering-based split search in the Splitting Options property group has been removed
Long Update: Deprecated property Perform clustering-based split search in the Splitting Options property group has been removed. To create the effects of selecting this property
Document Link: you can combine levels of high-cardinality variables during the data preparation stage
Example Link: or you can use custom categories within SAS Visual Analytics when building a report

Short Update: New Proc: QUANTMEDIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure performs quantitative analysis on biomedical images
Document Link: computing both basic and advanced statistical measures for entire images or for components within an image. The results are used in applications in fields such as computer vision

Short Update: New Proc: SEGMENTMEDIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure performs segmentation on two-dimensional and three-dimensional biomedical images. You use it to label pixels that belong to a region of interest
Document Link: which is a fundamental task of most biomedical image analysis

Short Update: New Proc: ANNOTATEIMAGES Procedure
Long Update: This new procedure enhances images in a data table by adding various types of annotations. You can highlight and draw specific features on images to facilitate better visualization

Short Update: New Proc: SUMMARIZEIMAGES Procedure
Long Update: This new procedure offers a comprehensive statistical overview of various features within an image table. It enables you to analyze and summarize key image attributes
Document Link: providing better understanding and insights about the data

Short Update: New Proc: QUANTIMAGES Procedure
Long Update: This new procedure performs quantitative analysis on images
Document Link: computing both basic and advanced statistical measures. The results are stored in a table for use in applications in fields such as computer vision

Short Update: New Proc: COMPAREIMAGES Procedure
Long Update: This new procedure calculates similarity metrics between two sets of images and is able to identify pairs of similar images

Short Update: New Proc: RECASSESS
Long Update: This new procedure calculates several different metrics to assess the quality of recommendations from a recommender system

Short Update: New Proc: FUTTEDQNET
Long Update: This new procedure trains and scores a fitted Q-network (FQN) reinforcement learning (RL) model in SAS Viya

Short Update: New Proc: DLMZEXPORT
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to create an analytics store (astore) from a deep learning model that has been trained using DLMZTRAIN

Short Update: New Proc: ASSESSBIAS
Long Update: This new procedure is designed to assess bias in predictive models by computing statistical metrics and bias measurements

Short Update: Enhancements for the Data Exploration Node Results
Long Update: The Data Exploration node results now include new reports Input Correlations

Short Update: Enhacnements for the SVM Node
Long Update: New parameters are available for autotuning an SVM node: Kernel

Short Update: You can now add a Segment Profile node as a child of a Decision Tree node in a pipeline
Long Update: A Decision Tree node automatically generates variable _LEAF_ID_ in its output data and identifies it with the Segment role.

Short Update: Refresh All Data in a Model Studio project
Long Update: You can now refresh all the data sources for a Model Studio project by clicking the Refresh all data sources icon on the Data tab

Short Update: New Proc: REGISTERMODEL
Long Update: This new procedure registers DATA step and analytic store models in SAS Model Manager. It also calculates and registers assessment statistics for prediction and classification models

Short Update: Enhancement to the smote action set: specify the extrapolationFactor parameter
Long Update: You can now specify the extrapolationFactor parameter to specify the standard deviation to use when you add Gaussian perturbation noise to the boundaries of input data

Short Update: New Proc: DISPLAYIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure accepts an input table that contains image binaries in supported formats (such as JPG
Example Link: and so on) and displays the images via the SAS Output Delivery System (ODS)

Short Update: Enhancement to the Score Data Node: New property Calculate TreeSHAP values under Output Data
Long Update: New property Calculate TreeSHAP values under Output Data enables you to specify whether to calculate TreeSHAP values for Forest or Gradient Boosting models for all observations

Short Update: Enhancement to the Interactive Grouping Node: The property Target event level is new
Long Update: Identifies the target level to use for modeling. Possible values are 0 and 1

Short Update: New Proc: SAVEIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure writes images and associated metadata from an input table in memory onto a disk in a desired format
Document Link: which can be either a photographic or biomedical image format. You can use it to convert images from one format to the other

Short Update: New Proc: PROCESSIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure lets you specify a series of image-processing algorithms to apply to each image in an input data table. The algorithms can be individually customized and used multiple times
Document Link: and they are applied in the order in which you specify the statements

Short Update: New Proc: MATCHIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure lets you search for a matching image in a large collection of images. Its applications range from finding duplicates of an image to searching for a license plate in a large surveillance database

Short Update: recommenderEngine Action Set: new action recKnn
Long Update: The new recKnn action enables you to train a k-nearest-neighbors model from high-dimensional user-item interaction data and to generate item recommendations based on this model

Short Update: Proc The Stylegan: new STYLEGAN procedure trains a generative adversarial network (GAN) model on images in SAS Viya
Long Update: PROC STYLEGAN implements the Style GAN version 2 model by using the PyTorch library
Document Link: which enables you to generate realistic and high-quality synthetic images

Short Update: Proc Partialdepend: The new PARTIALDEPEND procedure computes partial dependence (PD) functions for machine learning models
Long Update: The new PARTIALDEPEND procedure computes partial dependence (PD) functions for machine learning models that are built using algorithms such as gradient boosting
Example Link: and neural networks and for many other types of models that are created using SAS software. PD shows how changes to the model's input values affect the model's predictions. PROC PARTIALDEPEND also produces individual conditional expectation (ICE) tables

Short Update: Proc Gpreg: The new GPREG procedure performs Gaussian process regression (GPR) for very large data sets in SAS Viya
Long Update: GPR assumes that the predictions are based on a latent function that is a posterior distribution of a Gaussian process prior and a Gaussian noise likelihood

Short Update: Proc Gpclass: The new GPCLASS procedure performs classification—a common step in data exploration—on quantitative data in SAS Viya
Long Update: It performs binary classification by using Gaussian process classification (GPC)
Document Link: which is a method of probabilistic modeling that assumes that an underlying function is generated by a Gaussian process (GP) that determines the class labels of the data

Short Update: Proc Astore: now supports the AGGREGATION_METHOD argument in the SETOPTION
Long Update: The ASTORE procedure now supports the AGGREGATION_METHOD argument in the SETOPTION statement for analytic stores that the recKnn action generates. This argument specifies the type of aggregation to apply in pooling similarity scores of nearest neighbors

Short Update: New Proc: FLATTENIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure accepts an input table that contains images in supported formats (such as JPG
Example Link: and so on) and produces an output table that has one variable per pixel. Its benefits include the ability to store images of different sizes

Short Update: New Proc: CONDENSEIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure converts a wide table that contains one pixel per variable to a CAS image table so that other image-related procedures can use it. In essence
Document Link: it provides the opposite functionality of PROC FLATTENIMAGES

Short Update: Ratemaking Node: changes to the default Selection method for Frequency Fitting and Severity Fitting Options
Long Update: The default for parameter Selection method under Frequency Fitting Options and Severity Fitting Options is now (none). The default for Selection method under Compound Fitting Options is still Stepwise.

Short Update: New Proc: LOADIMAGES
Long Update: This new procedure reads images and associated metadata and loads them into a data set. It supports both photographic and biomedical image types

Short Update: The new TABULARGAN procedure trains a correlation-preserving conditional tabular generative adversarial network (CPCTGAN) model on tabular data.
Long Update: It generates synthetic tabular data that preserve the pairwise correlations between variables from the original data and supports multithreaded training on one graphics processing unit (GPU) device.

Short Update: The new RECENGINE procedure implements two methods of creating recommender system models
Long Update: Bayesian personalized ranking (BPR) and data translation with optimal step size (DTOS).

Short Update: The FACTMAC procedure now supports the CROSSVALIDATION statement
Long Update: which performs k-fold cross validation to assess the accuracy of a model.
Example Link: all data are divided into k subsets (folds)
Release: where k is the value of the KFOLD= option. For each fold
column8: a new model is trained on the (k - 1) folds and then validated using the selected (holdout) fold. The assessment metrics are then averaged across all the holdout folds.

Short Update: The BNET procedure now supports the CROSSVALIDATION statement
Long Update: which performs k-fold cross validation to assess the accuracy of a model.
Example Link: all data are divided into k subsets (folds)
Release: where k is the value of the KFOLD= option. For each fold
column8: a new model is trained on the (k - 1) folds and then validated using the selected (holdout) fold. The assessment metrics are then averaged across all the holdout folds.

Short Update: Ratemaking Node: You can now specify Compound as the model type for the Ratemaking node.
Long Update: Ratemaking Node: You can now specify Compound as the model type for the Ratemaking node.

Short Update: Ratemaking Node: You can now save the ratemaking table that is included in the node results to a library of your choice.
Long Update: You can now save the ratemaking table that is included in the node results to a library of your choice. New properties under Output Options in the Ratemaking node properties panel enable you to specify whether to save the table and
Example Link: the target library and the name of the table.

Short Update: New Proc: LOADDICOMDATA
Long Update: This new procedure reads data from files that comply with the Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicines (DICOM) standard (set by the National Electrical Manufacturers Association in 2018). Among its benefits is the ability to load data from generic DICOM files

Short Update: Added Example: Integrating Model Studio with SAS Visual Analytics
Long Update: The SAS Viya: Machine Learning User's Guide has a new example for integrating SAS Visual Analytics and Model Studio.

Short Update: The Ratemaking node results now include new reports Ratebook - Frequency and Ratebook - Severity.
Long Update: The Ratemaking node results now include new reports Ratebook - Frequency and Ratebook - Severity. These reports display a ratebook table for frequency or severity
Document Link: depending on the Ratemaking node Model type property setting.

Short Update: Open Source Code Node Python: Example added to documentation
Long Update: The SAS Viya: Machine Learning User's Guide now has a Python example for the Open Source Code node.

Short Update: Enhancement to the Pricing Optimization Node
Long Update: You can now import and export constraints in the Constraints window.

Short Update: Enhancement to the Pricing Optimization Node
Long Update: You can now import and export calculated measures in the Calculated Measures and Objective Measures window.

Short Update: Pricing Optimization Node: A new Base Scenario Details report is available in the Results view & Rate constraints are now inclusive.
Long Update: Pricing Optimization Node: A new Base Scenario Details report is available in the Results view & Rate constraints are now inclusive.

Short Update: The image action set is now documented (including examples) in SAS Viya Computer Vision Programming Guide
Long Update: The image action set is now documented (including examples) in SAS Viya Computer Vision Programming Guide

Short Update: The bioMedImage action set is now documented (including examples) in SAS Viya Computer Vision Programming Guide
Long Update: The bioMedImage action set is now documented (including examples) in SAS Viya Computer Vision Programming Guide

Short Update: Includes enhancements to previously existing features.
Long Update: Includes enhancements to previously existing features.

Short Update: New CAS Action Set for SMOTE
Long Update: Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique Action Set (SMOTE).

Short Update: Autotuning for LightGBM in SAS Model Studio
Long Update: Perform Autotuning for gradient boosting parameters is now supported when Perform LightGBM is selected.

Short Update: Enhancement to Node: Ratemaking
Long Update: You can now manually specify which variables you want to undergo spline processing using the Spline Variables window

Short Update: Enhancement to the Pricing Optimization Node: Efficient Frontier Options
Long Update: Use these options to specify minimum and maximum average success rates
Document Link: the number of rates to use
Example Link: and the method for calculating the average rate

Short Update: Enhancement to the Pricing Optimization Node: Probability of Success Variable
Long Update: You can now specify a variable to use in your objective functions that represents the probability of a user accepting an offer

Short Update: New Variable Role
Long Update: The Exposure variable role specifies a numeric variable that is used as a scaling measure of risk
Document Link: which is often referred to as an exposure in insurance and risk modeling. Only one variable in a project can be assigned the role of Exposure

Short Update: Estimate restrictions are now available for the Ratemaking node when Severity is the specified model type
Long Update: Estimate restrictions are now available for the Ratemaking node when Severity is the specified model type

Short Update: New Node added: Geosmoothing
Long Update: The Geosmoothing node is a postprocessing node that uses a geographically coded variable to smooth model results based on distances

Short Update: Enhancement to the Scorecard node: Interactive Scorecard Builder
Long Update: The interactive scorecard builder is a new feature available when using the Scorecard node

Short Update: New Node added: Behavioral Risk Model
Long Update: The Behavioral Risk Model node is a supervised learning node

Short Update: Enhancement to the Ratemaking node: "The Ratemaking node results now include new reports Normal Quantile-Quantile Plot for Standardized Residuals and Homoscedasticity Plot"
Long Update: The Ratemaking node results now include new reports Normal Quantile-Quantile Plot for Standardized Residuals and Homoscedasticity Plot

Short Update: Enhancement to the Pairwise Selection Node: new algorithm XYZ
Long Update: In addition to the previously existing Gradient Boosting algorithm
Document Link: a new algorithm XYZ is now available

Short Update: Enhancement to the Ratemaking Node: Coefficient Visualization is a new plot
Long Update: Coefficient Visualization is a new plot that is available in the Results view of the Ratemaking node

Short Update: Enhancement to the Ratemaking Node: Actual vs Expected is a new plot
Long Update: Actual vs Expected is a new plot that is available in the Results view of the Ratemaking node

Short Update: Update to Ratemaking node: Confidence Level property and the Use the Exact Percentile Method for Lift Calculations property are no longer available as output options
Long Update: Confidence Level property and the Use the Exact Percentile Method for Lift Calculations property are no longer available as output options

Short Update: Update to Optimization node: Table name option is no longer available
Long Update: Previously
Document Link: user-defined data sets could be specified for constraints or calculated measures using this option. Beginning with 2024.02
Example Link: these tables must be imported using the respective editors

Short Update: Ratemaking Node: The two-factor interactions editor for the Ratemaking node can now be used when the specified model type is Compound.
Long Update: The two-factor interactions editor for the Ratemaking node can now be used when the specified model type is Compound.

Short Update: Ratemaking Node: The Create relativity plots property is no longer available for the Ratemaking node. However
Long Update: relativity plots are automatically generated when the specified model type is Compound.
Document Link: The Create relativity plots property is no longer available for the Ratemaking node. However
Example Link: relativity plots are automatically generated when the specified model type is Compound.

Short Update: New Pairwise Selection Data Mining Preprocessing node
Long Update: The Pairwise Selection node is a new Data Mining Preprocessing node that fits a gradient boosting model to determine the predictive power of every pair of input variables

Short Update: New Pricing Optimization node for Data Preprocessing in SAS Dynamic Acturial Modeling Workflows
Long Update: The Pricing Optimization node is a Data Preprocessing node that can be incorporated into a dynamic actuarial modeling workflow. This node attempts finding the most advantageous pricing strategy for insurance renewals. The node can be used to optimize multiple metrics.

Short Update: Ability to Convert a Lua Window or a Python Window to a Custom Window
Long Update: When a project is part of a project package
Document Link: and the project contains a Lua window or a Python window
Example Link: you can convert that window to a custom window. Converting a window can be a more convenient way to create a custom window than creating a custom window from scratch

Short Update: Logger Custom Window
Long Update: The Logger custom window has been added to the SAS Event Stream Processing Studio Custom Windows GitHub. This custom window uses Lua and provides an easy way to debug the SAS Event Stream Processing event flow
Document Link: especially in remote environments where there is no access to the input data sources and to the output data

Short Update: Warm-Up Events for ONNX Models
Long Update: When a Score window processes events from an ONNX model
Document Link: it can take a while to process the first few events and a backlog of events might be created. You can use the new warmup-steps element to specify model warm-up steps in the Model Reader window

Short Update: Voice Transcription with ONNX Example
Long Update: A voice transcription example that uses the OpenAI Whisper ONNX model has been added to SAS Event Stream Processing Studio Examples GitHub. You can access this example from SAS Event Stream Processing Studio: click View example projects on the Projects page and select Voice Transcription with ONNX

Short Update: Update to the Pose Estimation with ONNX Example
Long Update: The Pose Estimation with ONNX example has been updated so that the model's w_annotate window now uses the Computer Vision Annotation custom window

Short Update: Update to the Computer Vision with ONNX Example
Long Update: The Computer Vision with ONNX example has been updated so that the model's w_annotate window now uses the Computer Vision Annotation custom window

Short Update: Shewhart Individuals Control Charts
Long Update: When you are working with online models
Document Link: you can now use Shewhart individuals control charts
Example Link: which are used for charting individual measured values over time

Short Update: Enhancements to Using the recommenderKnn Algorithm in the Train Window
Long Update: There are two new options for initializing the recommenderKnn algorithm in the Train window. You can now load pre-trained models into the Train window when you are using the recommenderKnn algorithm or you can train the model with prior data before it is used for online training and scoring

Short Update: New Attribute for Referencing a Lua or Python Code File
Long Update: In a Lua window or a Python window
Document Link: you can use the file attribute of the code element to reference Lua or Python code that is in an external file

Short Update: k-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) Algorithm Accepts Explicit Feedback
Long Update: The KNN algorithm that is used by SAS Event Stream Processing for recommendations now accepts implicit or explicit user feedback. Previously the KNN algorithm accepted implicit feedback

Short Update: Exponentially Weighted Moving Average (EWMA) Control Charts
Long Update: When you are working with online models
Document Link: you can now use EWMA control charts. EWMA control charts are used to monitor variables when small process shifts are of interest

Short Update: New Morphological Operations Algorithm
Long Update: The morphological operations algorithm enables you to analyze and extract geometric structures from digital images. These operations are particularly effective in pre-processing tasks and can be applied to both gray scale and binary images

Short Update: ByteTrack Method Available in Object Tracker Windows
Long Update: The Object Tracker window now enables you to use the ByteTrack tracking-by-detection method. Previously only the intersection-over-union (IOU) method was available

Short Update: Ability to Create Custom Windows
Long Update: Custom windows enable a developer to define new window types that users can easily add to their projects

Short Update: New Two-Dimensional Convolution Algorithm
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing now provides two-dimensional (2-D) convolution
Document Link: which involves convolving a single-channel input image with a user-specified kernel

Short Update: New Mahalanobis-Taguchi System (MTS) Method
Long Update: AS Event Stream Processing now provides the Mahalanobis-Taguchi System (MTS)
Document Link: which is a multivariate statistical method that is used for pattern recognition and diagnosis

Short Update: Enhancement to Subspace Tracking (SST)
Long Update: Subspace tracking (SST) is a method used in signal processing and data analysis to monitor and update the lower-dimensional space (subspace) that best represents a set of data that is evolving over time. The computation of SST has been expanded through the use of multiple principal component vectors

Short Update: Enhancement to Recommender Systems
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing now uses an adaptation of the inverted index base (IIB) k-nearest neighbors (KNN) algorithm for recommendations based on implicit user feedback

Short Update: New Motion Detection Algorithm
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing now provides a motion detection algorithm that analyzes an input image and determines whether motion has occurred

Short Update: New Cumulative Sum (CUSUM) Charts
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing now provides a CUSUM chart that plots the cumulative sums of the deviations of sample values from a target value

Short Update: New Comparison Functions Added to Distribution-Based Change Detection
Long Update: The methods of distribution-based change detection identify a change in parameter values in the distribution of data over time. New comparison functions to use with these methods are now available for change detection

Short Update: New Example: ONNX Model That Uses Pose Estimation
Long Update: Pose estimation is a computer vision technique to recognize and categorize the positions of a human body. A new example demonstrates how you can use an ONNX model that applies pose estimation to detect keypoints of a person in an incoming video stream

Short Update: Use of Python Programs in Pattern Windows
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing now enables the use of Python programs in Pattern windows to specify Events of Interest (EOIs) and output functions

Short Update: New Distribution-Based Change Detection Methods
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing now provides distribution-based change detection methods
Document Link: which compare probability distributions of data over time in order to identify significant variation between them

Short Update: Python modules can now be written at the project level
Long Update: Python modules can now be written at the project level. You can import these modules into any Python entity in the project by using the name of the module

Short Update: Python code snippets can now be written at the project level for reference by any Python entity within the project
Long Update: Python code snippets can now be written at the project level for reference by any Python entity within the project

Short Update: New Python Window
Long Update: A new Python window enables you to create SAS Event Stream Processing events with functions in Python programs

Short Update: New Pre-processing Capabilities within a Model Reader Window
Long Update: You can now specify model pre-processing steps directly within a Model Reader window.

Short Update: Enhancement to Managing Project Packages
Long Update: In SAS Event Stream Processing Studio
Document Link: the Project Package pane now enables you to edit files that are included in a project package. Previously you could view files but not edit them. This functionality is available for selected file types.

Short Update: Support for Models from Deep Learning Model Zoos
Long Update: You now can use models from a model zoo with SAS Event Stream Processing.

Short Update: New Measures for Change Detection
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing now provides four measures for change detection: Kullback-Leibler divergence (KL divergence)

Short Update: Restriction to Use of Lua Functions
Long Update: Lua code that is executed by a Lua entity within a project can include any function that is provided in the standard Lua libraries with the following two exceptions: os.execute and io.popen. The use of either of these functions results in a run-time error
Document Link: which prevents a project from being loaded.

Short Update: New Median Filter-Based Control Chart
Long Update: Median filter-based control charts enable you to monitor the quality of a manufacturing or an industrial process over time. Data is collected on the monitored process at specified intervals.

Short Update: New Dynamic Bayesian Networks Plug-in
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing now provides a plug-in that enables you to use dynamic Bayesian networks to compute the evolution of beliefs in hidden variables over time.

Short Update: New Ability to Clear the History of the Object Tracker Window
Long Update: You can now specify under what conditions the history of the Object Tracker window should be cleared so that subsequent tracking can proceed in a fresh state.

Short Update: Support for CUDA 11
Long Update: CUDA (Compute Unified Device Architecture) enables hardware accelerated computation on NVIDIA CUDA-enabled GPUs. SAS Event Stream Processing now supports CUDA 11.

Short Update: Image Processing Enables Numeric Variables in Output
Long Update: The image processing algorithm now enables you to include a comma-separated list of numeric parameter names in output.

Short Update: Connected Component Labeling Has New Parameters
Long Update: Connected Component Labeling (CCL) now provides parameters to specify the size of the bounding box and the sorting flag.

Short Update: Enhancement to PROC: TEXTPROFILE
Long Update: The BIGRAMRATIO option specifies the sample ratio of the input data set for the token bigram analysis. By default
Document Link: a sample proportion of 0.2 is used for the input data set. The OUTTOLIBRARY option specifies an existing library to automatically save all output tables generated by the TEXTPROFILE procedure. These tables can be directly used for similarity analysis between two data sets

Short Update: The Match type option that specifies an input match type for the Concepts node
Long Update: The Match type option that specifies an input match type for the Concepts node

Short Update: Enhancement to PROC: TEXTMINE
Long Update: TOPICDECISION option for the SVD statement
Document Link: the TOPICDECISION option for the SVD statement in the TEXTMINE procedure. The TOPICDECISION option computes a 0-1 topic membership decision for each document relative to each topic and adds the variables containing these decisions to the OUTDOCPRO= table

Short Update: The ability to provide an alternate name for a custom concept or category
Long Update: Beginning with 2025.06
Document Link: you can add an alternate name in the Alternate name field to provide a description for a custom concept

Short Update: Enhancement to the Concept node: a new Chunk Size option
Long Update: A new Chunk Size option for the Concepts node to specify whether to split an input document into chunks.  You can specify the size of the chunks. Splitting an input document into chunks can decrease the time that it takes the Concepts node to run

Short Update: New Proc: TRANSCRIPTERROR
Long Update: The TRANSCRIPTERROR procedure matches the hypothetical word sequences from an input hypothesis table to the true word sequences from an input reference table in order to measure the performance of a speech recognition system

Short Update: New Proc: TRANSCRIPT
Long Update: The TRANSCRIPT procedure transcribes audio input in Waveform Audio File (WAV) format by using the acoustic model and the language model that you specify

Short Update: New Proc: TEXTBERT
Long Update: The TEXTBERT procedure is designed to perform text classification by using a deep learning model. It uses transfer learning to fine-tune a classification model that is based on bidirectional encoder representations from transformers (BERT) with labeled textual input for training

Short Update: New Proc: BUILDINDEX
Long Update: The BUILDINDEX procedure enables you to construct an index that is based on a specified schema. A schema provides information about each variable in an index
Document Link: where each variable is represented by a column in the index

Short Update: New Proc: SEARCHINDEX
Long Update: The SEARCHINDEX procedure searches for a query against an index table and retrieves records that are relevant to that query. The query consists of one to three conditions: keyword
Example Link: and filter. The keyword condition finds specific keywords from text variables. The match condition finds records that have an exact value for the specified variable. The filter condition provides a range for a numerical variable to subset the results

Short Update: New Proc: GETINDEXSCHEMA
Long Update: The GETINDEXSCHEMA procedure gets the schema from an existing index table

Short Update: Enhancement to Actions: a new litiChunkSize parameter for the applyConcept
Long Update: exportTextModel
Example Link: a new litiChunkSize parameter for the applyConcept
column8: and tpParse actions. Previous versions of SAS Visual Text Analytics used 32-kilobyte chunks when processing a document. The litiChunkSize parameter uses this default value and allows you the ability to specify a different chunk size when processing a document

Short Update: Azure Data Lake Storage is supported as a data source for VTA projects in SAS Model Studio
Long Update: Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS) is supported for SAS Visual Text Analytics. If you are using Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS)
Document Link: then device code authentication is required when you refresh a data source or replace a data source

Short Update: Enhanced Proc: TEXTMINE
Long Update: The SPELLCHECK statement for proc TEXTMINE specifies the options for learning misspelled terms and their corrections

Short Update: Improved sorting for projects in SAS Model Studio
Long Update: Using the table view on the Projects page
Document Link: you can sort the list of projects by clicking the column header. For example
Example Link: you can sort the projects by the project name or the date on which the project was last modified. Beginning with this release
Release: when you return to a new session in Model Studio

Short Update: New Proc: TERMMAP
Long Update: The TERMMAP procedure is a powerful tool for extracting and visualizing patterns and relationships within textual or transactional data. By identifying Boolean rules that are based on the occurrence of terms
Document Link: the procedure helps you discover underlying structures in the data

Short Update: New Proc: TEXTSENTIMENT
Long Update: The TEXTSENTIMENT procedure enables you to validate language interpretation for textual information (LITI) syntax and to compile an LI binary from a table of LITI rules. It also enables you to save the compiled model as a table

Short Update: New Unmatched tab in the Interactive Window for the Categories
Long Update: Concepts
Example Link: a new Unmatched tab in the Interactive Window for the Categories node
column9: and the Topics node. Depending on the node
column10: this tab displays documents that do not match the selected concept

Short Update: Enhancement to Action: a new language parameter for the applySentimentConcepts action
Long Update: a new language parameter for the applySentimentConcepts action. When the language parameter is specified and the model parameter is not specified
Document Link: the predefined model for the language is used for scoring. When both the language parameter and the model parameter are specified
Example Link: the model that is specified with the model parameter is used and the value of the language parameter is ignored

Short Update: Enhancement to Action: new predefinedSentiment parameter for the compileConcept action
Long Update: a new predefinedSentiment parameter for the compileConcept action. When the value of this parameter is set to true
Document Link: the predefined sentiment model for the language that is specified with the language parameter is extended. The predefinedSentiment parameter replaces the extendableModel parameter

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: TEXTSENTSCORE
Long Update: new option LANGUAGE
Document Link: a new LANGUAGE option for the TEXTSENTSCORE procedure that specifies which language's predefined sentiment model to use. This LANGUAGE option replaces the INMODEL option and the step to load the ReferenceData library

Short Update: New sentiment model for Romanian
Long Update: A new sentiment model for Romanian has been added

Short Update: New sentiment model for Hungarian
Long Update: A new sentiment model for Hungarian has been added

Short Update: New property options for the Sentiment node that enable you to specify a sentiment model
Long Update: New property options for the Sentiment node that enable you to specify a sentiment model

Short Update: Enhancement for SAS Model Studio: a side-by-side layout option in the interactive window for the Concepts node
Long Update: the Text Parsing node
Release: a side-by-side layout option in the interactive window for the Concepts node

Short Update: New Proc: RELATEDTERMS
Long Update: The RELATEDTERMS procedure enables the identification and understanding of terms that are closely related to a specified term within a data set

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: OUTWORDPRO option for the TEXTMINE procedure
Long Update: The OUTWORDPRO option in the SVD statement of the TEXTMINE procedure specifies a SAS data table to contain the projections of the columns of the term-by-document matrix

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc TextMine: COMPLEXTAG option for parsing
Long Update: The COMPLEXTAG option includes the complexTag variable in the OUTPOS= table and in the output OUTTERMS= table. For some terms
Document Link: the variable will contain a finer level of detail of the part of speech such as Vpp (verb past participle)

Short Update: New Proc: TEXTSUMMARY procedure uses natural language processing (NLP) techniques to summarize a document
Long Update: The TEXTSUMMARY procedure uses natural language processing (NLP) techniques to summarize a document by selecting representative sentences from within the document to become the summary. This procedure computes a summary for each document in a data set

Short Update: New Proc: TERMCOOCCUR
Long Update: calculates a co-occurence association score for selected pairs of terms
Document Link: The TERMCOOCCUR procedure calculates a co-occurrence association score for selected pairs of terms in the document collection. The scores
Example Link: which are computed using positive pointwise mutual information (PPMI)
Release: indicate the strength of association between the pairs of terms

Short Update: New Proc: LANGUAGEID
Long Update: performs language identification on textual data
Document Link: The LANGUAGEID procedure performs language identification on textual data in a specified input table. This procedure identifies the language of a document and assigns a language code corresponding to the language. This procedure uses statistical analysis which can recognize patterns in the given text data and then utilize these patterns to identify the language

Short Update: New Proc: IDVALIDATION
Long Update: investigate whether an input table contains duplicate IDs
Document Link: The IDVALIDATION procedure enables you to investigate whether an input table contains duplicate IDs. If you specify the OUT= option in the OUTPUT statement
Example Link: then duplicate IDs and the number of times that they occur are saved to the specified output table

Short Update: New Proc: IDGENERATION
Long Update: generates unique identifiers
Document Link: The IDGENERATION procedure generates unique identifiers (IDs) for an input data table. The IDGENERATION procedure provides an OUTPUT statement that enables you to copy input variables into an output table

Short Update: New Proc: TEXTCATSCORE
Long Update: The TEXTCATSCORE procedure scores text documents against a category model
Document Link: which is a type of rule-based model. You can write your own rules to define category membership for some documents while excluding texts that contain inappropriate content
Example Link: and then use the TEXTCATEGORY procedure to create the category model

Short Update: New Proc: TEXTCATEGORY
Long Update: The TEXTCATEGORY procedure provides development packages for a category model. The procedure checks the syntax of textual category rules and generates information about syntax errors in the rules. It uses textual category rules to generate a category model. The procedure also creates an analytic store for the category model

Short Update: Make us of the Basic Tokenizer in Concept and Categorie nodes for Chinese
Long Update: Japanese or Korean
Document Link: the Use basic tokenizer option for the Concepts node and the Categories node. You can use the Use basic tokenizer option with the Chinese
Release: or Korean languages to use the basic tokenizer instead of the standard tokenizer. The basic tokenizer separates words by white spaces
column11: and Korean characters. The basic tokenizer can better meet the needs of parsing specific texts and enhance the rule matching for these languages

Short Update: New Proc: TEXTRULE
Long Update: generates language interpretation for textual information (LITI) concept or fact rules by using annotated data
Document Link: the new TEXTRULE procedure. The TEXTRULE procedure generates language interpretation for textual information (LITI) concept or fact rules by using annotated data

Short Update: New Proc: TEXTCONCEPTSCORE
Long Update: enables you to score unstructured text by using a language interpretation for textual information (LITI) model that is loaded from a CAS table
Document Link: the new TEXTCONCEPTSCORE procedure. The TEXTCONCEPTSCORE procedure enables you to score unstructured text by using a language interpretation for textual information (LITI) model that is loaded from a CAS table. The primary use cases for this procedure are named entity recognition (NER) and information extraction. You can use a predefined NER model or a custom model that you compile by using the TEXTCONCEPT procedure

Short Update: New Proc: TEXTCONCEPT
Long Update: enables you to validate language interpretation for textual information (LITI) syntax and to compile an LI binary from a table of LITI rules
Document Link: the new TEXTCONCEPT procedure. The TEXTCONCEPT procedure enables you to validate language interpretation for textual information (LITI) syntax and to compile an LI binary from a table of LITI rules. It also enables you to save the compiled model either as a CAS table or as an analytic store

Short Update: New Romanian sentiment model
Long Update: a new Romanian sentiment model that can be used with the applySentimentConcepts action and the compileConcept action

Short Update: New Procedure: PROC TEXTSENTSCORE
Long Update: The TEXTSENTSCORE procedure uses a LITI model and sentiment weights to score text in an input data table and create an output data table that contains a sentiment classification and a sentiment score for each document in the input data table

Short Update: New Procedure: PROC TEXTCRFSCORE
Long Update: The TEXTCRFSCORE procedure enables you to score new text data by using a trained conditional random field (CRF) model

Short Update: New Procedure: PROC TEXTCRF
Long Update: The TEXTCRF procedure enables you to train conditional random field (CRF) models by using labeled text data

Short Update: New Proc added
Long Update: TEXTPROFILE
Document Link: The new proc textprofile describes statistical characteristics of text data in order to provide a profile of a data set and enable comparisons between data sets

Short Update: SAS Visual Text Analytics in the SAS Viya platform includes improved text processing and performance enhancements to previously existing features.
Long Update: SAS Visual Text Analytics in the SAS Viya platform includes improved text processing and performance enhancements to previously existing features.

Short Update: The tokenizer parameter for the compileConcept action specifies which tokenizer to use in the concept model.
Long Update: the tokenizer parameter for the compileConcept action. The tokenizer parameter specifies which tokenizer to use in the concept model. When the tokenizer parameter is set to the default value of STANDARD
Document Link: a language-specific tokenizer is applied. All licensed languages support the default STANDARD value. When working with the Chinese
column8: a basic tokenizer is also available to restrict tokens to three types: whitespace-separated strings of non-Chinese

Short Update: Improved text processing and performance enhancements to previously existing features.
Long Update: Improved text processing and performance enhancements to previously existing features.

Short Update: tokenizer parameter for textRuleDevelop.compileCategory to change word separation
Long Update: The tokenizer parameter enables you to change the default (called Standard) word tokenization (which is a language specific tokenizer) to Basic. The Basic tokenizer separates by white spaces
column8: because of this the Basic tokenizer is only available when the language parameter is set to Chinese

Short Update: parseTableIn and parseTableOut for textRuleScore.applyConcept for CLAUS_n speed up
Long Update: The parseTableOut parameter enables you to save the intermediate parsing results to a table which can then be used in the parseTableIn parameter to speed up processing with the CLAUS_N operator between applyConcept actions

Short Update: General Enhancements
Long Update: Improved text processing and performance enhancements to previously existing features
Document Link: SAS Visual Text Analytics includes General Enhancements
Example Link: Improved text processing and performance enhancements to previously existing features

Short Update: CLAUS_n operator for LITI
Long Update: The CLAUS_n operator that returns term matches depending on whether the specified terms exist within the specified number of hierarchically related clauses.

Short Update: Expanded Graph Options (Preview)
Long Update: The following objects have new options that were formerly available only in SAS Graph Builder: butterfly chart

Short Update: New Options for Slider Controls
Long Update: The new Range minimum and Range maximum options for the slider control replace the Set fixed range option. You can assign parameters to these options to dynamically set the range for the slider

Short Update: Additional Expanded Graph Options (Preview)
Long Update: The following objects have new options that were formerly available only in SAS Graph Builder: dot plot

Short Update: Additional Way to Access Report Properties
Long Update: When you are editing a report
Document Link: you can now view the report properties by clicking More icon on the report toolbar
Example Link: and then selecting About this report. The About This Report window appears and displays the report properties
Release: including the report summary. (The report properties are still available under the General heading in the Options pane.)

Short Update: New SAS Visual Analytics API
Long Update: The new SAS Visual Analytics API enables application developers to perform basic report tasks
Document Link: such as creating and editing reports
column8: and exporting data from a report

Short Update: Preview: Expanded Graph Options
Long Update: The following objects have new options that were formerly available only in SAS Graph Builder: bar charts

Short Update: Inline Text Editing dynamic values
Long Update: You can also edit text inline to add dynamic values. Enter a brace ( { )
Document Link: and then choose a data item
column8: or other value to quickly add dynamic values to text in your reports

Short Update: Enhancement to Report parameters: You can use ranks in your parameter expressions to subset the scope of the expression. For example
Long Update: if you create a rank of the top 10 products by revenue
Document Link: then the expression is evaluated for those products instead of for the entire data source
Example Link: You can use ranks in your parameter expressions to subset the scope of the expression. For example
Release: if you create a rank of the top 10 products by revenue
column8: then the expression is evaluated for those products instead of for the entire data source

Short Update: Enhancement to Report parameters: You can use an expression to set the value of character-based parameters
Long Update: You can use an expression to set the value of character-based parameters

Short Update: New Option for Slider Controls
Long Update: A new Include missing values menu option is available in the slider control's object menu or in the pop-up menu. The Include missing values menu option does not display the check box below the slider. This option enables new or existing reports with sliders to take advantage of this new feature without having to display the Missing values check box in the report

Short Update: New Option for Slider Controls
Long Update: Slider controls have a new Missing values option check box in the Options pane. When you select this option
Document Link: a Missing values check box is displayed below the slider in a report. When a user selects the Missing values check box
Example Link: anything in the report that is filtered by the slider includes missing values

Short Update: New Inline Text Editing
Long Update: You can now edit text and titles in SAS Visual Analytics without having to use another window. To edit text or titles inline
Document Link: double-click the text that you want to edit
Example Link: and then use the toolbar buttons to change the font
column9: and so on. For text objects
column10: you can also right-click the object and select Edit

Short Update: Revised Workflow for Copying Links and Copying Embeddable Markup
Long Update: There are now separate menu options for copying links and for copying embeddable markup for reports
Release: there was only a Copy link option
column8: which opened the Copy Link window where you could copy links or copy markup. A new Copy embeddable markup menu option and a new Copy Embeddable Markup window enable you to copy a code snippet for a report
column10: or an object for use in the SAS Viya SDK for JavaScript

Short Update: Enhanced Parallel Coordinates Plot Object
Long Update: Parallel coordinates plot objects have the following enhancements: Color-mapped display rules are now supported for categorical data items. The Fill
column8: and Data tip background options are available under the Style heading in the Options pane

Short Update: Support for Viewing and Editing Source Tables When Viewing Reports
Long Update: You can now view and edit source tables when you are viewing a report if you are authorized to do so. (Previously
Document Link: this feature was available only when you were editing a report.)

Short Update: General Enhancement: The Export Report Package window has been updated for improved accessibility
Long Update: The Export Report Package window has been updated for improved accessibility

Short Update: General Enhancement: The Edit Rich Text window and the Edit Title window have been updated for improved accessibility and performance
Long Update: The Edit Rich Text window and the Edit Title window have been updated for improved accessibility and performance

Short Update: General Enhancement: New icon for aggregated measures
Long Update: New icon for aggregated measures

Short Update: General Enhancement: In text topics objects
Long Update: only documents that are part of a topic are displayed
Example Link: only documents that are part of a topic are displayed. Hiding the documents that are not part of the analysis makes text topics more consistent with the other analytical objects in SAS Visual Analytics

Short Update: General Enhancement: Data tip style and Data tip background are now under the Style heading
Long Update: The Data tip style and Data tip background options are now under the Style heading in the Options pane. Previously
Document Link: these options were under the Graph Frame heading

Short Update: Enhancement to Precision Containers: temporary foreground
Long Update: If you select an object that is in the background
Document Link: then it is temporarily moved to the front so that all of its contents are visible and available to interact with

Short Update: Enhancement to Precision Containers: corner brakcets
Long Update: When you move the cursor over an object that is not selected
Document Link: corner brackets appear. The corner brackets indicate the borders of the object

Short Update: Enhancement to Geo region and region-coordinate maps: placeholder regions
Long Update: For geo region maps and geo region-coordinate maps
Document Link: a new option enables you to display placeholder regions for regions that are not represented in the data. Placeholder regions can provide additional context for your map

Short Update: Add Multiple Data Sources at One Time
Long Update: You can now add multiple data sources to a report at one time in the Choose Data window
Document Link: which you can open from either the Data pane or the Suggestions pane

Short Update: Updated Report Review Pane
Long Update: The Report Review pane now displays a warning if your report contains a partition that is not used by any objects

Short Update: Enhancement to the Text Topics object: Number of Documents
Long Update: The text topics object has a new heading that displays the number of documents and provides quick access to some of the options

Short Update: Enhancement to the Text Topics object: Customize layout
Long Update: The text topics object has new options that enable you to customize the layout and the contents of the object. For example
Document Link: you can hide all of the visuals except for the word cloud
Example Link: and you can change the layout to a stacked container

Short Update: Enhancement to the Path Analysis object: Viewers can create & edit filters
Long Update: When you are viewing a report
Document Link: you can now create and edit path filters for path analysis objects if users are able to make data edits in the report

Short Update: General Enhacement: update to colors and icons
Long Update: The user interface has been refreshed. For example

Long Update: You no longer set report parameter values by assigning them to control objects in the Roles pane. Instead

Example Link: any parameter assignments using the Parameter role are converted to parameter links

Short Update: Enhanced Report Parameters: You can specify an expression to set the value of a parameter
Long Update: Because the expression for a parameter is evaluated for the entire data source
Document Link: you can use an expression-based parameter to accomplish tasks that were previously difficult or impossible

Short Update: Enhanced Report Parameters: changes to requirements for minimum and maximum values
Long Update: For numeric parameters and date parameters
Document Link: it is no longer necessary to specify the minimum and maximum possible values for the parameter

Short Update: Initial Value Option for Control Objects
Long Update: Control objects have a new Initial value option
Document Link: and range slider objects have Initial min value and Initial max value options.These options enable you to specify the default initial selection for the control when a user opens the report for the first time
Example Link: or when they select Restore default report state

Short Update: Enhancement to control objects inside the Prompt Container object
Long Update: For control objects that are inside of a prompt container
Document Link: layout options are now available to extend the size of the control. The Extend width if available option is available for controls inside of a vertical prompt container
Example Link: and the Extend height if available option is available for controls inside of a horizontal prompt container

Short Update: Enhancement for the expression editor
Long Update: In the expression editor for calculated items and advanced filters
Document Link: you can click the Pop out icon to edit a subexpression for an operator or function

Short Update: Enhancement for the Network object
Long Update: For network objects
Document Link: the directionality of links affects the calculation of communities

Short Update: General Enhancement to the Image Object Options Pane
Long Update: For image objects
Document Link: the Options pane displays the path for images that are stored in SAS Content

Short Update: Enhanced Expression Editor for Calculated Items & Advanced Filtering
Long Update: When you are editing calculated items and advanced filters
Document Link: the expression editor has a new side pane that shows details for functions and operators. You can use the side pane to specify the properties for the selected function or operator

Short Update: Enhancement to Automated Explanations: forecasts use the aggregation of the response measure and the format of the date item that is in the Time role
Long Update: For automated explanation objects
Document Link: forecasts use the aggregation of the response measure and the format of the date item that is in the Time role. (Previously
Example Link: the aggregation was always Average and a date format was chosen automatically.)

Short Update: Enhancement to Automated Explanations: forecasts now reference the most recent date value
Long Update: For automated explanation objects
Document Link: forecasts now reference the most recent date value.

Short Update: Enhanced Expression Editor: Code Reformating
Long Update: When you are editing calculated items and advanced filters
Document Link: the expression editor enables you to reformat your code for greater readability.

Short Update: Updated Values for Geographic Maps
Long Update: The geographical lookup values for SAS Visual Analytics have been updated
Document Link: please refer to the documentation for a detailed list of changes

Short Update: Distribute Reports to Microsoft Teams Channels
Long Update: You can now distribute reports to Microsoft Teams channels. When you distribute a report to a Microsoft Teams channel
Document Link: the PDF for the report is saved on the channel's Files tab or is saved to the user chat

Short Update: General Enhancements for Network Analysis object
Long Update: now with a summary

Short Update: General Enhancements for Automation Explanation object

Short Update: For periodic functions such as RelativePeriod()

Short Update: Decision tree objects have a new Abbreviate numeric values option that you can use to abbreviate large number values.
Long Update: Decision tree objects have a new Abbreviate numeric values option that you can use to abbreviate large number values.

Short Update: Critical Change: For English locales
Long Update: some date and datetime values are displayed with different formatting.
Example Link: some date and datetime values are displayed with different formatting. For example

Short Update: View the Source Tables for Data Sources
Long Update: The new View Source Table window enables authorized users to view the SAS Cloud Analytic Services (CAS) source tables for data sources. Access for this feature depends on the /SASVisualAnalytics_capabilities/sourceTableViewing application URI.

Short Update: There is a new Make truncated headings focusable setting for accessibility.
Long Update: There is a new Make truncated headings focusable setting for accessibility. This global setting for SAS web applications enables you to access truncated headings in the SAS Visual Analytics user interface.

Short Update: New Information Privacy Icons in the Data Pane

Short Update: General Enhancements: You can permanently delete items from the recycle bin on the home page.
Long Update: You can permanently delete items from the recycle bin on the home page.

Short Update: The Data Roles pane has been enhanced.
Long Update: The Data Roles pane has been enhanced to support selecting multiple data items. The user interface has been refined. For example

Short Update: Refreshed Report Canvas.
Long Update: The report canvas has been refreshed. When a blank canvas is displayed

Short Update: New Expression Builder for Calculated Items and Filters
Long Update: A new expression builder interface enables you to build calculated items
Example Link: and advanced filters. The interface provides inline help and code completion suggestions to help you create your expressions. A prompt is displayed for each function in order to provide help and samples to help you specify all of the parameter values.

Short Update: Improved UI Performance.
Long Update: SAS Visual Analytics now loads faster and displays reports more quickly than previous versions of the software.

Short Update: Python API Enhancement: new constructor to create ImageArray
Long Update: A new constructor is added that enables you to create ImageArray objects from a list of image-like objects

Short Update: New Proc: LIME
Long Update: This new procedure implements the local interpretable model-agnostic explanations (LIME) method. It enables you to explain how a machine learning model behaves near a specific query observation

Short Update: You can now launch SAS Enterprise Guide from SAS Viya Workbench
Long Update: You can now launch SAS Enterprise Guide from SAS Viya Workbench

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: GRADBOOST
Long Update: The new MITIGATEBIAS statement enables you to train a gradient boosting tree model while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: Python API Enhancement: darken and lighten functions are enhanced
Long Update: The darken and lighten functions are enhanced to enable you to specify gamma values on a per-image basis for images in an ImageArray object

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: RECENGINE
Long Update: This procedure now supports the BOUNDOBJ option in the DTOS statement when you use the data translation with optimal step size (DTOS) method. This option can significantly improve the performance of the DTOS method

Short Update: New Proc: FPCA
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to perform functional principal component analysis (FPCA) on dense
Document Link: regularly spaced functional data. For example
Example Link: you can use it to perform dimensionality reduction and feature extraction on functional data

Short Update: New Proc: FPCASCORE
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to apply a previously trained functional principal component analysis (FPCA) model to new functional data in order to compute functional principal component scores. For example
Document Link: you can use it to project new functional observations onto the computed functional principal components for analysis and prediction

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: ASTORE
Long Update: now enables you to score multiple correspondence analysis (MCA) models that were trained using the NOMINALDR procedure or the nominalVarsDimReduction.mca action

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: NNET
Long Update: The new MITIGATEBIAS statement enables you to train a neural network model while minimizing the bias metric that you specify

Short Update: New Proc: NOMINALDR
Long Update: This new procedure enables you to perform dimensionality reduction for nominal variables

Short Update: Network Python API
Long Update: You can now take advantage of SAS Viya Network capabilities by using a native Python interface. The API includes a number of graph theory and network analysis algorithms that can augment data mining and machine learning approaches

Short Update: Support for R Programming Language
Long Update: SAS Viya Workbench now supports R programming language in VS Code
Example Link: and Jupyter Notebook. You can manage
column8: and visualize your data using R and R packages available in SAS Viya Workbench

Long Update: Aggregate pushdown is now available for the simple.distinct action. Previously

Example Link: either specify sql=true in the summary action or specify the aggregatePushdown=true data connector option

Short Update: Aggregate pushdown is now available for the simple.summary action
Long Update: Aggregate pushdown is now available for the simple.summary action. To push down aggregation requests to the SingleStore database

Long Update: A new option is available in PROC ACCELERATOR. The optional KEEPLISTCOLUMNS= option in the RUNMODEL statement specifies columns to keep in the output data

Long Update: A new option is available for scoring in Teradata. The LOGLEVEL= option can help you to debug errors in your scoring code. If you use PROC SCOREACCEL
Document Link: you can specify the LOGLEVEL= option within the EPOPTIONS= string of the RUNMODEL statement. If you use the SAS_SCORE_EP stored procedure

Short Update: Enhancement to node: Hierarchical Modeling
Long Update: The Hierarchical Modeling node has been updated to enable you to generate forecast and statistics tables for all levels of the project hierarchy. After the node has run
