Short Update: runOptmodel action now automatically transforms univariate rational functions to second-order cone form for use by the conic optimization solver
Long Update: runOptmodel action now automatically transforms univariate rational functions to second-order cone form for use by the conic optimization solver

Short Update: Proc Optmodel now automatically transforms univariate rational functions to second-order cone form for use by the conic optimization solver
Long Update: Proc Optmodel now automatically transforms univariate rational functions to second-order cone form for use by the conic optimization solver

Short Update: The conic optimization solver in PROC OPTMODEL and the runOptmodel action now solves convex quadratically constrained quadratic programming (QCQP) problems by first automatically transforming to a second-order cone problem.
Long Update: The conic optimization solver in PROC OPTMODEL now solves convex quadratically constrained quadratic programming (QCQP) problems by first automatically transforming to a second-order cone problem.

Short Update: In PROC OPTMODEL and the runOptmodel action
Long Update: you can now solve the minimum spanning tree problem on directed graphs in addition to undirected graphs.
Document Link: In PROC OPTMODEL and the runOptmodel action
Example Link: you can now solve the minimum spanning tree problem on directed graphs in addition to undirected graphs. For directed graphs
Release: the algorithm returns a minimum-cost arborescence. You can specify a source node to be the root of an arborescence by using the SOURCE= suboption in the MINSPANTREE= option in the SOLVE WITH NETWORK statement.

Short Update: The optNetwork Action Set and Proc now support minSpanTree to solve minimum spanning tree problems on directed graphs.
Long Update: The minSpanTree action and Proc OptNetwork option enable you to solve the minimum spanning tree problem on directed graphs. In this case
Document Link: the algorithm returns a minimum-cost arborescence. You can specify a source node to be the root of an arborescence by using the source parameter / source= option.

Short Update: Microsoft Excel: Working with SAS Viya Jobs is now in Production from Preview
Long Update: A new manifest file is available to download and deploy for Excel. This manifest file contains an updated version of the SAS tab on the Ribbon
Document Link: which includes icons for these new production features

Short Update: Microsoft Excel: Working with SAS Programs is now in Production from Preview
Long Update: A new manifest file is available to download and deploy for Excel. This manifest file contains an updated version of the SAS tab on the Ribbon
Document Link: which includes icons for these new production features

Short Update: Microsoft Excel: Uploading Excel Data to the SAS Server is now in Production from Preview
Long Update: A new manifest file is available to download and deploy for Excel. This manifest file contains an updated version of the SAS tab on the Ribbon
Document Link: which includes icons for these new production features

Short Update: Microsoft Excel: Deleting Data from the SAS Server is now in Production from Preview
Long Update: A new manifest file is available to download and deploy for Excel. This manifest file contains an updated version of the SAS tab on the Ribbon
Document Link: which includes icons for these new production features

Short Update: PowerPoint: Updates in PowerPoint on the Web
Long Update: You can now use SAS for Microsoft 365 in Microsoft PowerPoint on the web to insert

Short Update: Excel: Working with SAS Viya Jobs (Preview)
Long Update: You can now open SAS Viya jobs in SAS for Microsoft 365. This is a preview feature for this release.

Short Update: New mathematical data step function EXPM1
Long Update: returns 1 less than the exponential function of the argument
Document Link: The EXPM1 function returns 1 less than the exponential function of the argument.

Short Update: Default change of ColorModel= in the SGScatter Proc - this might impact your output appearance.
Long Update: The COLORMODEL= option default for the SGSCATTER procedure COMPARE
Example Link: and PLOT statements is changed from the ThreeColorAltRamp style element to the TwoColorAltMap style element. This might change the appearance of your scatter plot panels that use the COLORRESPONSE= option. To restore the original appearance
Release: add the COLORMODEL=ThreeColorAltRamp option to the COMPARE
column9: or PLOT statement in your SAS program.

Short Update: SAS Conversation Designer in the SAS Viya platform includes performance enhancements to previously existing features.
Long Update: SAS Conversation Designer in the SAS Viya platform includes performance enhancements to previously existing features.

Short Update: SAS Conversation Designer in the SAS Viya platform includes performance enhancements to previously existing features.
Long Update: SAS Conversation Designer in the SAS Viya platform includes performance enhancements to previously existing features.

Short Update: General Enhancements
Long Update: SAS Conversation Designer in the SAS Viya platform includes performance enhancements to previously existing features.

Short Update: Topics are no longer created when you analyze assets
Long Update: and the Topic
Example Link: and TopicParent search facets are no longer available
Release: Topics are no longer created when you analyze assets
column10: and TopicParent search facets are no longer available

Short Update: Sample percent
Long Update: Maximum data size
Document Link: and Maximum frequency count options are no longer available for compute libraries
Example Link: When you analyze data in a SAS compute library
column9: and Maximum frequency count options are no longer available to select. In previous releases
column10: those options were ignored for compute data

Short Update: New Preview Data Tab
Long Update: For table assets
Document Link: the new Preview Data tab replaces the Sample Data tab. The new Preview Data tab provides improved performance for large tables
column8: and enables you to select and copy values from the preview table

Short Update: Discovery Agent Performance Update
Long Update: Only in-memory tables are profiled when newly created discovery agents are run. This setting improves the performance of profiling. Existing discovery agents continue to profile tables that are both loaded and unloaded into memory. Note that you can change the configuration of existing discovery agents to specify that they profile only tables that are loaded into memory

Short Update: New Custom Analysis Options
Long Update: Two new custom options were added to the list of analysis options: Use the sample data set for computing descriptive statistics and Sample size of the sample data set for computing descriptive statistics

Short Update: Add Tags to Columns in Table Assets
Long Update: You can add tags to the columns in table assets. A column.tags search facet is also available. You can use it to search for the columns that are associated with a specified tag

Short Update: Add Hyperlinks to Column Notes
Long Update: You can add hyperlinks to the column notes for columns in the Column Analysis tab

Short Update: Support for Column Annotations
Long Update: You can add notes to the columns displayed in the Descriptive Measures
Example Link: and Data Quality Measures views in the Column Analysis tab in the Details window

Short Update: Save Column Settings in SAS Information Catalog Tables
Long Update: The changes that you make to column selection and column order with the Manage columns button are persisted beyond the current session. The Manage columns button is available in the Search Results page and the tables in the Collections section of the Catalog Home window

Short Update: Enhcnament to Glossary: Import Non-Text Attributes
Long Update: You can include Boolean
Release: and date and time attributes for the glossary terms in the CVS files that you import into SAS Information Catalog

Short Update: Reload Relationships after Deploying an Update
Long Update: Administrators can run a job to update information about one or more asset types in SAS Information Catalog

Short Update: New Search Facets for SAS Studio Asset Types
Long Update: New search facets have been added to SAS Information Catalog search for StepCount

Short Update: More Detailed Library or Folder Information about Assets
Long Update: More detailed information is available about certain asset types

Short Update: Glossary REST API
Long Update: The Glossary API is now available. It serves as the programming interface to the glossary feature in SAS Information Catalog

Short Update: Reduced Default Sample Size for Text-Based Analyses
Long Update: The default number of rows used in text analyses in SAS Information Catalog has been reduced to 500. This setting improves performance without degrading the accuracy of the results of the analyses

Short Update: Indexes Checked Before They Are Rebuilt
Long Update: SAS Information Catalog indexes are checked when the rebuilding job is run to determine whether the rebuild is needed. If a rebuild is not needed

Short Update: Enhancement to the Glossary Feature: Term types now support additional attribute types
Long Update: Term types now support four new attribute types: Boolean
Release: and time. You also can import .sasxfer files into the glossary. These files enable you to migrate the metadata associated with terms and term types in SAS Business Data Network to the glossary contained in SAS Information Catalog

Short Update: Classifications Window Now Available
Long Update: You can access the Classfications. Once there
Document Link: you can review and manage the semantic types that are used for much of the analytical work performed in SAS Information Catalog. You can also open a selected semantic type and administrators can update its information privacy setting

Short Update: Updates to the Glossary Feature
Long Update: You can now remove the parent term from a selected glossary term and delete a term type. Removing the parent term turns the term into a root glossary term. You can delete only term types with no assigned terms
Document Link: and you cannot delete the default term type

Short Update: Glossary added to the SAS Information Catalog
Long Update: it is available with SAS Information Governance
Document Link: Glossary is a component that enables you to manage business terms and associate them with SAS Information Catalog assets. It supports a collaborative approach to managing this information. The Glossary is available with SAS Information Governance

Short Update: Update to Rebuilding Indexes Feature
Long Update: Starting with the 2024.01 release
Document Link: you can adjust the threshold for rebuilding indexes with the indexOutOFSyncLimit configuration option in the Catalog service in SAS Environment Manager. By default
Example Link: this option is set to 5 percent. Try resetting the option to 10 percent when you experience excessive rebuilds

Short Update: SAS OpenMetadata Connector for SAS Information Catalog
Long Update: Starting with the 2024.01 release
Document Link: you can use the SAS OpenMetadata connector to automatically add SAS Information Catalog metadata to an OpenMetadata metadata repository

Short Update: Clear Search Feature
Long Update: You can click the Clear Search icon in the Search field to clear your query

Short Update: Suggested Custom Options for Analysis
Long Update: You can enter custom options to customize your analysis before you run it. A table has been added that contains 18 commonly used custom options that you can use

Short Update: Updated Search Topic
Long Update: The Help topic that covers search in the SAS Information Catalog User's Guide has been updated. The new topic focuses on the most common types of queries and includes examples of each. It also provides tips for searching more efficiently.

Short Update: Enhanced Analysis Options Control
Long Update: You can set options before you perform an ad hoc analysis on an asset within SAS Information Catalog.

Short Update: You can run either a basic metadata analysis or a data profile analysis.
Long Update: You can set options before you analyze assets with a discovery agent in SAS Information Catalog. You can run either a basic metadata analysis or a data profile analysis.

Short Update: Semantic Type Remediation
Long Update: SAS Information Catalog now supports semantic type remediation
Document Link: which enables you to specify or change the semantic type assigned to a column in a table that has been analyzed.

Short Update: SAS Information Catalog REST API Release
Long Update: The SAS Information Catalog REST API is now available. It serves as the programming interface to the Catalog Service.

Short Update: Resources for Downloading Metadata and Uploading It to CAS
Long Update: You can use the SAS Information Catalog REST API to either download metadata for data sets or upload metadata to a library in a CAS server. This ability gives you several options to choose the type of metadata that you need and the manner of extraction. These processes enable you to handle metadata as in-memory tables in a library. The metadata can be of various types
Release: or a combination of data dictionary and additional profile metrics.

Short Update: Support for My Data Folder (casuser) added
Long Update: The My Data folder is now available in the Collections section of the SAS Information Catalog Home window. When you click it
Document Link: a list of tables matching the query: +library.name:casuser* is displayed. This query captures table assets such as those located in casuser and casuserhdfs for the specified user.

Short Update: More Meaningful Sentiment Analysis
Long Update: In previous releases
Document Link: a Neutral value reported in sentiment analysis could mean that a string contains either a value of no sentiment or a value of mixed positive and negative sentiments. Beginning with this release
Example Link: a Neutral value means that a string has a balanced mix of positive and negative sentiment values. Strings that have no sentiment value are no longer included in sentiment analysis.

Short Update: Advanced Options for Ad Hoc Analysis
Long Update: Now you can configure options when you run an ad hoc analysis of a database asset. These options affect the level of detail included in the analysis and the amount of time that the analysis takes to run.

Short Update: Read Access Required to Access SAS Information Catalog Assets.
Long Update: Access to assets within SAS Information Catalog requires that you have Read access to the type definition and all of its ancestors. This requirement enables administrators to create and manage a small set of rules.

Short Update: Deep Link to Ad Hoc Analysis History.
Long Update: Now you can create a deep link to the record that is created when an ad hoc analysis is run for a SAS Information Catalog database asset.

Short Update: Enable or Disable the SAS Information Catalog Tour.
Long Update: You can now enable or disable the tour for your implementation of SAS Information Catalog with a configuration setting in SAS Environment Manager. When you disable the setting
Document Link: the tour is not automatically run the first time that a new user logs in to SAS Information Catalog.

Short Update: Add and Maintain Group Contacts.
Long Update: Now you can add groups as contacts. Use the drop-down menu to limit your contacts search to users

Short Update: Hadoop: new option WEBHDFSURL
Long Update: When you use the WEBHDFSURL= option
Document Link: you are not required to run the Hadoop tracer script to copy the Hadoop JAR and configuration files to the SAS client machine

Short Update: JDBC: Support for CATALOG= Option
Long Update: Support for the CATALOG= option was added for JDBC

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Additional Values Supported for SQL_FUNCTIONS=
Long Update: You can now use the EXTERNAL_REPLACE and EXTERNAL_APPEND values with the SQL_FUNCTIONS= LIBNAME option for Google BigQuery

Short Update: Amazon Redshift: LIBNAME Support for SSO
Long Update: You can use single sign-on (SSO) to authenticate to Amazon Redshift via a LIBNAME statement

Short Update: DuckDB: Usage for Parquet Files
Long Update: Updated information was added about working with Parquet files

Short Update: Microsoft SQL Server on Fabric: Support for SCANSTRINGCOLUMNS= Options
Long Update: Support has been added for the SCANSTRINGCOLUMNS= options for Microsoft SQL Server on Microsoft Fabric Data Warehouse or Microsoft Fabric Lakehouse. Use this option to improve performance when loading data to SAS

Short Update: Snowflake: Working with VARIANT Data
Long Update: Information was added about working with VARIANT data in Snowflake

Short Update: Support for LIBNAME Connections to DuckDB
Long Update: Support has been added for LIBNAME statement connections to DuckDB. You can use this new SAS/ACCESS Interface to connect to a DuckDB instance on Amazon Web Services

Short Update: Hadoop: HIVE_PRINCIPAL= Option is Deprecated
Long Update: Several options have been added to facilitate connections to Hive servers that use Kerberos authentication. As a result
Document Link: the HIVE_PRINCIPAL= option is not needed for the Simba driver

Short Update: Hadoop: Connect to Hive Servers That Use Kerberos
Long Update: Several LIBNAME options are now available that enable you to connect to a Hive server in an environment that uses Kerberos. These options are used with the Simba JDBC driver that SAS redistributes. Prior to this release
Document Link: these new options were supported only in the string value that you provide for the URI= option. Now you can specify the values as the LIBNAME options KRB_AUTH_TYPE=
column10: or SSL_KEYSTORE_PWD=. Using these options means that you can omit the URI= option

Short Update: Impal: Bulk Loading from S3
Long Update: Support was added for bulk loading between Amazon S3 and Impala

Short Update: Microsoft SQL Server: Support for Microsoft Fabric Environments
Long Update: Support was added for Microsoft Fabric Data Warehouse and Microsoft Fabric Lakehouse with the Microsoft SQL Server LIBNAME engine and data connector

Short Update: Teradata: Support for Single Sign-On to Microsoft Azure
Long Update: Support has been added for single sign-on to Microsoft Azure. You can use single sign-on via a LIBNAME connection or with a CASLIB connection

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Bulk Loading with FedSQL and DS2 Languages
Long Update: Bulk loading with PROC FEDSQL and PROC DS2 now uses the COPY API rather than the PSQL utility. This change improves performance for bulk loading. Because PSQL is not used
Document Link: the BL_DELETE_DATAFILE= table option is no longer used

Short Update: Databricks: Parquet Support for BL_FORMAT=
Long Update: The BL_FORMAT= LIBNAME and data set options now support the Parquet format for bulk loading to Databricks

Short Update: Teradata: TPT= Usage
Long Update: Setting TPT=NO is no longer honored. SAS/ACCESS always uses the TPT API to transfer data

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Bulk Loading and Unloading Update
Long Update: Bulk loading and bulk unloading for PostgreSQL now use the COPY API rather than the PSQL utility. As a result
Document Link: these data set options are no longer used for bulk loading and unloading: BL_DATAFILE=
column10: the behavior of the BL_LOAD_METHOD= data set option has changed for PostgreSQL

Short Update: Teradata: now includes the required Teradata client by default
Long Update: Now includes the required Teradata client by default. Teradata Wallet is not included with this client package
Document Link: but it is supported if you install it in your environment

Short Update: Impala: now includes the Simba client by default for ODBC access
Long Update: Obtaining and installing the client driver is no longer required. However
Document Link: some changes to configuration files might be required

Short Update: SingleStore: Default Change for RESULTS=
Long Update: The default value for the RESULTS= LIBNAME option has changed from MEMORY to SERVER

Short Update: JDBC: Changes to the redistributed JDBC drivers for Hadoop & Spark
Long Update: SAS has changed the redistributed JDBC drivers for connecting to Hadoop and Spark. Customers who use the Hadoop or Spark data connectors or LIBNAME statements for in-database processing might be impacted. If you use CData properties in connections

Short Update: Oracle: Bulk Load Support in LIBNAME Statement
Long Update: You can now specify bulk-load options in a LIBNAME connection to Oracle. By using these options in a LIBNAME statement
Document Link: you do not need to remember to set these in separate DATA steps or procedure calls

Short Update: Hadoop: Critical Change for Hadoop: Updated JDBC Drivers
Long Update: SAS Viya platform now redistributes Simba JDBC drivers for connectivity to Databricks and Hadoop. The Simba drivers replace the JDBC drivers from CData. In existing programs that use the DRIVERCLASS=
Release: you must modify the values for these options to access the Simba JDBC driver. Similar changes are required for the corresponding data connector options driverClass=

Short Update: Spark: Critical Change for Hadoop: Updated JDBC Drivers
Long Update: SAS Viya platform now redistributes Simba JDBC drivers for connectivity to Databricks and Hadoop. The Simba drivers replace the JDBC drivers from CData. In existing programs that use the DRIVERCLASS=
Release: you must modify the values for these options to access the Simba JDBC driver. Similar changes are required for the corresponding data connector options driverClass=

Short Update: PC Files: Support for the SERVERAUTHDOMAIN= Option
Long Update: Support has been added for the SERVERAUTHDOMAIN= LIBNAME option for PC Files. Using this option avoids the need to store user ID and password values in your SAS programs

Short Update: Microsoft SQL Server: Support for the USE_SP_TABLES= Option
Long Update: Support was added for the USE_SP_TABLES= LIBNAME option. This option specifies whether to use the sp_tables stored procedure for Microsoft SQL Server when checking for table existence

Short Update: Parquet: USERS= Libname statement option
Long Update: USERS= LIBNAME Statement Option specifies users and their passwords that represent readers of the Parquet file

Short Update: Parquet: ADMINPASS= Libname statement option
Long Update: ADMINPASS= LIBNAME Statement Option specifies the administrator's password

Short Update: Google BigQuery: DBSLICE= Is No Longer Supported
Long Update: The DBSLICE= data set option is no longer supported for Google BigQuery. The Storage API partitions data more efficiently than user-supplied expressions. For this reason
Document Link: support has been removed for the DBSLICE= data set option

Short Update: Parquet: ADMIN= Libname statement option
Long Update: The ADMIN= Libname statment option is used to specify the administrator's name or id

Short Update: PostgreSQL: BULKLOAD= and BL_DELETE_DATAFILE= table options are now supported
Long Update: When appropriate SAS/ACCESS software is installed
Document Link: the BULKLOAD= and BL_DELETE_DATAFILE= table options are now supported for loading data to PostgreSQ. Via the BULKLOAD= table options in DS2 and FedSQL

Short Update: Snowflake: Support for QUALIFIER= Options
Long Update: Support was added for the QUALIFIER= LIBNAME and data set options. Use this option when you are referring to tables with a three-part name in the form qualifier.schema.table

Short Update: Snowflake: Additional Functions Are Passed
Long Update: The BAND and SOUNDEX functions are now passed to Snowflake for processing

Short Update: SAP HANA: Details About WHERE Clause Processing
Long Update: WHERE clauses with BINARY or VARBINARY data are now passed to SAP HANA for processing

Short Update: PostreSQL: Support for the BULKUNLOAD= Option
Long Update: Support for PostgreSQL has been added for the BULKUNLOAD= LIBNAME option. This option enables you to retrieve large amounts of data into SAS more quickly

Short Update: SingleStore: Buffer Increase for INSERTBUFF=
Long Update: The maximum buffer size has increased for the INSERTBUFF= LIBNAME option and data set option. This typically results in improved performance when you load data to your data source

Short Update: Snowflake: Bulk Loading by Using SAS FedSQL and SAS DS2 Languages
Long Update: Bulk loading is now automatically enabled for PROC FEDSQL and PROC DS2 when BULKLOAD=YES and related data source-specific authentication options are specified in the LIBNAME statement. Both bulk loading to Azure and to the Snowflake internal stage are supported. You can also enable bulk loading by using FedSQL table options. When set
Document Link: the table options override the LIBNAME options

Short Update: MySQL: Buffer Increase for INSERTBUFF=
Long Update: The maximum buffer size has increased for the INSERTBUFF= LIBNAME option and data set option. This typically results in improved performance when you load data to your data source

Short Update: Databricks: Support for TIMESTAMP_NTZ
Long Update: The TIMESTAMP_NTZ data type is now supported for Databricks

Short Update: Amazon Redshift: Bulk Loading Data via Pipeline Files
Long Update: You can use the USE_PIPELINE= LIBNAME option or data set option to facilitate bulk loading data via a pipeline file from the Compute server to Amazon Redshift

Short Update: Databricks: Bulk Unloading Support for BL_FORMAT_OPT=
Long Update: Support for the BL_FORMAT_OPT= LIBNAME option has been added for Spark when bulk unloading from Databricks

Short Update: Spark: Support for the DBFORCE= Data Set Option
Long Update: Support has been added for the DBFORCE= data set option for Spark. This option enables you to control truncation for Spark data sources

Short Update: SingleStore: Bulk-Loading Enhancements for PROC DS2 and PROC FEDSQL
Long Update: The BULKLOAD= LIBNAME option is now supported in the connection string for PROC DS2 and PROC FEDSQL. In addition
Document Link: the DS2 and FedSQL BULKLOAD= table options are now supported for SingleStore

Short Update: Databricks: Support for Bulk Unloading from Databricks to SAS Viya
Long Update: Support has been added for bulk unloading data from Databricks on Azure and from Databricks on AWS to SAS Viya

Short Update: SingleStore: When appropriate SAS/ACCESS software is installed
Long Update: the BULKLOAD= table option is now supported for loading data in the connecting string for Proc DS2 and Proc FEDSQL
Document Link: SingleStore: When appropriate SAS/ACCESS software is installed
Example Link: the BULKLOAD= table option is now supported for loading data

Short Update: MySQL: When appropriate SAS/ACCESS software is installed
Long Update: the BULKLOAD= table option is now supported for loading data in the connecting string for Proc DS2 and Proc FEDSQL
Document Link: MySQL: When appropriate SAS/ACCESS software is installed
Example Link: the BULKLOAD= table option is now supported for loading data

Short Update: Spark: Bulk Loading Support for BL_FORMAT=
Long Update: Support for the BL_FORMAT= LIBNAME option was added for bulk loading to Spark in HDFS

Short Update: Google BigQuery: List of Functions That Are Passed Down
Long Update: The list of functions that are passed down to Google BigQuery when SQL_FUNCTIONS=ALL has been updated

Short Update: Vertica: Update to TRACE= Default
Long Update: The TRACE= LIBNAME option no longer has a preset default value for Vertica. This change does not require updates to existing SAS programs

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support for Alias for AUTHDOMAIN=
Long Update: Support was added for the GCSDOMAIN= alias for AUTHDOMAIN=. You must use this alias if you use a CONNECT TO <data-source> statement in PROC SQL. Otherwise
Document Link: you can continue to use AUTHDOMAIN=
Example Link: including when you use a CONNECT USING statement in PROC SQL

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Loading NUMERIC Data
Long Update: NUMERIC values are now loaded into SAS as DOUBLE values by default. However
Document Link: to preserve more than 15 digits of precision
Example Link: NUMERIC data can still be converted to CHAR values. To do this
Release: set FETCH_NUMERIC_TYPE=NUMERIC and use the DBSASTYPE= data set option. This update requires a change to existing SAS programs

Short Update: Teradata: Default Update for TPT_PACKMAXIMUM=
Long Update: The default value for the TPT_PACKMAXIMUM= data set option has changed to YES. This change improves performance when you write to Teradata for multi-statement insert requests

Short Update: Parquet: STORAGE_CLIENT_SECRET specifies the secret key for Azure authentication
Long Update: The LIBNAME option STORAGE_CLIENT_SECRET specifies the secret key for Azure authentication

Short Update: Oracle: Support for Oracle Autonomous Database
Long Update: You can use a LIBNAME connection or a CASLIB connection to access Oracle Autonomous Database. You can use the same LIBNAME options
Example Link: or data connector options that you do to access any Oracle database

Short Update: Oracle: Default Update for INSERTBUFF=
Long Update: As a performance enhancement
Document Link: the default value for the INSERTBUFF= LIBNAME option is now 500

Short Update: Oracle: Support for Oracle Wallet
Long Update: You can now use Oracle Wallet to control authentication to an Oracle database. This is accomplished in a LIBNAME statement by using the PATH= option

Short Update: Spark: Support for Bulk Loading to Databricks on AWS
Long Update: Support has been added for bulk loading data to Databricks on Amazon Web Services

Short Update: Parquet: SAS Compute Server now supports reading and writing Parquet files from Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 (ADLS)
Long Update: SAS Compute Server now supports reading and writing Parquet files from Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 (ADLS). New options are required

Short Update: Microsoft SQL Server: Bulk Loading by Using SAS FedSQL and SAS DS2 Languages
Long Update: Bulk loading is available when accessing Microsoft SQL Server using SAS FedSQL language and SAS DS2 language programs. To enable bulk loading
Document Link: set the BULKLOAD= Table Option to YES

Short Update: JDBC: CData Drivers Are No Longer Supported
Long Update: The CData drivers for these social media platforms are no longer supported: Facebook

Short Update: Hadoop: Critical Change: Update to SAS_HADOOP_JAR_PATH
Long Update: Directories specified by the SAS_HADOOP_JAR_PATH environment variable
Document Link: which enables writing to HDFS with a Java API
Example Link: must be located within the parent path of /data-drivers/hadoop

Short Update: Amazon Redshift: When appropriate SAS/ACCESS software has been configured
Long Update: bulk load table options are available
Document Link: When appropriate SAS/ACCESS software has been configured
Example Link: bulk load table options are available for Amazon Redshift

Short Update: Snowflake: Support for BL_FOLDER= Options
Long Update: Support for Snowflake was added to the BL_FOLDER= LIBNAME and data set options. You can use these options when bulk loading to Azure ADLS locations

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Support for the PostGIS Extension
Long Update: PostgreSQL LIBNAME connections now support the PostGIS extension. This enables you to work with geometry and geographic data and call many PostGIS functions

Short Update: Oracle: Update to Behavior for BL_PARFILE=
Long Update: When you set BULKLOAD=YES
Document Link: the BL_PARFILE= option is now used by default. If you do not provide a file name for BL_PARFILE=
Example Link: then a file name is generated and bulk-loading option values are populated in the SQL*Loader parameter file

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support for Threaded Reads
Long Update: Support has been added for threaded Reads from Google BigQuery to the Compute server. To implement threaded Reads
Document Link: use the DBSLICEPARM= and DBSLICE= options

Short Update: R/3: Support for PROC CALLRFC
Long Update: Support for the CALLRFC procedure has been added for R/3

Short Update: Snowflake: Change to BL_NUM_DATAFILES= Option Default
Long Update: The default value for the BL_NUM_DATAFILES= LIBNAME and data set options has changed from 2 to a value that is based on your warehouse size. This improves performance with bulk loading to Snowflake

Short Update: ODBC: Update to the Lists of Functions That Are Passed Down
Long Update: The list of SAS functions that are passed to an ODBC data source has been updated. The list of functions that are passed when SQL_FUNCTIONS=ALL has also been updated. Several functions have been added to the lists

Short Update: Microsoft SQL Server: Default Update for INSERTBUFF=
Long Update: The default value for the INSERTBUFF= LIBNAME option is now calculated based on row size as long as INSERT_SQL=YES (the default)

Short Update: DB2: Change to Default Value for BL_METHOD= Option
Long Update: The default value for the BL_METHOD= data set option has changed from none to CLILOAD. Additional information about interactions that prevent the use of the CLILOAD value was also added

Short Update: SingleStore: Support for Named Pipes
Long Update: Support has been added for SingleStore for the BL_USE_PIPE= LIBNAME and data set options. These options enable you to use a named pipe for data transfer

Short Update: Oracle: Support for the invalidDate= Option
Long Update: Support was added for the invalidDate= data connector option. Use this option to specify how to handle invalid date values when you load data into the SAS Viya platform

Short Update: MongoDB: Improved Performance with Date Comparisons
Long Update: Information has been added to clarify how date values are handled with MongoDB

Short Update: Informix: Support for READBUFF= Options
Long Update: Support has been added for the READBUFF= LIBNAME and data set option. Use these options to control the number of rows for a single Read operation

Short Update: Impala: Additional Functions Are Passed Down
Long Update: Several functions are now passed down to the Impala data source: ATAN2

Short Update: MongoDB: Date and Time columns are supported for DS2 and FedSQL
Long Update: Definition of DATE and TIME columns is supported for MongoDB when appropriate SAS/ACCESS software is configured

Short Update: MySQL: Support for Named Pipes
Long Update: Support has been added for MySQL for the BL_USE_PIPE= LIBNAME and data set options. These options enable you to use a named pipe for data transfer

Short Update: SingleStore: DBSLICEPARM= Options
Long Update: Support for SingleStore has been added for the DBSLICEPARM= LIBNAME option

Short Update: Parquet: The SAS_CHAR_COLUMN_DEFAULT data set option specifies that all SAS character columns be written as logical type STRING
Long Update: Parquet: The SAS_CHAR_COLUMN_DEFAULT data set option specifies that all SAS character columns be written as logical type STRING

Short Update: Informix: Support for INSERTBUFF= Options
Long Update: Support has been added for the INSERTBUFF= LIBNAME option and data set option. Use these options to control the number of rows for a single Insert operation

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support for the GOMEMLIMIT= Environment Variable
Long Update: You can assign a value to the GOMEMLIMIT= environment variable to facilitate LIBNAME connections to Google BigQuery

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support for BIGNUMERIC Data
Long Update: Support has been added for the BIGNUMERIC data type in Google BigQuery

Short Update: Snowflake: Critical Change Default Update for AUTOCOMMIT=
Long Update: The default value for the AUTOCOMMIT= LIBNAME option is now YES for Snowflake. This might require you to change existing programs

Short Update: SingleStore: Update for DBMSTEMP= and CONNECTION= Options
Long Update: The DBMSTEMP= LIBNAME option now honors the CONNECTION= LIBNAME option setting. In addition

Short Update: SingleStore: Single Sign-On Support for Microsoft Azure
Long Update: Support was added for single sign-on (SSO) to Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure Active Directory) when you connect by using a LIBNAME statement

Short Update: MySQL: Documentation Enhancement for the CONNECTION= Option
Long Update: Documentation of supported values for MySQL for the CONNECTION= LIBNAME option has been clarified. A recommendation about an interacting option

Short Update: Hadoop: Bulk Loading to Cloudera Data Platform
Long Update: A new environment variable enables bulk loading to Cloudera Data Platform Private Cloud - Data Services

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support for Go Logging GO_ENABLE_LOGGING= option
Long Update: You can use the GO_ENABLE_LOGGING= LIBNAME option and related options to enable logging from your connection to a Google BigQuery data source

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support for Authentication Domains via the AUTHDOMAIN= option
Long Update: You can use the AUTHDOMAIN= LIBNAME option to authenticate to Google Cloud Platform by specifying an authentication domain. The authentication domain is managed by a credentials service

Short Update: Spark: Support for REPLACE=
Long Update: The REPLACE= data set option enables you to overwrite an existing Databricks Delta table with a new table of the same name

Short Update: Spark: Support for DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=
Long Update: Support has been added for the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES= LIBNAME option. Use this option to specify the maximum number of bytes per character when writing to a Spark data source

Short Update: SingleStore: DISK Value Is Deprecated for RESULTS=
Long Update: The DISK value for the RESULTS= LIBNAME option is now deprecated. A note is printed in the SAS log
Document Link: and the RESULTS= value is changed automatically
Example Link: depending on the value of the CONNECTION= LIBNAME statement option

Short Update: MySQL: DISK Value Is Deprecated for RESULTS=
Long Update: The DISK value for the RESULTS= LIBNAME option is now deprecated. A note is printed in the SAS log
Document Link: and the RESULTS= value is changed automatically
Example Link: depending on the value of the CONNECTION= LIBNAME statement option

Short Update: JDBC: Support for DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=
Long Update: Support has been added for the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES= LIBNAME option. Use this option to specify the maximum number of bytes per character when writing to a JDBC data source

Short Update: JDBC: Support for AUTHTYPE=
Long Update: Support has been added for the AUTHTYPE= LIBNAME option. Use this option to connect the Conpute Server with Microsoft OneDrive

Short Update: Informix: Support for the DBTYPE= Data Set Option
Long Update: Support has been added for the DBTYPE= data set option. Use this option to specify an alternative data type when writing to an Informix data source

Short Update: Hadoop: Support for DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=
Long Update: Support has been added for the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES= LIBNAME option. Use this option to specify the maximum number of bytes per character when writing to a Hadoop data source

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Specify a Project for Query Results
Long Update: You can use the LARGE_RESULTS_PROJECT= LIBNAME option to specify a project to use for query results. You can specify an alternative project

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Improved Bulk Load Performance
Long Update: Support has been added for the BL_WRITEBUFF= LIBNAME and data set options. You can use these options to improve performance when you bulk load data to PostgreSQL

Short Update: Amazon Redshift: Skip IDENTITY Columns
Long Update: Support has been added for the SKIP_IDENTITY_COL= LIBNAME option. Setting this option to YES enables you to skip over Read-only IDENTITY columns when you write to Amazon Redshift tables

Short Update: ODBC: Support for the SCANSTRINGCOLUMNS= Options
Long Update: Support has been added for the SCANSTRINGCOLUMNS= LIBNAME and data set options. Use these options to improve performance when loading large tables that contain large character data (such as VARCHAR and VARBINARY) from an ODBC data source.

Short Update: Microsoft SQL Server: Support for the SCANSTRINGCOLUMNS= Options
Long Update: Support has been added for the SCANSTRINGCOLUMNS= LIBNAME and data set options. Use these options to improve performance when loading large tables that contain large character data (VARCHAR
Example Link: and VARBINARY) from Microsoft SQL Server.

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support for JSON Data
Long Update: Support has been added for the JSON data type in Google BigQuery.

Short Update: Spark: Configuration Enhancement
Long Update: Options that you needed to specify in the hive-site.xml file previously can now be specified as LIBNAME and data connector options.

Short Update: SingleStore: Updates for Passing Joins
Long Update: The requirements for passing joins between multiple librefs have changed.

Short Update: SingleStore: Modifications to INSERTBUFF= Options
Long Update: The behavior of the INSERTBUFF= LIBNAME and data set options is modified. Now you can specify the number of rows for a single Insert operation to improve performance. Previously
Document Link: specifying any non-zero value caused the engine to automatically calculate the number of rows. The default behavior
Example Link: to automatically calculate the number of rows

Short Update: Parquet: The DBTYPE= data set option is now supported.
Long Update: The option specifies data types for columns when SAS creates a Parquet table. The supported data types are more extensive than the default SAS data types or the data types that you can create by assigning an informat.

Short Update: MongoDB: Alldata and Flat Files Are Not Created by Default
Long Update: The *_alldata and *_flat files are no longer created automatically when you create a scan of MongoDB data. You can specify to create Alldata
Example Link: or both types of file by using the REFRESH command with PROC FEDSQL.

Short Update: JDBC: Removed Support for Twitter CData Driver
Long Update: SAS no longer provides the CData JDBC driver for Twitter (now X). To access Twitter with SAS/ACCESS Interface to JDBC
Document Link: you must obtain and install a Twitter driver.

Short Update: Hadoop: URI= Option Is Not Required
Long Update: When you connect to Hive using Knox
Document Link: the URI= connection option is no longer required.

Short Update: Spark: Support for the DBMAX_TEXT_TYPES= Option
Long Update: Support has been added for the DBMAX_TEXT_TYPES= LIBNAME and data set options. Use these options to specify whether the DBMAX_TEXT= option applies to all character types or only to long character types.

Short Update: SAP HANA: Support for DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=
Long Update: Support has been added for the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES= LIBNAME Option.

Short Update: Parquet: The new data set option COLUMN_COMPRESS= was added.
Long Update: The new data set option COLUMN_COMPRESS= enables you to specify different compression types for the columns in a Parquet table.

Short Update: JDBC: Support for the DBMAX_TEXT_TYPES= Option
Long Update: Support has been added for the DBMAX_TEXT_TYPES= LIBNAME and data set options. Use these options to specify whether the DBMAX_TEXT= option applies to all character types or only to long character types.

Short Update: Informix: Support for Bulk Unloading Data
Long Update: Support has been added for bulk unloading data from Informix to the SAS Compute Server. This includes support for the BULKUNLOAD= LIBNAME option and related options.

Short Update: Greenplum: Support for Graphics with DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=
Long Update: Support for graphic data types has been added with the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTS= LIBNAME option.

Short Update: DB2: Support for Graphics with DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTES=
Long Update: Support for graphic data types has been added with the DBCLIENT_MAX_BYTS= LIBNAME option.

Short Update: Spark: Support for the INSERTBUFF= Options added
Long Update: Support has been added to the INSERTBUFF= LIBNAME and data set options. INSERTBUFF= is used only when BULKLOAD=NO.

Short Update: Spark: Support for Batch Updates added
Long Update: Support has been added for the BATCH_UPDATE= LIBNAME option. When the BULKLOAD= option is disabled
Document Link: batch updates are enabled automatically via the BATCH_UPDATE= option.

Short Update: Spark: Default CData JDBC Driver
Long Update: SAS redistributes the CData JDBC Driver for Spark SQL and the CData JDBC Driver for Databricks. To specify a connection to Databricks
Document Link: set PLATFORM=DATABRICKS in a Spark LIBNAME statement or a Spark CASLIB statement. When using the CData JDBC drivers for Spark SQL or Databricks
Example Link: the URL= option is no longer required. Instead
Release: you can specify option such as SERVER=

Short Update: Spark: Critical Change Class Path Options Are No Longer Supported
Long Update: CLASSPATH= LIBNAME option are no longer supported. The CData JDBC driver is now used for Spark and for Databricks. You can either use the CData JDBC drivers that are redistributed by SAS
Document Link: or your administrator can install third-party JDBC drivers in the known /data-drivers/jdbc location.

Short Update: Snowflake: Support for Bulk Loading and Bulk Unloading in Azure ADLS
Long Update: Support has been added for bulk loading and bulk unloading files that are stored in Azure ADLS storage locations.

Short Update: SingleStore: POST_COLUMN_OPTS= Data Set Option added
Long Update: The POST_COLUMN_OPTS= data set option is available. You can use this option to add database-specific options after the final column definition in the generated CREATE TABLE statement.

Short Update: MySQL: POST_COLUMN_OPTS= Data Set Option added
Long Update: The POST_COLUMN_OPTS= data set option is available. You can use this option to add database-specific options after the final column definition in the generated CREATE TABLE statement.

Short Update: JDBC: Critical Change Class Path Options Are No Longer Supported
Long Update: CLASSPATH= LIBNAME option are no longer supported. Instead of using these options
Document Link: it is required that third-party JDBC drivers be installed in the known /data-drivers/jdbc location
Example Link: or the drivers will not be found.

Short Update: JDBC: BATCH_UPDATE= Replaces BULKLOAD=
Long Update: Use the BATCH_UPDATE= LIBNAME option to enable batch updates for JDBC data sources. The BATCH_UPDATE= option is enabled by default and replaces the BULKLOAD= option for JDBC.

Short Update: Hadoop: Support for the INSERTBUFF= Options added
Long Update: Support has been added for the INSERTBUFF= LIBNAME option. The INSERTBUFF= options are used only when BULKLOAD=NO.

Short Update: Hadoop: Support for Hive Related Options added
Long Update: HIVE_PRINCIPAL= LIBNAME option
Document Link: which specify the principal name of the Hive server in an environment that uses Kerberos

Short Update: Hadoop: Support for Batch Updates added
Long Update: Support has been added for the BATCH_UPDATE= LIBNAME option. When the BULKLOAD= option is disabled
Document Link: batch updates are enabled automatically via the BATCH_UPDATE= option.

Short Update: Hadoop: Support for Additional Connection Options added
Long Update: Support has been added for several connection options: ALLOW_SELF_SIGNED_CERTS= (SSL related)

Short Update: Hadoop: Deprecating HDFS Options
Long Update: HDFS_DATADIR= and HDFS_METADIR= connection options are deprecated.

Short Update: Hadoop: Default CData JDBC Driver
Long Update: The CData JDBC driver for Apache Hive that is redistributed in the SAS Viya platform is now the default driver for the Hadoop engine and the Hadoop data connector. It is no longer necessary to use the URL= connection option or url= data connector option in order to use this driver or the Cloudera Hive JDBC Connector. Instead
Document Link: you can specify options such as SERVER=

Short Update: Hadoop: Critical Change Class Path Options Are No Longer Supported
Long Update: The CLASSPATH= LIBNAME option are no longer supported. You can instead either use the CData JDBC drivers that are redistributed by SAS
Document Link: or your administrator can install third-party JDBC drivers in the known /data-drivers/jdbc location.

Short Update: Teradata: Documentation Enhancement - Joining Teradata Tables from Multiple LIBNAME Connections
Long Update: The documentation has been updated to state that joins for tables that you access via different LIBNAME connections must match on the DATABASE= option as well as other options.

Short Update: Spark: TLS Encryption with Databricks
Long Update: Support has been added for the USE_SSL= LIBNAME. Use these options to enable TLS encryption in your connection to Databricks.

Short Update: Spark: SASDATEFMT= Data Set Option
Long Update: Support has been added for the SASDATEFMT= data set option. Use this option when reading or writing date values to convert them to an alternate date or time format.

Short Update: Spark: PLATFORM= and HTTPPATH= Connection Options
Long Update: Support has been added for the PLATFORM= and HTTPPATH= connection options for a Spark LIBNAME connection. The PLATFORM= option specifies the target platform (Spark or Databricks) and assigns the appropriate CData driver as the default driver. This option also constructs an appropriate JDBC URL connection string from SAS connection options. It is no longer necessary to use the URL= option when you connect to Spark or Databricks.

Short Update: Spark: Databricks Support for SSO to Microsoft Azure AD
Long Update: Support was added for single sign-on (SSO) to Azure AD when using the CData JDBC driver for Databricks that is redistributed with the SAS Viya platform. SSO is supported for a Spark LIBNAME connection. SSO to Azure AD must be configured for the SAS Viya platform.

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Support for New Environment Variables
Long Update: Support was added for the SAS_PG_USEDECLAREFETCH and SAS_PG_FETCHSIZE environment variables. Specify values for these variables when you work with large amounts of data.

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Critical Change for PostgreSQL: Single Sign-On Support for the Flexible Server
Long Update: Single sign-on for PostgreSQL now connects to the Microsoft Azure Flexible server by default. If you are connecting to the Single server instead
Document Link: you now need to specify the USER= value in your LIBNAME statement in the format that is required for the Single server.

Short Update: JDBC: SASDATEFMT= Data Set Option
Long Update: Support has been added for the SASDATEFMT= data set option. Use this option when reading or writing date values to convert them to an alternate date or time format.

Short Update: Informix: Support for Bulk Loading Data
Long Update: Support has been added for bulk loading data to Informix via option BULKLOAD=YES

Short Update: Hadoop: SASDATEFMT= Data Set Option
Long Update: Support has been added for the SASDATEFMT= data set option. Use this option when reading or writing date values to convert them to an alternate date or time format.

Short Update: Hadoop: Critical Change for Hadoop: TEMP_CTAS= Default Has Changed
Long Update: The default value of the TEMP_CTAS= LIBNAME option is now NO. This change might require you to update existing SAS programs.

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support for the IGNORE_FEDSQL_OBJECTS= Options
Long Update: You can specify that you want to ignore FedSQL objects when you query a Google BigQuery. This can improve performance when you check the contents of a library.

Short Update: Snowflake: Support for the blNumReadThreads= Option.
Long Update: Support was added for the QUERY_TAG= LIBNAME and data set options. Use these options to add an optional tag to Snowflake queries.

Short Update: Snowflake: Support for the BL_NUM_READ_THREADS= Option.
Long Update: Support was added for the BL_NUM_READ_THREADS= LIBNAME option. Use this option to specify multiple threads when bulk unloading data from Snowflake to the SAS Compute Server.

Short Update: SingleStore: Description of the RESULTS= Option updated.
Long Update: The description of the behavior of the values for the RESULTS= LIBNAME option has been updated.

Short Update: MySQL: Description of the RESULTS= Option updated.
Long Update: The description of the behavior of the values for the RESULTS= LIBNAME option has been updated.

Short Update: Spark: Single Sign-On Authentication to Databricks
Long Update: The Spark LIBNAME connection supports single sign-on authentication to Databricks in Microsoft Azure. Authentication is managed with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

Short Update: Spark: READBUFF= Enhancement for the SAS/ACCESS Interface to Spark.
Long Update: The maximum READBUFF= value for Spark SQL connections made using SAS/ACCESS Interface to Spark has been increased to 100
Document Link: 000. The default READBUFF= value for Databricks connections is now 100

Short Update: Snowflake: BL_NUM_DATAFILES= LIBNAME Option
Long Update: Support was added for the BL_NUM_DATAFILES= LIBNAME option for the SAS/ACCESS Interface to Snowflake

Short Update: SingleStore: DATABASE= Is Required.
Long Update: The DATABASE= connection option is now required when you connect to SingleStore by using a LIBNAME statement.

Short Update: JDBC: READBUFF= Enhancement for the SAS/ACCESS Interface to JDBC.
Long Update: JDBC: READBUFF= Enhancement for the SAS/ACCESS Interface to JDBC.

Short Update: Hadoop: READBUFF= Enhancement for the SAS/ACCESS Interface to Hadoop.
Long Update: The maximum READBUFF= value for Hadoop has been increased to 100
Document Link: 000 for the SAS/ACCESS Interface to Hadoop.

Short Update: Hadoop: BL_FORMAT= Update for the SAS/ACCESS Interface to Hadoop.
Long Update: A limitation has been documented for the BL_FORMAT=ORC option for the SAS/ACCESS Interface to Hadoop. Note	When specifying BL_FORMAT=ORC
Document Link: TIMESTAMP fractional seconds are limited to three digits.

Short Update: SAP IQ: Explanation for Load CHAR Values added.
Long Update: Information was added to explain how to load CHAR values as either CHAR or VARCHAR values.

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Explanation of Bulk Loading Date and Time Values added.
Long Update: Information was added to describe how to bulk load date and time values from CAS to PostgreSQL.

Short Update: MODE= data set option has been added for Google BigQuery.
Long Update: Support has been added for the MODE= data set option for Google BigQuery. Use this data set option to enable multiple performance-related options.

Short Update: Informix: Connect With or Without Specifying the Data Source Name
Long Update: Support has been added for the CONOPTS=
column8: and DSN= LIBNAME options. You can connect to Informix by specifying the DSN= option or by specifying the other options.

Short Update: Hadoop: Configuration for Bulk Loading to ADLS Gen2.
Long Update: Information was added about configuring Hadoop to enable bulk loading to ADLS Gen2 for Azure HDInsight.

Short Update: Enhancment to Filename
Long Update: The WEBHDFSURL= option is now available
Document Link: when you use the WEBHDFSURL= option
Example Link: you are not required to run the Hadoop tracer script to copy the Hadoop JAR and configuration files to the SAS client machine

Short Update: Enhancment to Proc: HADOOP
Long Update: The WEBHDFSURL= option is now available
Document Link: when you use the WEBHDFSURL= option
Example Link: you are not required to run the Hadoop tracer script to copy the Hadoop JAR and configuration files to the SAS client machine

Short Update: Change to Proc: HADOOP
Long Update: MAPREDUCE and PIG statements are considered deprecated
Document Link: The MAPREDUCE and PIG statements are considered deprecated. These statements continue to work
Example Link: but support for them is likely to be removed in future updates. It is recommended that you use Spark or Hive functionality as an alternative

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc S3: The ACL= option was added for the COPY
Long Update: MKDIR
Release: Use this option to specify a canned ACL value that applies to newly created objects

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc S3: The REGION= option was added to the REGION ADD statement
Long Update: The REGION= option was added to the REGION ADD statement

Short Update: Parquet with Data Step: USER= data set option
Long Update: The USER= data set option specifies a user's name or ID

Short Update: Parquet with Data Step: PWD= data set option
Long Update: The PWD= data set option specifies the user's password

Short Update: Parquet with Data Step: ACL data set option
Long Update: The ACL data set option creates an Access Control List

Short Update: New formats for SAS National Language Suppoprt are available
Long Update: The new formats help with monetary format of the international accounting expression and monetary format of the international accounting expression for many locals

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: XSL
Long Update: supports SAS LOCKDOWN restrictions

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc: S3
Long Update: For the COPY
column8: support was added for the ACL= option
column13: support was added for the ACL= option. This option enables you to set a canned ACL value for objects that are created in Amazon S3

Short Update: Enhancement to Filename: Support has been added for the ACL= option for the S3 FILENAME statement
Long Update: Support has been added for the ACL= option for the S3 FILENAME statement. This option enables you to set a canned ACL value for files that are created in Amazon S3

Short Update: The RESTRICTFROM system option prevents users from using the FROM= parameter in the FILENAME EMAIL statement
Long Update: The RESTRICTFROM system option prevents users from using the FROM= parameter in the FILENAME EMAIL statement

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc S3: List of supported REGIONs has been updated
Long Update: The list of supported regions for the REGION= option has been updated

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc IMPORT: VARNAMEROW statement
Long Update: The VARNAMEROW statement specifies a row from the delimited text file that contains the variable names

Short Update: Parquet: Enhancement to Proc CONTENTS output
Long Update: For tables that are created by the Parquet engine
Document Link: the CONTENTS procedure output has been enhanced. If any columns in the table are compressed
Example Link: PROC CONTENTS displays the value COLUMNAR in the COMPRESSED field

Short Update: New Data Step function: HASH_FAST_HEX
Long Update: The HASH_FAST_HEX function returns a message digest as a 16-byte hexadecimal string for a key value and a message consisting of one or more character strings or numbers

Short Update: New Data Step function: HASH_XX_HEX Function
Long Update: The HASH_XX_HEX function returns a message digest as a 16-byte hexadecimal string for a key value and a message consisting of one or more character strings or numbers

Short Update: New Function GIT_REF_LIST
Long Update: GIT_REF_LIST returns the list of reference objects that are associated with the local repository

Short Update: New Function GIT_REF_GET
Long Update: GIT_REF_GET returns the specified attribute of a reference object in the local repository

Short Update: New Function GIT_REF_FREE
Long Update: GIT_REF_FREE clears the reference objects that are associated with the local repository

Short Update: PDF Security option PDFSECURITY now uses 256-bit AES encryption instead of 128-bit.
Long Update: The PDFSECURITY=HIGH option uses a 256-bit AES encryption algorithm. In addition
Example Link: you must use Adobe Acrobat 9 or later or Adobe Reader 9 or later to open the document.

Short Update: Proc Python: New method logMessage added
Long Update: Proc Python: the new method logMessage enables you to easily write native message to the SAS log

Short Update: Region statement has been added to the Proc S3.
Long Update: The region statement in Proc S3 enables you to add
Document Link: list or remove a custom AWS region to interact with

Short Update: Encryptall has been added as an option for the Source= data set option in a data step data statement.
Long Update: ENCRYPTALL encrypts and saves the source code
Example Link: that created a stored compiled DATA step program or a DATA step view.

Short Update: Toggle SAS code comment by line
Long Update: Toggle SAS code comment by line

Short Update: Be able to ignore region from format
Long Update: Be able to ignore region from format

Long Update: Set default CSV save location to workspace root for remote workspace

Long Update: Add sas file system support for ITC-based (IOM/COM) connections

Long Update: Add Traditional Chinese and Polish translations

Long Update: Ability to export SAS Notebook to HTML file

Long Update: Python language features inside proc python

Long Update: Display macro name in outline pane

Long Update: Added username and password support for SSH connection type

Long Update: Added support for SAS server for viya connections

Long Update: Export sas notebook to sas file

Long Update: Clear log on execution start (with new setting SAS.log.clearOnExecutionStart)

Long Update: New documentation site

Long Update: Add data viewer support for IOM/COM connections

Long Update: Added better error reporting for COM/IOM connections

Long Update: Open context menu and select Format Document to auto format the SAS code

Short Update: Improve function autocomplete
Long Update: Provide functions autocomplete similar to other keywords from syntax data

Short Update: Additional Options for showing log output panel

Long Update: Support recursive folding block

Long Update: Support function signature help

Long Update: Japanese translation

Short Update: Added the ability to upload and download sas content using the context menu
Long Update: Added the ability to upload and download sas content using the context menu

Long Update: Added the ability to download results as an html file

Long Update: Added sas 9.4 remote connection support via ITC and the IOM Bridge protocol

Long Update: Added ods graphics on to the wrapper code

Long Update: Added Close Session button on the tooltip of the active profile status bar item

Long Update: Run SAS code via VS Code tasks

Short Update: Refined SAS code auto-indentation
Long Update: Refined SAS code auto-indentation

Long Update: Option to control the default placement of Result panel

Long Update: Convert .sasnb to .flw

Long Update: Assign _SASPROGRAMFILE macro-variable to full path and filename of submitted SAS program

Long Update: Option to specify ODS style

Short Update: German language support added
Long Update: German language support added

Short Update: Show session startup log
Long Update: Show session startup log

Short Update: Changed Data viewer to use AG Grid instead of VSCode data grid.
Long Update: Changed Data viewer to use AG Grid instead of VSCode data grid. Our data viewer now support infinite paging for large tables

Short Update: Autoexec support for Viya connection
Long Update: Autoexec support for Viya connection

Short Update: Auto-completion follows user's typing case
Long Update: Auto-completion follows user's typing case

Short Update: Added the ability to download tables from the libraries view
Long Update: Added the ability to download tables from the libraries view

Short Update: Ability to specify SAS system options for session startup
Long Update: Ability to specify SAS system options for session startup

Short Update: Support SAS Notebook has been added.
Long Update: Support SAS Notebook has been added.

Short Update: Support SAS 9 Local via COM has been added.
Long Update: Support SAS 9 Local via COM has been added.

Short Update: Support Drag & Drop for SAS content has been added.
Long Update: Support Drag & Drop for SAS content has been added.

Short Update: Support Canceling running job has been added.
Long Update: Support Canceling running job has been added.

Short Update: Support Add to My Favorites and Remove from My Favorites action has been added.
Long Update: Support Add to My Favorites and Remove from My Favorites action has been added.

Short Update: Several enhancements: CA certificates
Long Update: Run Region
Example Link: Allow user to provide trusted CA certificates. Support Run Region. Infinite scrolling for data table. Updated folder icons.

Short Update: SAS VS Code Extension: Added SAS content navigator and Added support for SAS libraries.
Long Update: You are now able to browse
column8: and run files on a SAS server using a Viya connection and You are now able to see libraries and tables from a SAS instance. You are also able to delete
column10: and drag tables into your sas programs.

Short Update: Amazon Redshift: Data Connector Support for SSO
Long Update: You can use single sign-on (SSO) to authenticate to Amazon Redshift via the Amazon Redshift data connector. Use the Amazon Redshift data connector to define a connection between your data source and CAS

Short Update: Clarification about Partitioning Data with CAS
Long Update: Details have been added about how data is partitioned with DECIMAL or NUMERIC data types in CAS

Short Update: Hive: Hadoop Data Connector
Long Update: Connect to Hive Servers That Use Kerberos
Document Link: Several data connector options are available that enable you to connect to a Hive server in an environment that uses Kerberos. These options are used with the Simba JDBC driver that SAS redistributes. Prior to this release
Example Link: these new options were supported only in the string value that you provide for the uri= option. Now
Release: you can specify the values as the data connector options krbAuthType=

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Bulk Loading and Unloading Update
Long Update: Bulk loading and bulk unloading between PostgreSQL and CAS now use the COPY API rather than the PSQL utility. As a result
Document Link: these data connector options are no longer used for bulk loading and unloading: blDelDatFile=

Short Update: MySQL: Append to MySQL Tables
Long Update: Support has been added for the append= data connector option. This option enables you to append data to an existing MySQL table

Short Update: Oracle: Append to Oracle Tables
Long Update: Support has been added for the append= data connector option. This option enables you to append data to an existing Oracle table

Short Update: SingleStore: Append to SingleStore Tables
Long Update: Support has been added for the append= data connector option. This option enables you to append data to an existing SingleStore table

Short Update: PostgreSQL: Rules for Appending Data Have Been Updated
Long Update: The rules about appending data to tables in PostgreSQL by using the append= data connector option have been updated

Short Update: SAP IQ: Load Data via a Pipe File

column9: such as writing data to an exception table
column10: when there is no match in a lookup table for data in the source table

Short Update: Enhancement to Step: Query Step explicit pass-through for SingleStore and Snowflake
Long Update: If you are creating a query in a flow
Document Link: you can now use explicit pass-through for queries that contain only SingleStore or only Snowflake tables

Short Update: New Step: Transform Data Step
Long Update: The Transform Data step enables you to transform one or more variables in the input data set. These transformed variables are saved to an output data set

Short Update: Enhancement to the Custom Step Designer: Option Table Control
Long Update: Use the option table control to create a repeatable group of controls that is displayed in the user interface as a table

Short Update: New Step: Explore Data Step
Long Update: The Explore Data step provides graphs that can be used to explore the relationships among selected variables

Short Update: New Step: Specifying Which Row in a File Contains Column Names
Long Update: A new option for File nodes enables you to specify which row in a file is the header row. This option does not apply to Microsoft Excel files

Short Update: Running a Portion of a Program in a Flow
Long Update: You can select a block of code to run in a SAS or Python program in a flow

Short Update: New step: Imputation
Long Update: The Imputation step replaces missing values in a data source with an estimate of the missing value

Short Update: Copying the Full Path of a File or Folder to the Clipboard
Long Update: You can now copy the full path of a file or folder to the clipboard from the Explorer pane

Short Update: New Step: Standardize Data in Prepare Data
Long Update: The Standardize Data step enables you to center or standardize one or more numeric variables by using a variety of methods

Short Update: New Step: Verify with Loqate in Enriching Data
Long Update: The Verify with Loqate step enables you to verify addresses
Example Link: and phone numbers that use the Loqate Verify API. This step replaces three previous steps: Verify & Geocode Addresses - Loqate

Short Update: Enhancement to the Custom Step Designer: Column Selector Control
Long Update: When creating a custom step
Document Link: you can specify whether the values for the column selector control come from an input table or from another column selector control

Short Update: Step Enhancement: Load Table Step with SingleStore data
Long Update: If both the source and target tables are located in a SingleStore database
Document Link: you can now use native SQL code for the Upsert rows technique. This option can improve performance

Short Update: New Step: Series Map
Long Update: The Series Map step creates a map overlaid with a series plot. The Series Map step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Binning
Long Update: The Binning step divides the data values of a continuous variable into intervals. The values for each interval are replaced with a single value that is representative of the interval. The Binning step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: Custom Step Designer: Indenting Options and Sections in Custom Steps
Long Update: When authoring a custom step
Document Link: you can use the Indent option (which is available for all controls and sections) to specify whether to indent an option
Release: or section in the user interface. Using indention enables you to visually show a hierarchy of sections
column9: and text. It also enables to you to group options under a section heading

Short Update: Critical Change Warning: Converting SAS Tasks to SAS Custom Steps
Long Update: The task functionality will reach end-of-life in the 2024.12 stable release and in the LTS 2025.03 release. SAS recommends users convert any existing tasks to custom steps as soon as possible. Starting with the 2024.07 stable release and the LTS 2024.09 release of SAS Studio
Document Link: the Tasks pane will not be available from the SAS Studio workspace by default. To access the Tasks pane

Short Update: Updated Step: Stack Columns Step by default
Long Update: no case identifier is created by the step
Example Link: no case identifier is created by the step. You must specify whether to create a case identifier variable
Release: or you can select identifier variables from the input table. The Stack Columns step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: The Text Map step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer
Long Update: The Text Map step creates a map that is overlaid with a text scatter plot. The Text Map step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: The Scatter Map step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer
Long Update: The Scatter Map step creates a map that is overlaid with a scatter plot. The Scatter Map step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: The Bubble Map step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer
Long Update: The Bubble Map step creates a map that is overlaid with a bubble plot. The Bubble Map step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: Licensing Change: Match Codes Step
Long Update: The Match Codes step has been updated and is no longer available in SAS Studio Analyst. The Match Codes step is now available only in SAS Studio Engineer. If you added a Match Codes step to a flow when using SAS Studio Analyst
Document Link: you must remove the deprecated step from the flow. Then you can use SAS Studio Engineer to add the Match Codes step back to the flow

Short Update: Adding Subflows to a Flow
Long Update: You can now add subflows to your flow from a SAS server location

Short Update: SCD Step Enhancement: SingleStore Support for Generating Surrogate Keys
Long Update: If you are using SingleStore data
Document Link: you can now use a surrogate key that is generated elsewhere
Example Link: or you can generate the surrogate key in SAS Studio

Short Update: SCD Step Enhancement: SingleStore Optional Flagging Method
Long Update: The flagging method
Document Link: which is used to identify the current row
Example Link: is now optional if you are using SingleStore data

Short Update: New Step: Series Plot Step
Long Update: The Series Plot step creates plots that display a series of line segments that connect observations of input data. The Series Plot step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Remove Duplicates Step
Long Update: You can now specify whether to write duplicate rows to the log or save duplicate rows to a table. The Remove Duplicates step is available in SAS Studio Basic
Document Link: SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Register Python Model Step
Long Update: Using this step
Document Link: you can register into SAS Model Manager your Python models that have been trained in SAS Studio. Then you can use the functionality in SAS Model Manager to manage and govern your trained models.This step is available only for classification models with a binary target.The Register Python Model step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Permutations Step
Long Update: The Permutations step computes the possible permutations of a given number of objects. The Permutations step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Parse Data Step
Long Update: The Parse Data step performs Parsing and Extraction by using the QKB locale. The Parse Data step is available in SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Dice Roll Simulation Step
Long Update: The Dice Roll Simulation step simulates rolling a specified number of dice. The results show the frequency and percentage of each possible roll given a specified number of throws. The Dice Roll Simulation step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Combinations Step
Long Update: The Combinations step computes the possible combinations of the total number of objects into sets with a specified number in each set. The Combinations step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Clean Data Step
Long Update: The Clean Data step performs Standardization
column8: and Pattern Analysis by using the QKB locale. The Clean Data step is available in SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: New Step: Choropleth Map Step
Long Update: The Choropleth Map step creates a map of polygonal areas. The Choropleth Map step is available in SAS Studio Analyst and SAS Studio Engineer

Short Update: Custom Step Designer: Link Control
Long Update: Use the Link control to add hyperlinks to your custom steps. For security reasons
Document Link: this feature must be enabled by your SAS administrator in SAS Environment Manager

Short Update: Step Enhancement: Manga Columns Step now support Column Creation and Propeties Changes
Long Update: You can now create a column in the output table when you run the Manage Columns step. You can also update the name
column9: and informat of a column in the output table

Short Update: Step Enhancement: Manga Columns Step now can create a view as output
Long Update: You now have the option to create a data view instead of a physical table from the output port of a Manage Columns node

Short Update: New Step: Pie Chart Step
Long Update: The Pie Chart step creates pie charts that represent the relative contribution of the parts to the whole by displaying data as wedge-shaped slices of a circle

Short Update: New Step: Histogram Step
Long Update: The Histogram step creates a chart that displays the frequency distribution of a numeric variable

Short Update: New Step: Heat Map Step
Long Update: The Heat Map step displays the magnitude of the response based on two variables

Short Update: New Step: Bubble Plot Step
Long Update: The Bubble Plot step explores the relationship between three or more variables

Short Update: Important Change: System Options in SAS Studio
Long Update: SAS Studio automatically sets several system options before each code submission. The list of system options on the SAS Viya 4 platform is different from the list in SAS 9.4 and SAS Viya 3.5

Short Update: Library for Temporary Output Files in Flows
Long Update: You can use the new Default output library for intermediate tables option to change the default library for temporary output files in all flows or for a single flow.

Short Update: Describe Missing Data step added
Long Update: The Describe Missing Data step displays the frequencies and percentages of missing values for each selected variable. If two or more variables are assigned to this step
Document Link: the step displays the pattern of missing data across variables.

Short Update: Correlation Analysis step added
Long Update: Correlation is a statistical procedure for describing the relationship between numeric variables. The relationship is described by calculating correlation coefficients for the variables. The correlations range from -1 to 1. The Correlation Analysis step provides graphs and statistics for investigating associations among variables.

Short Update: Characterize Data step added
Long Update: The Characterize Data step creates a summary report of tables and graphs that describe the variables in the input data set. This step can also create frequency and univariate output tables that describe the main characteristics of the data.

Short Update: Split Columns Step added
Long Update: The Split Columns step creates an output table by splitting the unique combination of values of the selected columns in the input table into multiple columns. You can use the output table to individually analyze the columns that contain multiple rows of the input table.

Short Update: List Table Attributes Step added
Long Update: The List Table Attributes step enables you to quickly see the date on which the table was created and last modified
column8: and an alphabetical list of the variables and their attributes. You can also view any directory and host or engine information by using this step.

Short Update: List Data Step added
Long Update: The List Data step displays the contents of a table as a report.

Short Update: Custom Step Designer: Enablement Property for Custom Steps
Long Update: The custom step author can use the enabled property to create a dependency between two controls. When the dependency condition is true
Document Link: the dependent option is enabled in the user interface
Example Link: and the user of the step can specify a value. When the dependency condition is false
Release: the dependent option is visible in the user interface but disabled.

Short Update: Select Random Sample Step added
