Long Update: The Select Random Sample step creates an output table that contains a random sample of the rows in the input table. You might use this task when you need a subset of the data.

Short Update: Line Chart Step added
Long Update: The Line Chart step shows the mathematical relationships between variables by revealing trends or patterns of data points.

Short Update: Distribution Analysis Step added
Long Update: The Distribution Analysis step provides information about the distribution of numeric variables. A variety of plots such as histograms
Example Link: and quantile-quantile plots can be used in this analysis.

Short Update: Custom Step Designer: Allow only integers in number control
Long Update: As a step author
Document Link: you can now specify whether the value for a number field control must be an integer.

Short Update: Choose insert method for Load Table Step
Long Update: You can now select whether to use PROC APPEND or the PROC SQL INSERT statement to insert data into the target table. If the target table is a SAS table type
Document Link: such as a Base SAS or SPD Server table
Example Link: the PROC APPEND option can improve performance.

Short Update: Box Plot Step added
Long Update: The Box Plot step represents numeric values measured as intervals. The box plot is a bi-directional plot. It uses Category and Analysis as role names
Document Link: and the corresponding axes are called Category Axis and Analysis Axis.

Short Update: Table Analysis Step added
Long Update: The Table Analysis step provides one-way to n-way frequency and contingency (crosstabulation) tables. This step also generates statistics about the association between rows and columns.

Short Update: Summary Statistics Step added
Long Update: The Summary Statistics step provides descriptive statistics for variables across all observations and within groups of observations.

Short Update: Scatter Plot Step added
Long Update: The Scatter Plot step creates plots that show the relationships between two or three variables by revealing patterns or concentrations of data points.

Short Update: Match Codes Step added
Long Update: Use the Match Codes step to create match codes that can be used as a basis for standardization or transformation. Using the Match Codes step
Document Link: you can create a match code for a column that is based on a locale and a rule definition.

Short Update: New Step: Mask Data Step for SAS Studio Analyst and Engineer
Long Update: Use the Mask Data step to perform data masking by using three different obfuscation methods: masking

Short Update: You can now create step prompts by using JSON code in job definitions.
Long Update: You can now create step prompts by using JSON code in job definitions. You can run these prompts in SAS Visual Analytics.

Short Update: Union Rows step added.
Long Update: The Union Rows step enables you to combine data from multiple sources into a single target table. You can subset the source data and choose from multiple set operators to determine how to combine the data sources.

Short Update: Creating a Data View from the Output Port of the Query Step
Long Update: You now have the option to create a data view instead of a physical table from the output port of a Query node. You can create a data view only when the query uses PROC SQL to generate the results.

Short Update: Bar-Line Chart Step added.
Long Update: The Bar-Line Chart step creates a vertical bar chart with a line chart overlay.

Short Update: Bar Chart Step added.
Long Update: The Bar Chart step creates horizontal or vertical bar charts that compare numeric values or statistics between different values of a chart variable. Bar charts show the relative magnitude of data by displaying bars of varying height. Each bar represents a category of data.

Short Update: Connect a SAS IOM Client to SAS Analytics Pro (Experimental)
Long Update: The container image is updated to allow external connections from SAS IOM clients
Document Link: such as SAS Enterprise Guide and SAS Extension for Visual Studio Code

Short Update: Documentation to support batch processing is included
Long Update: Documentation to support batch processing is included

Short Update: New Version of Python
Long Update: Python 3.9.13 is included in the SAS Analytics Pro container image to support the use of the PYTHON procedure (PROC PYTHON)

Short Update: SingleStore: The BY statement is now supported for SingleStore
Long Update: SingleStore: The BY statement is now supported for SingleStore

Short Update: The product SAS with SingleStore has been renamed SAS SpeedyStore
Long Update: The product SAS with SingleStore has been renamed SAS SpeedyStore. The data connector has been renamed. There are no changes in usage

Short Update: SingleStore: You can now write the output table to a different database than the input table
Long Update: In-database DATA step processing
Example Link: supports a new feature. You can now write the output table to a different database than the input table

Short Update: SingleStore: The data connector now supports streaming views without creating a snapshot copy of the view result set
Long Update: The default for the createViewSnapshot= data connector option has changed from 'onLoad' to 'never'

Short Update: SingleStore: Data Step Processing in SingleStore
Long Update: the SAS DATA step can export some code to be processed in the SingleStore database

Short Update: New Attribute for Source Windows
Long Update: The optional queue-height attribute enables you to set the size of the input queue. Previously
Document Link: the queue size was 32 event blocks and could not be changed. The default value of the queue-height attribute is 32 event blocks

Short Update: Event Sorter Custom Window
Long Update: The Event Sorter custom window has been added to SAS Event Stream Processing Studio Custom Windows GitHub. This custom window enables you to sort incoming events by a time field that defines when the events were created
Document Link: as opposed to when they are available to the event stream

Short Update: Ability to Group Incoming Events in Object Tracker Windows
Long Update: In Object Tracker windows
Document Link: you can use the new group-by attribute of the input element to group incoming events. This attribute is useful when a single Object Tracker window is receiving events from multiple cameras

Short Update: New Parameter for File and Socket Connector to Exclude Binary Large Objects
Long Update: The optional excludecsvblobs parameter of the file and socket subscriber connector enables you to exclude binary large objects (blobs) from the output to enhance the readability of a CSV file

Short Update: Enhancement to the JSON Function in Functional Windows and Notification Windows
Long Update: The JSON function that you can use in Functional windows and Notification windows now implements most of the syntax of the JSONPath query language. Previously
Document Link: indexing and filtering functionality could not be used
Example Link: but now this functionality is available

Short Update: Critical Change: How to Build Field Names for Apache Avro Messages
Long Update: How you build field names for Apache Avro messages has changed since SAS Event Stream Processing 6.2.3. Now
Document Link: you must concatenate the nested values of keys from the Avro schema. The keys should be extracted from either AVRO_RECORD field name keys or AVRO_MAP keys

Short Update: Confluent Cloud Connector Added
Long Update: Confluent Cloud is a fully managed
Document Link: cloud-native streaming data service based on Apache Kafka. SAS Event Stream Processing now provides for early adopters a Confluent Cloud connector that communicates with a Confluent Cloud Cluster for publish and subscribe operations

Short Update: Apacha Avro: Critical Change How to Build Field Names for Apache Avro Messages
Long Update: How you build field names for Apache Avro messages has changed since SAS Event Stream Processing 6.2.3. Now
Document Link: you must concatenate the nested values of keys from the Avro schema. The keys should be extracted from either AVRO_RECORD field name keys or AVRO_MAP keys. AVRO_MAP keys cannot be referenced when the AVRO_MAP is nested within an AVRO_ARRAY. AVRO_RECORD field name keys cannot be referenced when the AVRO_RECORD is nested within an AVRO_MAP

Short Update: Viewing Image and Video Files in Project Packages
Long Update: You can now use the Project Package pane to view image and video files. Selected image and video file formats are supported

Short Update: Quick Way to Create a Source Window with a Connector and an Output Schema
Long Update: You can now create a Source window and a file and socket publisher connector by dragging a file from the Project Package pane to the workspace. When the file is a CSV file
Document Link: the Source window's output schema is populated too

Short Update: File-Based Versioning
Long Update: When file-based versioning is used
Document Link: project versions are stored in a Git repository that is internal to SAS Event Stream Processing and can be synchronized with an external Git repository

Short Update: Enhancement to Monitoring Capabilities
Long Update: You can now deploy SAS Event Stream Processing Monitoring for Kubernetes when standalone SAS Event Stream Processing is deployed

Short Update: Each project package now includes a README.md file
Long Update: When you view these files
Document Link: the Markdown code is rendered as HTML. You can edit the Markdown code

Short Update: Creating Files within Project Packages
Long Update: You can now create certain types of files in the Project Package pane. Examples include CSV
column9: you needed to create your file outside of SAS Event Stream Processing Studio and upload it to the project package

Short Update: Renaming Files in a Project Package
Long Update: You can now rename certain files in a project package. Renaming a file updates all references to that file in the project's XML code

Short Update: Quick Way to Import Schema Fields
Long Update: When you configure a window's output schema
Document Link: for some windows a new button enables you to quickly import all schema fields from the parent window
Example Link: without using the Output Schema window

Short Update: Each New Project Contains a Source Window
Long Update: When you create a project
Document Link: a Source window is automatically added to the workspace. The Source window's output schema contains a key field

Short Update: New NATS.io Connector and Adapter
Long Update: NATS.io is an open-source
Document Link: high-performance messaging system for distributed systems. The NATS.io connector and adapter support publish and subscribe operations against a JetStream-enabled NATS.io server

Short Update: Updated Database Drivers
Long Update: The versions of ODBC drivers for the databases that are supported by the Database connector and adapter have been updated

Short Update: UVC Connector and Adapter No Longer Supported as of April 2024
Long Update: Beginning with the 2024.04 stable release
Document Link: the UVC connector and publisher adapter will no longer be supported. Users are encouraged to migrate to the Video Capture publisher connector and adapter.

Short Update: Integration with Grafana
Long Update: The SAS Event Stream Processing Data Source Plug-in for Grafana enables you to discover and stream data from ESP servers

Short Update: Filter Window Supports Python Programming
Long Update: The Filter window can now use a Python function to determine whether an output event is generated from the input event

Short Update: New Python Connector
Long Update: A new Python connector uses Python programs to process almost any type of input data or to generate the data within the code

Short Update: New Parameters for Video Capture Publisher Connector and Adapter
Long Update: The Video Capture Publisher Connector and Adapter now provides parameters to set values in the AVOption data structure. FFmpeg uses this data structure to set parameters that control audio-video codecs

Short Update: Changes to the Video Capture Connector and Adapter
Long Update: The Video Capture connector and adapter now uses third-party libraries from FFmpeg to read and decode input.

Short Update: User-Defined Properties in File-Based Versioning
Long Update: When you use file-based versioning to create configurations
Document Link: you can now adjust the values of user-defined properties. In the previous release
Example Link: the only adjustment that you could make in a configuration was to activate or deactivate connectors.

Short Update: Installing Examples Directly from SAS Event Stream Processing Studio
Long Update: Some examples can now be installed directly from SAS Event Stream Processing Studio as project packages that are ready for you to run in test mode. As a result
Document Link: you do not need to configure connectors to point to input files.

Short Update: Enhancement to Encrypting Passwords in Connectors and Adapters
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Studio now provides a graphical user interface for encrypting passwords in connectors and adapters.

Short Update: Support for TLS in StateDB Windows When Redis Is the External Data Store
Long Update: You can use Transport Layer Security (TLS) to secure the connection between a Redis data store and SAS Event Stream Processing.

Short Update: Several Connectors and Adapters No Longer Supported
Long Update: Fourteen connectors and adapters are no longer supported. Remove them from your projects. Event Stream Processor

Short Update: New Utility to Encrypt Passwords in Connectors and Adapters
Long Update: The Database connector and adapter permit you to encrypt the password for the associated DSN connection string. Several other connectors and adapters permit you to encrypt a password for session authentication. There is a new utility to generate the encrypted versions of these passwords.

Short Update: New String Functions
Long Update: New string functions are available for the Functional window and the Lua window. The argument to these functions can accommodate multibyte data.

Short Update: Access to Relational Databases from Lua Components
Long Update: You now can access relational databases from Lua components through ODBC drivers.

Short Update: Updated Library for Kafka Connector and Adapter.
Long Update: The Kafka connector and adapter now use librdkafka v2.1.1. Unlike the previously supported version
Document Link: this version of the library validates host names in certificates

Short Update: New Video Capture Connector and Adapter
Long Update: The Video Capture connector and adapter read an input video stream and publish each extracted image frame into a Source window as a unique event that contains a binary blob field. The connector and adapter use third-party libraries from OpenCV and GStreamer to read and decode the input stream.

Short Update: New Rate Parameter for Kafka Publisher Connector and Adapter.
Long Update: The Kafka publisher connector and adapter now enable you to specify the requested transmit rate in events per second.

Short Update: Additional Data Types Supported by the OPC-UA Publisher Connector and Adapter.
Long Update: The OPC-UA publisher connector and adapter now support the following data types: BOOLEAN

Short Update: New Parameter for Source Window to Control Event Flow.
Long Update: The shed-input parameter can now be used to force the Source window to process only the latest available event block and avoid queueing.

Short Update: Improvements to the OPC-UA Connector and Adapter.
Long Update: The OPC-UA publisher connector and adapter now provide additional mappings to OPC-UA data types. Also
Document Link: the new publishinterval parameter enables control of when events are published.

Short Update: Deprecation Warning for 2023.09 Stable Release: Several Connectors and Adapters No Longer Supported as of September 2023
Long Update: eginning with the 2023.09 stable release
Document Link: 14 connectors and adapters are no longer supported: OPC-DA

Short Update: Change to Expiration of Secondary Indexes of StateDB Writer Windows.
Long Update: Because Redis does not provide out-of-box support for secondary indexes
Document Link: you must use the StateDB Writer window to implement one. With this release
Example Link: secondary indexes expire when the latest event added to the secondary index expires from Redis.

Short Update: When you use Lua functions on Lua properties
Long Update: you now must enclose arguments in braces ({ }).
Document Link: When you use Lua functions on Lua properties
Example Link: you now must enclose arguments in braces ({ }) . The braces indicate that you are passing a Lua table to the function. You must consider this requirement when you migrate Lua code from previous releases of SAS Event Stream Processing.

Short Update: Publisher support for AVRO_BYTES to ESP_DOUBLE type has been added.
Long Update: Publisher support for AVRO_BYTES (logical decimal type only) to ESP_DOUBLE type has been added. Also
Document Link: the AVRO_ARRAY type is processed differently from previous releases.

Short Update: Notification Window Enables Transport Layer Security
Long Update: You can now select Transport Layer Security (TLS) to specify security information for a Notification window in SAS Event Stream Processing Studio.

Short Update: New Attributes for Lua Windows
Long Update: The Lua window now includes the following attributes: destroy

Short Update: Enhanced install instructions for installing saspy from other package managers and enhanced conda instructions
Long Update: Enhanced install instructions for installing saspy from other package managers and enhanced conda instructions

Short Update: New parameter for submit methods to reset the language service
Long Update: New parameter for submit methods to reset the language service

Short Update: New method on the SASdata object called attrs which returns a 1 row dataframe with each of the attributes returned by the ATTRN and ATTRC functions
Long Update: New method on the SASdata object called attrs which returns a 1 row dataframe with each of the attributes returned by the ATTRN and ATTRC functions. Mostly they are character or numeric
Document Link: but the create/modified are returned as timestamps. This provides an easy programmatic way to access any of these values

Short Update: A timestamp has been added of when the SAS Session was started
Long Update: A timestamp has been added of when the SAS Session was started

Short Update: New method sasdata2parquet (sd2pq)
Long Update: which is like sasdata2dataframe
Document Link: but for data too big to fit in a Pandas DataFrame (not enough memory)
column8: but for data too big to fit in a Pandas DataFrame (not enough memory)

Short Update: Support for SAS dates/datetimes outside of the range of Pandas Timestamps. The values are converted to NaT
Long Update: Support for SAS dates/datetimes outside of the range of Pandas Timestamps. The values are converted to NaT

Short Update: Support for Customization of a SAS Quality Knowledge Base
Long Update: The SAS Quality Knowledge Base (QKB) is a collection of files that store data and logic that define data management operations such as parsing
Example Link: and matching. You can now use environment variables to configure SAS Micro Analytic Service to use a specific QKB

Short Update: redisCli DS2 Package Added
Long Update: The RedisCli package provides a DS2 interface to Redis servers. It enables DS2 code to set data in a Redis server and get data from a Redis server.

Short Update: Support for Connecting to a Redis Server
Long Update: SAS Micro Analytic Service can now access data on a Redis server.

Short Update: Critical Change: Width for VARCHAR Formats
Long Update: Starting in 2025.02
Document Link: in DATA step processing for the CAS LIBNAME engine
Example Link: the width of VARCHAR formats is measured in characters rather than in bytes

Short Update: CAS session option enhancement: TRANSFERSESSION
Long Update: The TRANSFERSESSION= session option specifies whether a session is transferred to the new server when a CAS server state transfer occurs

Short Update: New set option: STDJSON
Long Update: enables you to enforce conformity with the JSON standard
Document Link: The new STDJSON option in the CASL SET statement enables you to control whether the CASL2JSON and JSON2CASL functions conform to the JSON standard

Short Update: New option for job expiration
Long Update: New option for job expiration

Short Update: Added support for job_name_prefix
Long Update: Added support for job_name_prefix: an optional parameter used to identify the compute server session in SAS Workload Orchestrator

Short Update: Added support for http_timeout
Long Update: Added support for http_timeout: an optional parameter used set the timeout for https request

Short Update: New timedOut state added
Long Update: New timedOut state added

Short Update: The SAS Log will now be streamed back to the DAG-log while the task is running
Long Update: instead of being retrieved after the code have been executed
Document Link: The SAS Log will now be streamed back to the DAG-log while the task is running
Example Link: instead of being retrieved after the code have been executed

Short Update: Enhancements to the SAS Studio Operator
Long Update: The SAS Log will now be streamed back to the DAG-log while the task is running
Document Link: instead of being retrieved after the code have been executed

Short Update: SASStudioOperator: reuse a compute session or run in parallel
Long Update: SASStudioOperator: reuse a compute session or run in parallel

Short Update: TLS is enabled by default
Long Update: TLS is enabled by default

Short Update: Operator has been added to delete a SAS Compute Session
Long Update: Operator has been added to delete a SAS Compute Session

Short Update: Ability to login using client credentials
Long Update: You can run jobs using client credentials

Short Update: Allow passing airflow vars as macro variables to SAS Job Execution Operator
Long Update: Allow passing airflow vars as macro variables to SAS Job Execution Operator

Short Update: Added CHANGELOG.md to track changes overtime
Long Update: Added CHANGELOG.md to track changes overtime

Short Update: New Operator added to create SAS Compute Session
Long Update: New Operator added to create SAS Compute Session - SASComputeCreateSession

Short Update: Critical Change: Deprecate SASStudioFlowOperator which is superseded SASStudioOperator
Long Update: Critical Change: Deprecate SASStudioFlowOperator which is superseded SASStudioOperator. The original will still function
Document Link: but any new functionality is added to SASStudioOperator

Short Update: Ability to pass in code to execute
Long Update: Ability to pass in code to execute

Short Update: Ability to pass in a session for SASStudioFlowOperator and SASJobExecutionOperator.
Long Update: Ability to pass in a session for SASStudioFlowOperator and SASJobExecutionOperator.

Short Update: Ability to pass and receive macro variables as input/output
Long Update: Ability to pass and receive macro variables as input/output via xcom.

Short Update: Ability to execute programs as well as Flows
Long Update: Ability to execute programs as well as Flows

Short Update: Added support for the SAS Job Execution Operator to capture logs.
Long Update: Added support for the SAS Job Execution Operator to capture logs.

Short Update: Specify the DS2_OPTIONS Statement in Code Files
Long Update: You can specify DS2 options in DS2 code files by adding the DS2_OPTIONS statement before the PACKAGE statement

Short Update: DATAGRID_TABLESELECT Function
Long Update: You can use the DATAGRID_TABLESELECT function to create a new data grid that is a subset of another data grid. You can use WHERE conditions and column specifications to control which rows and columns are included in the subset data grid

Short Update: Import Data from Within SAS Intelligent Decisioning
Long Update: The Import data option in SAS Intelligent Decisioning is available from two additional category views: the Decisions and Code files category views

Short Update: Data Grid Function Enhancements for joining data grids.
Long Update: You can specify multiple key columns when you use a data grid function to join two data grids or to query two data grids to find the number of matching rows. This applies to: DATAGRID_FULLJOIN Function

Short Update: You Can Migrate SAS Data Studio Plan Files Into SAS Studio
Long Update: When you generate code in SAS Data Studio
Document Link: a SAS Studio flow (.flw) file is automatically created and saved in the same folder as your SAS Data Studio plan file. The plan file is displayed as code in a code node within the flow. You can open the code node and run the code by clicking Run. You can also edit the code node and use discrete nodes

Short Update: SAS Data Studio
Long Update: Prepare Data
Release: access to SAS Data Studio in SAS Viya 4 is not enabled by default. SAS administrators can enable SAS Data Studio by using SAS Environment Manager

Short Update: Google BigQuery: NUMERIC and BIGNUMERIC data types are handled as DOUBLEs by default
Long Update: The Google BigQuery NUMERIC and BIGNUMERIC data types are supported for reading by DS2 when appropriate SAS/ACCESS software is installed. Starting in 2024.09
Document Link: in order to improve read performance
Example Link: these data types are handled as DOUBLEs by default. The FETCH_NUMERIC_TYPE= table option is provided to revert to the former NUMERIC handling

Short Update: New function: PRXPAREN is now available
Long Update: Returns the last bracket match for which there is a match in a pattern

Short Update: You can define constructors for array package variables with the DECLARE PACKAGE statement.
Long Update: Creates a package variable and optionally creates a package instance.

Short Update: Two new built-in functions: GETTHREADERRORSTATUS and SETTHREADERRORSTATUS
Long Update: Two new built-in functions
Example Link: enable you to perform row-level checking for run-time errors by querying a new internal error status variable.

Short Update: DS2 now supports array package variables for accessing the attributes and invoking the methods of a package from outside the package.
Long Update: DS2 now supports array package variables for accessing the attributes and invoking the methods of a package from outside the package. Array package variables enable you to reference multiple instances of a package using one variable.

Short Update: Enhancement to OF Operator type variable lists are supported with the OF operator.
Long Update: Type variable lists are supported with the OF operator
Document Link: the OF variable-array[*] syntax now supports variable arrays that have a type variable list specification.

Short Update: Enhancement to OF Operator more flexibel Syntax
Long Update: The OF operator can be specified once in the argument list. There is no longer a need to precede each variable array or variable list in the argument list with an OF operator
Document Link: although this syntax is still supported.

Short Update: Two new automatic variables _LOCALNTHREADS_  & _LOCALTHREADID_ for additional thread processing information
Long Update: There are two new automatic variables for getting information about thread processing. _LOCALNTHREADS_ and _LOCALTHREADID_ return information about the local node in a multi-node processing environment.

Short Update: New Function VSETMISSING to set variables to missing
Long Update: A new DS2 built-in function
Example Link: enables you to set variables to SAS missing or ANSI null using a prefix.

Short Update: DECIMAL and NUMERIC Support in Type Variable Lists
Long Update: DECIMAL and NUMERIC types are now supported for variable selection in DS2 type variable lists.

Short Update: The READMODE= table option is provided to improve performance when reading tables in Google BigQuery.
Long Update: The READMODE= table option is provided to improve performance when reading tables in Google BigQuery. You must have SAS/ACCESS Interface to Google BigQuery configured in order to access BigQuery tables.

Short Update: Two new functions for the varlist data structure in DS2(VSETVALUE & VGETVALUE)
Long Update: The VSETVALUE function enables you to set data values for the elements of a varlist. The VGETVALUE function enables you to obtain the data values of varlist elements. The data values obtained by VGETVALUE are of a built-in data type rather than a varlist type. Thus
Document Link: the obtained value can be used with any expression that supports the built-in data type.

Short Update: Google BigQuery: NUMERIC and BIGNUMERIC data types are handled as DOUBLEs by default
Long Update: The Google BigQuery NUMERIC and BIGNUMERIC data types are supported for reading by FedSQL when appropriate SAS/ACCESS software is installed. Starting in 2024.09
Document Link: in order to improve read performance
Example Link: these data types are handled as DOUBLEs by default. The FETCH_NUMERIC_TYPE= table option is provided to revert to the former NUMERIC handling

Short Update: The READMODE= table option is provided to improve performance when reading tables in Google BigQuery.
Long Update: The READMODE= table option is provided to improve performance when reading tables in Google BigQuery. You must have SAS/ACCESS Interface to Google BigQuery configured in order to access BigQuery tables.

Short Update: SAS UUIDGEN function can now be used in FedSQL
Long Update: The function UUIDGEN returns the Returns the short or binary form of a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) as a character type.

Short Update: Support for Access to a Snowflake Database
Long Update: SAS Container Runtime supports connections to a Snowflake database for a SAS Intelligent Decisioning decision. This means that you can publish a decision that contains database queries that are intended for a Snowflake database to SAS Container Runtime

Short Update: New Editing Capabilities for Source Tables
Long Update: When you are viewing the source table for a data source
Document Link: you can now edit the table. You can perform actions such as applying filters
column8: and adding and deleting rows. You can save your changes if you have Write permissions for the location

Short Update: New SAS Studio Asset Types
Long Update: SAS Lineage diagrams can now display SAS Studio step columns

Short Update: Clear Search Feature
Long Update: You can click the Clear Search icon in the Search field to clear your query in the Search for Subjects window

Short Update: Performance and Stability Updates.
Long Update: SAS Lineage was updated to enhance performance and stability.

Short Update: New View Setting Controls for level control and node size
Long Update: You can increase or increase the number of levels displayed in a lineage diagram with the Expand level control. You can select between small
Example Link: and large-sized nodes with the Node size selector.

Short Update: SAS Enterprise Guide 8.4 now supports SAS Viya 4
Long Update: SAS Enterprise Guide 8.4 now supports SAS Viya 4

Short Update: New Snippet: Survivorship
Long Update: The Survivorship snippet uses the DQSUVR macro to identify a surviving record from a group of records in a cluster. The output also shows different methods to compose and indicate the surviving record

Short Update: New Snippet: RTENG Clustering
Long Update: The RTENG Clustering snippet uses the DQCLRTNG macro to cluster data based on fuzzy matching. The macro uses the RTENG action set to perform exact matching and clustering. The output table contains the input columns and a cluster ID column that contains the cluster number

Short Update: New Snippet: OPTNET Clustering
Long Update: The OPTNET Clustering snippet uses the DQCLNET macro to cluster matching records based on the specified match rules. Multiple match rules represent OR matching conditions. Multiple columns within a match rule represent AND matching conditions

Short Update: New Snippet: Match Action Clustering
Long Update: The Match Action Clustering snippet uses the Entity Resolution action set (entityres.match) to cluster data based on fuzzy matching. The output table contains the input columns and a cluster ID column that contains the cluster number

Short Update: New DQOPTNET autocall macro that provides a common framework to perform clustering
Long Update: New DQOPTNET autocall macro that provides a common framework to perform clustering

Short Update: New DQCLRTNG Autocall Macro that matches and clusters data.
Long Update: New DQCLRTNG Autocall Macro that matches and clusters data.

Short Update: Enhanced the DQMATCH function to better explain what type of matches applied to the locales.
Long Update: Enhanced the DQMATCH function to better explain what type of matches applied to the locales.

Short Update: New DQEXTPAR Autocall Macro that can extract and parse data.
Long Update: New DQEXTPAR Autocall Macro that can extract and parse data.

Short Update: New DQCLEAN Autocall Macro that cleans data
Long Update: New DQCLEAN Autocall Macro that cleans data using the Standardize

Short Update: %DQSURVR AUTOCALL Autocall Macro added for Entity Resolution Survivorship
Long Update: Performs Entity Resolution Survivorship as an autocall macro and extracts the surviving record from clustered data based on user-specified criteria.

Short Update: Updated Look and Feel
Long Update: SAS Data Explorer has been updated to be easier to navigate and more efficient to use

Short Update: Improved Connectivity to Sources
Long Update: The interface for connecting to sources has been updated. New windows have been provided to simplify the tasks of selecting sources to connect with

Short Update: The WRITETO subroutine creates a CAS table from data in a matrix or a table.
Long Update: The WRITETO subroutine creates a CAS table from data in a matrix or a table.

Short Update: The READTABLEFROM function creates a SAS IML table from a CAS table.
Long Update: The READTABLEFROM function creates a SAS IML table from a CAS table.

Short Update: The READMATRIXFROM function creates a matrix from the numeric variables or character variables in a CAS table.
Long Update: The READMATRIXFROM function creates a matrix from the numeric variables or character variables in a CAS table.

Short Update: The READFROM function creates a matrix from variables in a CAS table.
Long Update: The READFROM function creates a matrix from variables in a CAS table.

Short Update: Python SWAT: Add CASTable.rename() to rename the columns of a table
Long Update: Add CASTable.rename() to rename the columns of a table

Short Update: DEFAULTTABLEREPLICATION= specifies the default replication factor for new tables for a session.
Long Update: DEFAULTTABLEREPLICATION= specifies the default replication factor for new tables for a session. 0 means no replication

Short Update: DATASTEPVARLENCHK= specifies whether a warning
Long Update: error or no message is generated when truncation occurs during a DATA step append.
Document Link: DATASTEPVARLENCHK= specifies whether a warning message is generated
Release: or no message is generated when truncation occurs during a DATA step append.

Short Update: Revised Transformers for SAS Workload Orchestrator
Long Update: The sas-workload-orchestrator-statefulset-resources.yaml and sas-workload-orchestrator-daemonset-resources.yaml transformer files have been revised for SAS Workload Orchestrator. With the updated transformer files
Document Link: you can provide both upper and lower limits for the memory and CPU use for statefulset and daemonset pods

Short Update: Critical Change to OpenShift Support
Long Update: With 2025.08 and later
Document Link: you can use Red Hat OCP or OKE 4.17.x - 4.19.x

Short Update: The sas-data-mining-models pod was merged into the sas-data-mining-project-resources pod
Long Update: The sas-data-mining-models pod was merged into the sas-data-mining-project-resources pod. Pod changes might affect the software update process and the tuning and configuration of pods

Short Update: Critical Change: Ingress Requirements
Long Update: For your cluster ingress
Example Link: this version of ingress-nginx was not supported

Short Update: Critical Change: Ingress Requirements
Long Update: At this time
Document Link: ingress-nginx 1.13.x is not supported. SAS intends to add support for this version of ingress-nginx and to update the documentation in a future release

Short Update: Critical Change: Ingress Requirements
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now requires ingress-nginx 1.9.6 or later. This change to the minimum supported version of ingress-nginx was made in order to ensure compatibility with Kubernetes 1.29.x - 1.31.x

Short Update: SAS Health Offering Renamed and Enhanced
Long Update: The SAS Health Episode Builder offering has been renamed to SAS Health Cost of Care Analytics. SAS Health Cost of Care Analytics now includes a user interface. You can point and click in order to construct episodes and create analysis jobs

Short Update: SAS Governance and Compliance Manager Offerings Now Available
Long Update: New Risk offerings
Document Link: SAS Governance and Compliance Manager and SAS Governance and Compliance Manager Advanced
Example Link: are now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform. SAS Governance and Compliance Manager enables your organization to respond promptly to regulatory requirements and internal initiatives in an ever-changing regulatory landscape

Short Update: DuckDB: New SAS/ACCESS engine is now included with the SAS Viya platform
Long Update: All the standard data types supported by SAS Viya platform applications are supported. DuckDB 1.2.0 and later are supported

Short Update: SAS Governance and Compliance Manager Now Available
Long Update: A new Risk solution
Example Link: is now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform. SAS Governance and Compliance Manager enables your organization to respond promptly to regulatory requirements and internal initiatives in an ever-changing regulatory landscape

Short Update: Critical Change: Pod Changes
Long Update: The sas-feature-flags pod was merged into the sas-configuration pod. Also
Document Link: the sas-redis-operator pod was removed. Pod changes might affect the software update process and the tuning and configuration of pods

Short Update: Critical Change: Pod Changes
Long Update: sas-business-rules & sas-reference-data => sas-decisions-framework; sas-config-reconciler => sas-configuration

Short Update: Critical Change: Pod Changes
Long Update: The sas-links pod was merged into an existing pod named sas-visual-analytics-app. Pod changes might affect the software update process and the tuning and configuration of pods

Short Update: Critical Change: Pod Changes
Long Update: The following pods have been merged: sas-forecasting-data-definitions

Short Update: Security Context Constraint for sas-model-publish
Long Update: If you plan to use BuildKit to publish models to containers with SAS Model Manager or SAS Intelligent Decisioning
Release: and default service accounts to the sas-model-publish SCC

Short Update: New Configuration File for Redis
Long Update: Redis now has a transformer file that allows you to modify the PersistentVolumeClaim size or the StorageClass for nodes. The transformer file can be applied during the initial deployment of your SAS Viya platform software or after the software has been deployed. For details
Document Link: see the README file located at $deploy/sas-bases/examples/redis/server/README.md (for Markdown format) or at $deploy/sas-bases/docs/configuration_settings_for_redis.htm (for HTML format)

Short Update: The sas-model-management and sas-model-repository pods were merged into a new pod named sas-model-manager
Long Update: The sas-model-management and sas-model-repository pods were merged into a new pod named sas-model-manager. Pod changes might affect the software update process and the tuning and configuration of pods

Short Update: Change to OpenShift Requirements
Long Update: SAS Viya platform deployments on Red Hat OpenShift are no longer required to use the cert-utils-operator to manage certificate content in Route resources. The cert-utils-operator is still recommended for these deployments. For information about an alternative
Document Link: see the Example kustomization.yaml Files for the OpenShift Ingress Controller Without the Use of the cert-utils-operator section of the README file located at $deploy/sas-bases/examples/security/README.md (for Markdown format) or at $deploy/sas-bases/docs/configure_network_security_and_encryption_using_sas_security_certificate_framework.htm (for HTML format)

Short Update: SAS Clinical Acceleration Repository Adds Platform Support
Long Update: SAS Clinical Acceleration Repository can now be deployed in Amazon Web Services
Document Link: with Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service. Previously
Example Link: it was only deployed in Microsoft Azure

Short Update: SAS Mirror Manager Enhancements
Long Update: SAS container image signatures are now available for Google Artifact Registry after Google added support for version 1.1 of the OCI distribution specification. The SAS Mirror Manager documentation has been enhanced with the addition of a procedure describing the steps to set up a mirror registry in Harbor

Short Update: Authentication: New SAML Option
Long Update: A new option for SAML authentication is now available: entityIDAlias. When you configure sas.logon.saml.sp for SAML authentication
Document Link: you can now specify an alias that the entity ID can use in SAML URLs
Example Link: such as the AssertionConsumerService URL. The SAML service provider metadata and SAML authentication request include the alias as part of SAML URLs

Short Update: Configure OpenSearch for a Memory-Backed Temporary Directory
Long Update: By default
Document Link: OpenSearch creates its temporary directory within /tmp using an emptyDir volume mount. However
Example Link: some hardened installations mount /tmp on emptyDir volumes with the noexec option
Release: preventing JNA and libffi from functioning correctly. This can cause startup failures with exceptions like java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkerError or messages indicating issues with mapping segments or allocating closures. In order to allow JNA loading without relaxing file system restrictions
column8: OpenSearch can be configured to use a memory-backed temporary directory

Short Update: New Transformers for SAS Servers on OpenShift Using Kerberos
Long Update: SAS has introduced new transformers for SAS Servers running on Red Hat OpenShift that use Kerberos

Short Update: Enhancements and Documentation to Minimize Downtime during Updates
Long Update: SAS continues to enhance rolling updates for the SAS Viya platform to minimize downtime and improve system resilience. In 2025.03
Document Link: several improvements have been introduced to ensure a smoother update experience: Improved Stability for Compute Workloads & Recommendations for Minimizing CAS Workload Disruptions

Short Update: Change to SAS Configurator for Open Source Support Default Python Profile
Long Update: SAS Configurator for Open Source is dropping three Python packages that were previously managed by default. The default Python profile
Document Link: which determines the version of Python and the packages that are downloaded and managed
Example Link: is removing the following packages: hnswlib==0.7.0

Short Update: Changes to SMTP Server Requirements
Long Update: In Google Cloud environments only
Document Link: an (optional) SMTP server is not supported starting in 2025.03. The SAS Viya platform mail service supports only Basic Authentication at this time. Third-party email providers are gradually deprecating Basic Authentication and enforcing OAuth 2.0 for enhanced security on mail servers

Short Update: Critical Change: Changes to Kubernetes Requirements
Long Update: Support for Kubernetes 1.31.x has been added for all supported providers with the exception of Red Hat OpenShift. Kubernetes 1.28.x is no longer supported. SAS Viya platform 2025.02 supports Kubernetes 1.29.x - 1.31.x.

Short Update: Critical Change: Changes to Kubernetes Requirements
Long Update: Support for Kubernetes 1.30.x has been added for all supported providers with the exception of Red Hat OpenShift. Kubernetes 1.27.x is no longer supported. SAS Viya platform 2024.09 supports Kubernetes 1.28.x - 1.30.x.

Short Update: Critical Change: Calico CNI Support
Long Update: Deployments in upstream open-source Kubernetes clusters now require Calico 3.27.x and later. This change to the minimum supported version of Calico ensures compatibility with Kubernetes 1.29.x - 1.31.x

Short Update: Merging Pods: The sas-business-rules and sas-reference-data pods have been merged into a single pod
Long Update: sas-business-rules & sas-reference-data result in sas-decisions-framework

Short Update: Enhancements to Support for Open-Source Languages
Long Update: Starting in 2025.02
Document Link: the SAS Viya platform includes enhancements to the SAS multi-language architecture. With these enhancements
Example Link: you can harness the power of SAS analytics directly from Python by means of the new sasviya.ml Python package. SAS Configurator for Open Source now offers an option to include the required Python packages that enable users to take advantage of these new capabilities. The SAS Viya Platform: Integration with External Languages guide has been updated to describe these options.

Short Update: Critical Changes to SAS Risk Solutions
Long Update: The deployment process for SAS Risk solutions has significant enhancements in 2025.02 that affect both requirements and configuration. SAS Risk solutions consume the SAS Risk Cirrus Core component. Previously
Document Link: the Risk Cirrus Core component used transformers to manage configuration. Now generators are used instead.

Short Update: Changes to PostgreSQL Support (External PostgreSQL Only)
Long Update: SAS Viya platform support for PostgreSQL 16 for external PostgreSQL servers was added in 2024.12. SAS offerings in the Retail and Consumer Goods category have added support for PostgreSQL 16 in 2025.02

Short Update: CAS Server Enhancement
Long Update: The CAS server has been enhanced with a new management feature for MPP CAS deployments that include an optional graphics processing unit (GPU). To take advantage of additional capabilities that are provided by a GPU
Document Link: CAS workers require scheduling to GPU-enabled nodes in the CAS node pool.

Short Update: Critical Change: Pod Changes
Long Update: reduced number of Pods
column9: sas-redis-server-2-0 and sas-redis-server-2-1 have been combined into sas-redis-server-0 and sas-redis-server-1

Short Update: Critical Change: Pod Changes
Long Update: reduced number of Pods
Example Link: sas-redis-server-1 and sas-redis-server-2 have been combined into sas-redis-server

Short Update: Critical Change: Ingress Controller Required Configuration
Long Update: If you are using ingress-nginx 1.12.x and later for your Kubernetes cluster
Document Link: you must change the default configuration of the ingress controller in order to mitigate breaking changes from NGINX

Short Update: Critical Change: Ingress Controller Required Configuration
Long Update: If you are using ingress-nginx 1.12.x and later for your Kubernetes cluster
Document Link: you must change the default configuration of the ingress controller in order to mitigate breaking changes from NGINX.

Short Update: SAS Redis Server Dependency on SAS Redis Operator Is Removed
Long Update: SAS Redis Server is no longer managed by SAS Redis Operator. Events that were handled by the operator will now be performed by the SAS Redis server pods

Short Update: Model Repository Service Deployment Configuration
Long Update: Starting in 2024.12
Document Link: service accounts are created for some SAS services by default. Previously
Example Link: as part of the deployment configuration for the Model Repository service
Release: an overlay was used to create these service accounts. This overlay enabled the service to run with additional permissions in a Red Hat OpenShift environment. The following two transformers in the overlay are no longer needed: sa.yaml and sas-transformer.yaml

Short Update: Critical Change: Time-to-Live Value for Kubernetes Jobs
Long Update: Starting with 2024.12
Document Link: all SAS Viya platform Kubernetes jobs have a default time-to-live (TTL) value of 0. This change was made in order to improve the update experience. The requirement to manually delete certain jobs no longer applies to most deployments

Short Update: Critical Change: OpenShift Support
Long Update: For OpenShift clusters
Document Link: support for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) 4.17.x has been added. OCP 4.17 corresponds to Kubernetes 1.30. With 2024.12
Example Link: you can use Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) 4.15.x - 4.17.x in one of the supported environments

Short Update: SAS Real-Time Watchlist Screening Enhancements
Long Update: SAS Real-Time Watchlist Screening for Entities and SAS Real-Time Watchlist Screening for Payments have added support for deployment on AWS
Example Link: and Red Hat OpenShift. As a result
Release: these solutions can now be deployed on any of the supported cloud platforms

Short Update: SAS Configurator for Open Source Enhancement
Long Update: SAS Configurator for Open Source has added two options for using alternative locations for Python packages. You can now specify repository locations for the Pip package manager to use for Python packages. You can set these locations by modifying the values for profile-name.pip_index_url or profile-name.pip_extra_url in the configuration file for SAS Configurator for Open Source

Short Update: Changes to Data Access Requirements
Long Update: SAS In-Database Technologies for Databricks requires a deployment of SAS Embedded Process for Spark. An additional RPM file is now available for a SAS Embedded Process for Spark deployment. The new deployment is referred to as the accelserver RPM file. The previous deployment
Document Link: referred to as the sepcorespark RPM file
Example Link: continues to be supported. When you deploy the accelserver RPM

Short Update: Changes to Data Access Requirements
Long Update: SAS In-Database Technologies for Azure Synapse Analytics now supports Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics with Spark 3.3. Previously
Document Link: Spark 2.4 and Spark 3.1 were supported. In addition
Example Link: SAS In-Database Technologies for Databricks now supports Databricks 10.4 LTS - 12.2 LTS for Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services. Previously
column8: but that version contains a software limitation

Short Update: Changes to Data Access Requirements
Long Update: Starting with 2024.09
Document Link: the SAS Viya platform supports MinIO Enterprise Object Store as a data source in AWS environments. You can use the CASLIB statement to connect the CAS server with an S3 or MinIO instance. The FILENAME statement lets you connect the Compute Server with your S3 or MinIO data source. At this time
Example Link: the Parquet LIBNAME statement cannot be used with a MinIO data source

Short Update: Change to CAS Backing Store Enablement
Long Update: The method by which the CAS backing store is enabled has been changed. Previously
Document Link: the backing store was enabled by modifying the custom resource for the CAS operator. Now
Example Link: you enable the backing store in four different scenarios using patch transformer .yaml files

Short Update: Ingress Configuration Feature Now Available
Long Update: SAS has streamlined the process for modifying the ingressClass that the SAS Viya platform uses in a deployment. This feature is useful for segregating traffic to different or non-default ingress-nginx instances

Short Update: Change to PostgreSQL Server Requirements
Long Update: SAS now recommends that you use a block storage device for the PostgreSQL server persistent storage. This recommendation applies equally to an internal or an external PostgreSQL server

Short Update: Critical Change: Kustomize Requirement
Long Update: Kustomize is required in order to generate Kubernetes manifest files for a deployment of the SAS Viya platform. A newer version of Kustomize is required: Kustomize 5.4.3

Short Update: Critical Change: SAS Configurator for Open Source Support for Python 3.11
Long Update: SAS Configurator for Open Source now supports Python 3.11.10. The Python version is determined by parameters in the SAS Configurator for Open Source transformer: $deploy/site-config/sas-pyconfig/change-configuration.yaml. The default_py.python_signature and default_py.python_tarball properties have been modified to support a newer version of Python

Short Update: Critical Change: Pod Changes. sas-visual-analytics-administration -> sas-visual-analytics-app
Long Update: The sas-visual-analytics-administration pod was merged into an existing pod named sas-visual-analytics-app. Pod changes might affect the software update process and the tuning and configuration of pods

Short Update: SAS Data Quality for Program Integrity Healthcare Now Available
Long Update: The first module of a new SAS healthcare offering
Document Link: SAS Data Quality for Program Integrity Healthcare
Example Link: is now available. This offering supports medical practices
column8: and researchers seeking to mine valuable data from medical claims

Short Update: Enhancement to RabbitMQ Transformer
Long Update: To maintain optimal I/O levels
Document Link: RabbitMQ and SAS recommend that you configure a block storage device for RabbitMQ persistent storage

Short Update: Documentation Updates
Long Update: In selected Kubernetes cluster environments
Document Link: the SAS Viya platform can be deployed on generic physical (or 'bare-metal') machines running Red Hat Enterprise Linux. The documentation that is provided for SAS Viya platform deployments was written primarily with virtual machines in mind. The vast majority of this guidance is equally applicable to bare-metal machines. However
Example Link: deployment and sizing guidance specific to bare-metal clusters has now been added to the Tuning Guide. Pre-installation guidelines related to the CAS workload class now incorporate information about deploying on physical machines

Short Update: PostgreSQL Changes (Internal PostgreSQL Only)
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now uses PostgreSQL 16 for internal PostgreSQL servers. The internal PostgreSQL server has been upgraded to Crunchy 5.6.1 for PostgreSQL 16

Short Update: SAS Integrated Regulatory Reporting Now Available
Long Update: A new offering
Example Link: is now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform. SAS Integrated Regulatory Reporting enables financial institutions to manage the complexities of regulatory reporting processes and meet regulatory deadlines using a modern
column8: and cloud-native architecture offered by SAS Viya. By means of the Quick Start feature
column9: the solution supports reporting templates from the following European Banking Authority (EBA) frameworks: COREP framework under EBA Taxonomy 3.2 & IRRBB and MREL frameworks under EBA Taxonomy 3.4

Short Update: Withdrawal of Support for Process Orchestration in Selected Solutions
Long Update: Support for the Process Orchestration functionality in the SAS Viya platform is currently suspended for the following SAS solutions only: SAS Allowance for Credit Loss

Short Update: Change to Ingress Requirements
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now requires ingress-nginx 1.9.0 or later. This change to the minimum supported version of ingress-nginx was made in order to ensure compatibility with Kubernetes 1.28.x - 1.30.x

Short Update: Change to Ingress Requirements
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now requires ingress-nginx 1.7.1 or later. This change to the minimum supported version of ingress-nginx was made in order to ensure compatibility with Kubernetes 1.27.x - 1.29.x

Short Update: Change to Ingress Requirements
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now requires ingress-nginx 1.6.4 or later. This change to the minimum supported version of ingress-nginx was made in order to ensure compatibility with Kubernetes 1.26.x - 1.28.x

Short Update: Deployment Notes and What's New
Long Update: When updating to a new version of the software
Document Link: be sure to review both the Deployment Notes and the What’s New topics. The Deployment Notes alert you to changes to the deployment process. The What’s New topics can include critical changes
Example Link: such as changes to system requirements and pod names. For both the Deployment Notes and the What's New topics
Release: be sure to review each note after the version that is currently deployed
column8: up to and including the version to which you are updating

Short Update: Changes to SAS/CONNECT Server and SAS/CONNECT Spawner
Long Update: The ability to locally spawn a SAS/CONNECT server inside the SAS/CONNECT spawner pod has been removed. It was previously deprecated in the 2024.03 Stable and Long-Term Support release

Short Update: The following SAS solutions have added support for deployment in Red Hat OpenShift: SAS Anti-Money Laundering
Long Update: SAS Regulatory Capital Management
Document Link: The following SAS solutions have added support for deployment in Red Hat OpenShift: SAS Anti-Money Laundering

Short Update: cas.STATETRANSFERMODEL='SUSPEND'|'READONLY'
Long Update: Determines how the state is transferred to a new server

Short Update: cas.MAXSESSIONTRANSFERSIZE=table-size
Long Update: Determines the maximum combined table sizes for a single session that can be transferred to a new server. Any sessions with more than the specified amount of data do not transfer all the session tables to a new server. The SAS administrator can put a limit on the size to minimize disruption. The default value is no limit

Short Update: Changes to Platform Names and Documentation
Long Update: Google Cloud Platform (or GCP) is now called Google Cloud. GKE on VMware and
Release: has been renamed as Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware

Short Update: Pod Name changes
Long Update: sas-category-taxonomy & sas-concept-taxonomy are now sas-text-analytics-taxonomies

Short Update: SAS Real-Time Watchlist Screening for Payments Now Available
Long Update: SAS Real-Time Watchlist Screening for Payments provides real-time and batch processing capabilities to perform watchlist screening. The payment screening capabilities are complimented with the ability to tune screening parameters and integrate customer-specific allow lists and deny lists. Screening is processed using REST API or Kafka integration and is fully audited to meet your regulatory needs

Short Update: Pod Name Changes
Long Update: A number of Pods changed their name or were consolidated

Short Update: Pod Name Changes
Long Update: sas-business-rules-services was split into sas-business-rules & sas-reference-data. sas-decisions-definitions was split into sas-decisions & sas-treatment-definitions. sas-forecasting-comparison
Example Link: sas-forecasting-gateway & sas-forecasting-pipelines where combined into sas-forecasting

Short Update: Common Customizations Divided Into Two New Topics
Long Update: Common Customizations has been divided into Required Customizations and Optional Customizations

Short Update: Updated Sizing Recommendations
Long Update: The updated recommendations are based on a single node for the CAS server
Document Link: a topology that has been thoroughly tested for environments with approximately 8 concurrent end users. The recommendations now provide node minimum and maximum estimates when using cluster autoscaling for the Compute
Release: and Stateless workload classes. Other changes include lower minimum requirements for CAS disk cache storage and SASWORK and additional
column8: lower-resourced machines for Stateless workloads on most platforms

Short Update: OpenSearch Adds Configurable Parameters for Retaining Audit Log Indices
Long Update: OpenSearch has added a new transformer file
Example Link: to configure the retention of audit log indices

Short Update: SAS Regulatory Capital Management Change
Long Update: The rcm_transform.yaml file for SAS Regulatory Capital Management has been modified with new variables for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: Change to Storage Requirements
Long Update: Starting with 2024.06
Document Link: enhancements to the software update process were added. These enhancements resulted in an additional requirement for a PVC that points to POSIX-compliant storage in order to store shared content and libraries

Short Update: Changes to Requirements for an External PostgreSQL Server
Long Update: Starting with 2024.06
Document Link: the SharedServices database for an external PostgreSQL server is no longer created automatically during the initial deployment of the SAS Viya platform. Instead
Example Link: you must manually create it before you start the SAS Viya platform deployment. This database supports the required SAS Infrastructure Data Server component. The procedures to update your SAS Viya platform software to 2024.06 are not affected by these changes

Short Update: Changes to SAS with SingleStore
Long Update: SAS with SingleStore (the product formerly named SAS SpeedyStore) has added support for deployment on Red Hat OpenShift. Deploying SAS with SingleStore on Red Hat OpenShift requires a security context constraint

Short Update: SAS Asset and Liability Management Configuration Change
Long Update: The alm_transform.yaml file for SAS Asset and Liability Management has been modified with new variables for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: SAS Risk Modeling Configuration Change
Long Update: The rm_transform.yaml file for SAS Risk Modeling has been modified with a new variable for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: SAS Risk Cirrus Core Configuration Change
Long Update: The core_transform.yaml file for SAS Risk Cirrus Core has been modified with new variables for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: SAS Insurance Capital Management Configuration Change
Long Update: The icm_transform.yaml file for SAS Insurance Capital Management has been modified with new variables for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: SAS Expected Credit Loss Configuration Change
Long Update: The ecl_transform.yaml file for SAS Expected Credit Loss has been modified with new variables for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling Configuration Change
Long Update: The pcpricing_transform.yaml file for SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling has been modified with new variables for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: SAS Allowance for Credit Loss Configuration Change
Long Update: The acl_transform.yaml file for SAS Allowance for Credit Loss has been modified with new variables for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: Changes to Red Hat OpenShift Requirements
Long Update: The requirements to deploy the SAS Viya Platform into a Red Hat OpenShift environment are now less restrictive. Red Hat OpenShift Kubernetes Engine (OKE) is supported in addition to Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP). SAS has assessed these Kubernetes distributions and determined that they function in a similar manner

Short Update: SAS Model Risk Management Configuration Change
Long Update: The mrm_transform.yaml file for SAS Model Risk Management has been modified with a new variable for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: SAS Risk Factor Manager Configuration Change
Long Update: The rfm_transform.yaml file for SAS Risk Factor Manager has been modified with a new variable for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: Changes to Kubernetes Requirements
Long Update: Support for Kubernetes 1.29.x has been added for all supported providers with the exception of Red Hat OpenShift. Kubernetes 1.26.x is no longer supported. SAS Viya platform 2024.05 supports Kubernetes 1.27.x - 1.29.x

Short Update: Changes to Kubernetes Requirements
Long Update: Support for Kubernetes 1.28.x has been added for all supported providers with the exception of Red Hat OpenShift. Kubernetes 1.25.x is no longer supported. SAS Viya platform 2024.02 supports Kubernetes 1.26.x - 1.28.x

Short Update: SAS Stress Testing Configuration Change
Long Update: The st_transform.yaml file for SAS Stress Testing has been modified with new variables for increased functionality with Git repositories

Short Update: SAS Configurator for Open Source Requires SCC on OpenShift
Long Update: SAS Configurator for Open Source is a utility used for installing and configuring R and Python. If you are performing a deployment on Red Hat OpenShift
Document Link: SAS Configurator for Open Source now requires that you apply and bind a Security Context Constraint (SCC)

Short Update: Enhancements to SAS Fraud and Compliance Solutions Available
Long Update: Enhancements to SAS Fraud and Compliance Solutions Available

Short Update: SAS Real-Time Watchlist Screening for Entities Now Available
Long Update: A new offering
Document Link: SAS Real-Time Watchlist Screening for Entities
Example Link: is now available for deployment with SAS Viya. SAS Real-Time Watchlist Screening for Entities provides real-time and batch processing capabilities to perform watchlist screening. It seamlessly integrates with an industry-leading
Release: third-party screening engine to provide efficient

Short Update: Enhanced Product: SAS Business Orchestration Services
Long Update: SAS Business Orchestration Services now includes a new
Document Link: cloud-native engine that enables users to declare their orchestrations through a set of workloads and flows in YAML format. The classic engine
column8: but it will eventually be superseded by the cloud-native engine

Short Update: SAS Anti-Money Laundering Enhancement
Long Update: SAS Anti-Money Laundering has added support for deployment on Google Cloud Platform and GKE on VMware

Short Update: Critical Deprecation Warning: Changes to SAS/CONNECT Server and SAS/CONNECT Spawner
Long Update: The ability to locally spawn SAS/CONNECT server inside the SAS/CONNECT spawner is deprecated as of the 2024.03 Stable and Long-Term Support releases. It will be removed at 2024.09 Stable and Long-Term Support releases

Short Update: Additional SAS Risk offerings are gaining capabilities that use an Apache Airflow database and the Process Orchestration feature
Long Update: The following SAS Risk offerings are gaining capabilities that use an Apache Airflow database and the Process Orchestration feature: SAS Allowance for Credit Loss
column8: SAS Credit Risk Stress Testing. Apache Airflow requires a dedicated PostgreSQL database. Starting with 2024.03
column9: Apache Airflow can be installed on either an external or an internal instance of PostgreSQL

Short Update: Security Context Constraint for SAS Detection Architecture
Long Update: Deploying SAS Detection Architecture on Red Hat OpenShift requires a security context constraint

Short Update: Oracle: SAS/ACCESS Interface to Oracle now supports Oracle client and database 19c and later. Previously
Long Update: Oracle 12c client and database were supported
Document Link: SAS/ACCESS Interface to Oracle now supports Oracle client and database 19c and later. Previously
Example Link: Oracle 12c client and database were supported

Short Update: MongoDB: SAS/ACCESS Interface to MongoDB now supports versions of OpenSSL later than 1.0.2
Long Update: SAS/ACCESS Interface to MongoDB now supports versions of OpenSSL later than 1.0.2. Previously
Example Link: but the required libraries have now been removed from SAS images. Verify that your version of MongoDB supports a version of OpenSSL that is later than 1.0.2

Short Update: Hadoop: SAS In-Database Technologies for Hadoop Cloud Services now supports Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) 5.x and 6.x
Long Update: SAS In-Database Technologies for Hadoop Cloud Services now supports Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) 5.x and 6.x. Previously
Document Link: only Amazon EMR versions 5.3 and 6.0 were supported. This change does not affect the requirements for SAS/ACCESS Interface to Hadoop

Short Update: Google Cloud has changed the product name of Anthos Clusters on VMware. The new name is GKE on VMware
Long Update: Google Cloud has changed the product name of Anthos Clusters on VMware. The new name is GKE on VMware. This guide acknowledges this name change and uses 'GKE on VMware (formerly Anthos Clusters on VMware)' in order to provide continuity with previous releases

Short Update: Changes to a Deployment Command
Long Update: One kubectl command has been revised. If you deploy or update the SAS Viya platform using Kubernetes commands
Document Link: you should be aware of this change.

Short Update: Change to Calico CNI Support
Long Update: Deployments in upstream open-source Kubernetes clusters now require Calico 3.25.x and later. This change to the minimum supported version of Calico ensures compatibility with Kubernetes 1.26.x - 1.28.x

Short Update: MySQL: SAS/ACCESS Interface to MySQL now supports versions of OpenSSL later than 1.0.2
Long Update: SAS/ACCESS Interface to MySQL now supports versions of OpenSSL later than 1.0.2. Previously
Example Link: but the required libraries have now been removed from SAS images. Verify that your version of MySQL supports a version of OpenSSL that is later than 1.0.2

Short Update: New Transformer for CAS
Long Update: CAS has introduced a new transformer file for deployments that use two node pools for CAS
Document Link: one each for the cascontroller and casworker taints and labels. For more information
Example Link: see the README file located at $deploy/sas-bases/overlays/cas-server/README.md

Short Update: SAS Insurance Capital Management Now Available
Long Update: SAS Insurance Capital Management is now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform. SAS Insurance Capital Management is a collection of computational and reporting logic that is designed to enable insurance and reinsurance companies to implement the European Union Solvency II standard model and ICS 2.0

Short Update: Change to Kustomize Requirement
Long Update: Kustomize 5.1.1
Document Link: Kustomize is required in order to generate Kubernetes manifest files for a deployment of the SAS Viya platform. Starting with SAS Viya platform 2023.12
Example Link: a newer version of Kustomize is required: Kustomize 5.1.1

Short Update: SAS Insurance Contract Valuation Now Available
Long Update: SAS Insurance Contract Valuation is now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform. SAS Insurance Contract Valuation provides an integrated environment for managing
Example Link: and tracing all steps of the IFRS 17 and LDTI compliance processes

Short Update: SAS Regulatory Capital Management Now Available
Long Update: SAS Regulatory Capital Management is now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform. SAS Regulatory Capital Management enables financial institutions to manage the complexities of regulatory capital calculation and reporting processes in the banking sector in an integrated and reliable enterprise framework

Short Update: Using Kustomize transformers to start or stop SAS Viya platform deployment is no longer supported
Long Update: Use sas-stop-all and sas-start-all CronJobs to stop and start your SAS Viya platform deployments.

Short Update: Two new SAS Risk products
Long Update: SAS Climate Risk Stress Testing and SAS Credit Risk Stress Testing
Document Link: are now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform.
Example Link: SAS Climate Risk Stress Testing and SAS Credit Risk Stress Testing can be deployed on all the supported cloud platforms. They both require an instance of SAS Common Data Store.

Short Update: SAS Anti-Money Laundering Now Available
Long Update: SAS Anti-Money Laundering is now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform. This release is the latest iteration of SAS Anti-Money Laundering
Document Link: which saw its first release in 2012. The current version on SAS Viya merges two previous offerings
Example Link: SAS Anti-Money Laundering and SAS Customer Due Diligence
Release: into a single offering. SAS Anti-Money Laundering can be deployed with Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service or with upstream open source Kubernetes.

Short Update: Starting with 2023.11
Long Update: PostgreSQL 11 is no longer supported for an external PostgreSQL server instance of SAS Infrastructure Data Server.
Document Link: PostgreSQL versions 12 - 15 are the only supported versions of PostgreSQL for an external instance.

Short Update: PostgreSQL Changes and Kubernetes Compatibility
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now supports PostgreSQL 15 for external PostgreSQL servers in 2023.10. PostgreSQL 11 - 15 are now supported.

Short Update: New File Required for Mirror Registries for Red Hat OpenShift Deployments
Long Update: If you are deploying on Red Hat OpenShift using a mirror registry
Document Link: you should add a reference to a new file in the base kustomization.yaml file ($deploy/kustomization.yaml).

Short Update: A Pre-update Checklist is included to help you get started with updating to a new version or to apply a patch update.
Long Update: Through a Q&A format
column8: and the required documentation to update the software.

Short Update: SingleStore: In previous releases
Long Update: the default value for the SingleStore --overpack-factor option was 0.10. Starting in 2023.07
Release: the default value for the SingleStore --overpack-factor option was 0.10. Starting in 2023.07

Short Update: SAS Asset and Liability Management Now Available
Long Update: SAS Asset and Liability Management on SAS Viya is now available with a new architecture. This release creates a unified framework with Kamakura Risk Manager
Document Link: a mature enterprise risk management system that focuses on credit risk

Short Update: New Retail and Planning Offerings and Offering Names
Long Update: With the July Stable release
Document Link: the names and licensing of some SAS Retail and SAS Planning offerings have been changed. SAS Assortment Planning
Release: and SAS Financial Planning are now part of a new offering
column8: SAS Intelligent Planning. Licensing changes enable you to combine the capabilities of each intelligent planning offering for the requirements of a specific enterprise (such as consumer items

Short Update: Multi-tenancy: Change to sas-tenant-job
Long Update: In multi-tenant deployments
Document Link: the behavior of the sas-tenant-job has changed. During the onboarding of a new tenant
Example Link: the sas-tenant-job now continues to run until the completion of the rolling restart of all SAS Viya platform services. Successful job completion indicates that a SAS administrator can immediately sign on to the new tenant and begin adding users and groups.

Short Update: Support for GPUs on Red Hat OpenShift
Long Update: Some SAS offerings support processing-intensive features that can leverage a GPU for improved performance. For example
Document Link: deep learning or deep neural network capabilities that are included with SAS Viya or SAS Viya Advanced can leverage a GPU if it is present in the cluster. You can now take advantage of these features with GPU-capable VMs in a Red Hat OCP cluster for OpenShift on VMware.

Short Update: SAS Fraud Decisioning Now Available
Long Update: SAS Fraud Decisioning detects
Example Link: and manages evidence of fraud in real time. SAS Fraud Decisioning provides real-time decision processing and advanced analytic modeling. Functionality extends to decisions related to credit and debit cards
column10: and merchant transactions. SAS Fraud Decisioning can be deployed only with AKS or with upstream open source Kubernetes at this time.

Short Update: Change to Kustomize Requirements - Kustomize 5.0.3 required.
Long Update: Kustomize is required in order to generate Kubernetes manifest files for a deployment of the SAS Viya platform. Starting with SAS Viya platform 2023.06
Document Link: a newer version of Kustomize is required: Kustomize 5.0.3.

Short Update: Teradata: Changes to Data Source Support
Long Update: SAS/ACCESS Interface to Teradata now supports Teradata TTU 17.20 or later.

Short Update: Support for Multi-Tenancy.
Long Update: You can now deploy SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling with multi-tenancy enabled. At this time
Document Link: SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling and other Risk products support only the database-per-tenant configuration.

Short Update: Support for Confidential Computing on AKS
Long Update: Starting in SAS Viya platform 2023.03
Document Link: confidential computing is supported in Microsoft AKS deployments.

Short Update: Revised Deployment Command for resource pruning
Long Update: With the change in Kubernetes support
Document Link: the required command to prune additional resources while performing an update using Kubernetes commands has been revised.

Short Update: New Workload Classes for CAS
Long Update: To increase the granularity for scheduling CAS workloads
Document Link: SAS has introduced cascontroller and casworker classes.

Short Update: Forward Proxy Content.
Long Update: Content describing how to configure for forward proxies during the deployment of your software has been added to the deployment guide.

Short Update: Changes to the Updating Software Documentation.
Long Update: Additional information about using the cadence-release flag is provided in the 'Update to a New Version Using the Deployment Operator' and 'Apply a Patch Update Using the Deployment Operator' topics.

Short Update: Changes to Kubernetes Requirements.
Long Update: Support for Kubernetes 1.26.x has been added. Kubernetes 1.23.x is no longer supported. SAS Viya platform 2023.05 supports Kubernetes 1.24.x - 1.26.x.

Short Update: Changes to Ingress Support.
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now requires ingress-nginx 1.3.0 or later. This change to the minimum supported version of ingress-nginx was made in order to ensure compatibility with Kubernetes 1.24 - 1.26. For deployments in open source Kubernetes clusters
Document Link: the minimum version of Calico that is required is now 3.24.x.

Short Update: Support for Multi-Tenancy for some Risk products
Long Update: You can now deploy additional Risk products with multi-tenancy enabled: SAS Expected Credit Loss
Document Link: SAS Model Risk Management and SAS Stress Testing. At this time
Example Link: these Risk products support only the database-per-tenant configuration.

Short Update: Support for External PostgreSQL Instances for additional products
Long Update: You can now deploy the following additional products with an external instance of the required PostgreSQL database: SAS Asset and Liability Management

Short Update: Support for Anthos Clusters on VMware
Long Update: Starting with 2023.04
Document Link: the SAS Viya platform can be deployed in Anthos Clusters on VMware (GKE on-prem). These clusters are managed by the version of Google Kubernetes Engine for on-premises data centers. Anthos Clusters run in customer-managed data centers rather than in Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Short Update: SAS Mirror Manager Support for Additional Registry Options
