Long Update: SAS Mirror Manager now offers support for deploying from an image registry in Red Hat OpenShift or JFrog Artifactory.

Short Update: Changes to Data Source Support: SAS In-Database Technologies for Hadoop Cloud Services now supports Microsoft Azure HDInsight 5.0.
Long Update: SAS In-Database Technologies for Hadoop Cloud Services now supports Microsoft Azure HDInsight 5.0.

Short Update: Changes to Data Source Support: Databricks 10.4 LTS or later (on Azure and AWS)
Long Update: SAS In-Database Technologies for Databricks now supports Databricks 10.4 LTS or later (with Spark 3.2.x or later) for Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services. The newer versions of Databricks include fixes for issues with Spark SQL. Previously
Document Link: SAS In-Database Technologies for Databricks supported Databricks 6.x - 9.x.

Short Update: SAS Visual Analytics SDK: registerDataDriveContent support with exported report packages using new packageUri option
Long Update: registerDataDriveContent support with exported report packages using new packageUri option

Short Update: SAS Content SDK: Added getSASJobExecutionUrl helper
Long Update: This function generates a SAS Job Execution URL. You can use the URL to open a job and execute it if it is a job with an HTML prompt. This URL can be opened in a new tab or window
Document Link: or embedded in an iframe if allowed by the security settings on the deployment.

Short Update: SAS Visual Analytics SDK: getData method on ObjectHandle
Long Update: Returns all of the data from the report object. This data matches what appears in the report object
Document Link: including any filters that have been applied.

Short Update: Batch Processing Enhancements for SAS Model Studio Forecasting projects
Long Update: Prior to this release
Document Link: when running a project in batch mode
Example Link: there was no way to tell which
column8: models had failed for any particular time series. Starting in 2025.08
column9: the batch log records any model that has failed when the pipeline is run. Be sure to examine this log after the batch processing is complete and make any necessary changes to the time series in Interactive Modeling

Product/Tool: SAS Portal Framework for SAS Viya
Short Update: Initial release of the SAS Portal Framework for SAS Viya
Long Update: Create a portal to consolidate your reporting
Release: and more into a unified interface that supports full authentication and authorization. Built on top of SAS Viya.

Short Update: Log Tab for Virtual Environments
Long Update: When a system administrator creates or updates a virtual environment
Document Link: the new Log tab provides information about the progress of building the virtual environment. If the process fails
Example Link: the Log tab displays error messages

Short Update: New Option: No Python Dependencies
Long Update: When you select a virtual environment for your project
Document Link: you can now choose an option to not include Python dependencies. If you use SAS Event Stream Manager to create a project container for your project
Example Link: selecting this option can result in faster image creation as well as a smaller container image

Short Update: Ability to View Contents of the Built-In Virtual Environment
Long Update: A system administrator can now view which Python packages are included in the built-in environment. Previously
Document Link: you could not view this information

Short Update: Ability to Import a requirements.txt File into an Existing Virtual Environment
Long Update: A system administrator can now import a requirements.txt file into an existing virtual environment. Previously
Document Link: you could import data from a requirements.txt file only when creating a virtual environment

Short Update: Ability to Create Arm64 Source Images for Project Containers
Long Update: You can now use SAS Event Stream Manager to create Arm64 source images for use in project containers. Previously
Document Link: when you wanted to use a project container in an Arm64 environment
Example Link: your organization had to provide the Arm64 source images

Short Update: Enhancement to the Ability to Choose Whether ESP Servers Stop and Start When the SAS Viya Platform Is Stopped and Started
Long Update: When you use SAS Event Stream Manager to monitor a project
Document Link: a new field indicates whether the ESP server that was created for the project is required to be in continuous operation. Previously
Example Link: there was no easy way to tell whether continuous operation was selected when the project was deployed in SAS Event Stream Manager

Short Update: ESI Workflows for Stopping and Starting an ESP Standalone Environment
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Standalone Installer (ESI) now includes stop-all and start-all ESI workflows that you can use to stop and start your ESP Standalone environment

Short Update: Source Images for Project Containers Can Be Pulled from the SAS Container Registry
Long Update: When you create a project container for use in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 for x86 architectures
Document Link: SAS Event Stream Manager can pull source images directly from the SAS Container Registry. Previously you had to store the source images in your own organization's container registry

Short Update: Ability to Use a ConfigMap When Creating Project Containers
Long Update: When you are creating project containers
Document Link: you can use a Kubernetes ConfigMap that specifies default locations for source images

Short Update: New Attribute for Handling Lua and Python Exceptions
Long Update: The optional on-script-exception attribute enables you to specify how exceptions that are encountered during the execution of Lua or Python code are handled. You can set this attribute at project level

Short Update: Enhancements to the Configuration of Custom Windows
Long Update: When you are working on the configuration object (_espconfig_) of a custom window
Document Link: you can use the new esp_type field to specify the data type of the fields that the user of the custom window is permitted to map to input variables and output variables

Short Update: ESI Can Deploy SAS Event Stream Processing in Your Own Kubernetes Cluster
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Standalone Installer (ESI) enables you to install standalone SAS Event Stream Processing with minimal SAS Viya platform dependencies. You can now use ESI to deploy SAS Event Stream Processing in your own Kubernetes cluster. Previously you could use ESI only to deploy SAS Event Stream Processing in Microsoft Azure

Short Update: New Parameters for the OPC-UA Connector and Adapter
Long Update: The new retryconnection parameter enables you to specify whether to periodically retry the connection to the OPC-UA server if the server goes down. The retryqueuesize parameter enables you to specify the size of the buffer that is used to save event blocks that are generated by the subscribed window while the connection is down

Short Update: ESI Can Use a Mirror Registry
Long Update: When you do not want to use ESI with the SAS Container Registry
Document Link: you can use SAS Mirror Manager to create a mirror registry for the SAS software container images in your order

Short Update: New Attribute for StateDB Writer and StateDB Reader Windows
Long Update: When the database type is Redis
Document Link: you can use the keep-alive-ping attribute to specify the interval at which to send a ping command to keep the connection alive

Short Update: New Parameter for the RabbitMQ Connector and Adapter
Long Update: When you use the RabbitMQ publisher connector or publisher adapter
Document Link: you should now use the queuename parameter instead of the buspersistencequeue parameter to specify the queue name. The queuename parameter can also be used to specify the queue name when the buspersistence parameter is disabled

Short Update: Critical Change: Ability to Choose Whether ESP Servers Stop and Start When the SAS Viya Platform Is Stopped and Started
Long Update: Under certain circumstances
Document Link: you can now choose whether ESP servers stop and start when the SAS Viya platform is stopped and started

Short Update: Support for Opaque Strings in the NATS.io Connector and Adapter
Long Update: When you use a NATS.io publisher connector or publisher adapter
Document Link: you can now set the natsiotype parameter to opaquestring. The fields that are published can include the message's subject. When you use the NATS.io subscriber adapter
Example Link: you can set the value of the natsiotype parameter to the name of a string field

Short Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Standalone Installer Available
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Standalone Installer (ESI) provides a new way to install standalone SAS Event Stream Processing. ESI is a command-line application that deploys SAS Event Stream Processing with minimal SAS Viya platform dependencies

Short Update: New esp.getLogLevel() Python Function
Long Update: When you are debugging ESP server logs
Document Link: you can get the current log level of loggers in the ESP server with the esp.getLogLevel() Python functio

Short Update: New esp_getLogLevel() Lua Function
Long Update: When you are debugging ESP server logs
Document Link: you can get the current log level of loggers in the ESP server with the esp_getLogLevel() Lua function

Short Update: Critical Change: ESP Servers Can Stop and Start When the SAS Viya Platform Is Stopped and Started
Long Update: When the SAS Viya platform is stopped and started
Document Link: any running ESP servers that were created by SAS Event Stream Processing Studio are now automatically stopped and started. Stopping and starting the SAS Viya platform has no impact on ESP servers that were created by SAS Event Stream Manager. Previously
Example Link: restoring any ESP server pods required you to manually back up and restore ESPServer custom resources

Short Update: Critical Change: PV and PVC Are Now Mandatory
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing requires a file-based persistent volume (PV) for running projects

Short Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Streamviewer No Longer Supported
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Streamviewer is no longer supported. Users are encouraged to explore the SAS Event Stream Processing Data Source Plug-in for Grafana

Short Update: New Monitoring Capabilities
Long Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Monitoring for Kubernetes uses Grafana to enable project monitoring. It measures CPU usage and memory consumption
Document Link: and uses Grafana Loki for log aggregation

Short Update: Lower overall ESP server memory usage because now unused memory is periodically returned to the operating system
Long Update: Lower overall ESP server memory usage because now unused memory is periodically returned to the operating system

Short Update: Deleting Orphaned SAS Micro Analytic Service Stores
Long Update: Members of the administrator group can now use the Settings page in SAS Event Stream Manager to delete orphaned SAS Micro Analytic Service stores that were associated with project XML files

Short Update: Considerably shorter ESP server load times for large projects that contain multiple SAS Analytic Store files
Long Update: Considerably shorter ESP server load times for large projects that contain multiple SAS Analytic Store files. In some cases
Document Link: ESP server performance is 10 times faster than in previous software releases

Short Update: SAS Event Stream Processing Streamviewer No Longer Supported as of July 2024
Long Update: Beginning with the 2024.07 stable release
Document Link: SAS Event Stream Processing Streamviewer is no longer supported. Users are encouraged to explore the SAS Event Stream Processing Data Source Plug-in for Grafana

Short Update: New Deployment Assets for Connector Configuration
Long Update: You can completely or partially set connector and adapter configuration parameters in a configuration file. When you deploy SAS Event Stream Processing with other SAS Viya products in a Kubernetes environment
Document Link: you must apply a customization to your deployment in order to apply configuration parameters set in that file. Deployment assets are now available to configure the ESP operator so that it applies the customization

Short Update: New Overlays for PV access
Long Update: When you deploy SAS Event Stream Processing with other SAS products
Document Link: two new overlays enable direct file access to the persistent volume (PV) file system

Short Update: SingleStore: Documentation has been updated to recommend that you manually pause SingleStore before you uninstall SAS SpeedyStore
Long Update: Documentation has been updated to recommend that you manually pause SingleStore before you uninstall SAS SpeedyStore

Short Update: The instance of SingleStoreDB that is included with SAS with SingleStore has been updated from version 8.7 to 8.9
Long Update: The database update is not backward-compatible. If you update to 2025.03 or later
Document Link: the SingleStoreDB instance is automatically updated to version 8.9.x. Following the update to 2025.03 or later

Long Update: Android & iOS: Support for the new report data privacy options and the new option for slider controls have been added

Short Update: Job Plug-In: The --wait-results option is available as of release 2.6.44
Long Update: The --wait-results option is available as of release 2.6.44 of the job CLI plug-in. You can use this option with the job requests execute and job flows execute commands. The option enables the job CLI plug-in to wait for the results from the program associated with the job request or job flow. The CLI polls the program until the CLI receives the program results. The results are written to stdout.

Document Link: an enterprise risk management system. It provides advanced analytics for interest-rate risk
column8: and liquidity risk management. SAS Market Risk Management covers a wide range of trading-book and banking-book products. Users can perform scenario
column10: and simulation analyses of portfolio P/L and accounting. SAS Visual Analytics provides reporting capabilities. SAS Market Risk Management can be deployed on Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform. It requires SAS Common Data Store.

Long Update: A new report is included to provide insights into user activity

Long Update: Redis now has a transformer file that enables you to modify the PersistentVolumeClaim size or the StorageClass for nodes. The transformer file can be applied on the deployment of your SAS Viya platform software

Short Update: Customer-provided Root CA Certificate Is Supported
Long Update: Prior to deployment
Document Link: the SAS Viya platform deployment can be configured to use a customer-provided root CA certificate by using the saspackage/k8s/sas-certframe/examples/security/customer-provided-sas-viya-ca-certificate-secret.yaml file. Follow the instructions in Configure the SAS Viya Platform Root CA Certificate in the README file $deploy/sasbases/examples/security/README.md (for Markdown format) or at $deploy/sas-bases/docs/configure_network_security_and_encryption_using_sas_security_certificate_framework.htm (for HTML format)

Short Update: Critical Change: Changes to Kubernetes Requirements
Long Update: Support for Kubernetes 1.32.x has been added for all supported providers with the exception of Red Hat OpenShift. Kubernetes 1.29.x is no longer supported. SAS Viya platform 2025.05 supports Kubernetes 1.30.x - 1.32.x

Short Update: Critical Change: Ingress Requirements
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now requires ingress-nginx 1.10.1 or later. This change to the minimum supported version of ingress-nginx was made in order to ensure compatibility with Kubernetes 1.30.x - 1.32.x. Using later versions of third-party components is a best practice

Short Update: Critical Change: Calico CNI Support
Long Update: Deployments in upstream open-source Kubernetes clusters now require Calico 3.28.x and later. This change to the minimum supported version of Calico ensures compatibility with Kubernetes 1.30.x - 1.32.x

Short Update: New Argument for Compute Provider for Job Execution Service
Long Update: A new argument is available that enables you to avoid an overly long key name for fileref results

Short Update: Critical Change: SAS Functions. These functions are removed from SAS software for security reasons. They are no longer supported and should not be used.
Long Update: The following functions should be removed from DATA step programs to prevent an error: ADDRLONG

Short Update: New Session Option: MAXCORESPERWORKER
Long Update: The MAXCORESPERWORKER= session option specifies the maximum number of cores per worker for a session. You can use this option to reduce the maximum cores per worker in order to reduce core contention and improve performance. This option defaults to the CAS server configuration option cas.MAXCORESPERWORKER setting. If neither option is set
Document Link: the maximum number of cores per worker is determined by the CAS server container's CGroup core limit

Short Update: In a SAS Viya 3.x to SAS Viya 4 migration
Long Update: the Plan and Backup Ansible playbook now has an evaluate play
Document Link: Running the playbook with the evaluate play creates the SAS 3.x System Evaluation report that contains information about the CPU
Release: and the installed software. It also displays information about the eligibility of your SAS Viya 3.x deployment to migrate to SAS Viya 4 using the full-system migration method

Short Update: Starting in release 2025.03
Long Update: you can set job requests to include a time duration value on all job instances submitted from the job request
Example Link: you can set job requests to include a time duration value on all job instances submitted from the job request. After a job instance completes running and the specified time duration (such as three days) has elapsed
Release: the job instance expires and is deleted.

Short Update: Change in When Compute Provider Saves Results for a Job Execution Service Job
Long Update: Starting in release 2025.02
Document Link: if the _omitSessionResults argument is not present
Example Link: the default behavior for the Compute provider is that it no longer saves results from the Compute job. This means that results generated by the job's code are lost unless the results are saved in another way.

Short Update: The New Global Configuration Property: sas.compute.service
Long Update: The set of properties that are used to configure how the Compute service runs the jobs that it receives from the Job Execution Service

Short Update: Backup and Restore Enhancement: The status.json file for each backup now includes the cadence and cadence version of the deployment
Long Update: The status.json file for each backup now includes the cadence and cadence version of the deployment

Long Update: Storage resources such as the space available on the PVC are pre-validated by default to help ensure that there is adequate space on the PVC to store data for a backup job. If the pre-validation fails

Long Update: Resources such as CPU and memory are now pre-validated by default to help ensure that restore jobs complete successfully. If the pre-validation fails

Short Update: SAS Drive is now deprecated

Example Link: and administrators can re-enable SAS Drive until its official retirement in the 2025.06 release

Short Update: The SAS Viya audit service can now create activity records for two new user activity events
Long Update: The first new event is generated in response to user requests for access to resources that are managed by infrastructure services
Document Link: such at the report service. The second new user activity event is sent directly from applications to the POST endpoint of the audit service

Short Update: Additional security has been applied to all deployments. A one-time procedure is required to create a configuration for sas.logon.jwt
Long Update: Additional security has been applied to all deployments. A one-time procedure is required to create a configuration for sas.logon.jwt

Short Update: Starting with 2024.11
Long Update: the SAS Viya platform supports new configuration parameters that can reduce the overhead of LDAP directory queries
Example Link: optional group-membership information can be included in the authentication claims from the identity provider. The SAS Viya platform can now read and apply this information when users log in. If you configure the required IdP settings and set the corresponding SAS Viya platform authentication parameters
Release: you can enable SAS Logon Manager to use the group information from the OIDC token or SAML claim for user authentication instead of querying LDAP for group information

Short Update: The documentation for the SAS logging facility has been updated for the SAS Viya platform
Long Update: The SAS Viya logging facility is a programming framework that enables the customization of the logging process. The logging facility supports two sets of users adminstrators and programmers

Short Update: Read-Only access to global tables and other state components is now enabled by default during CAS state transfer
Long Update: Read-Only access to global tables and other state components is now enabled by default during CAS state transfer. This allows actions that read data to continue to run
Document Link: which provides a better user experience by minimizing disruptions

Example Link: learn more about SAS Viya platform applications

column9: that setting is honored and the Welcome to SAS Viya page does not appear

Long Update: The audit service now uses the SAS_LOG_LEVEL_SERVICE_AUDIT logger

Short Update: Describing Your SAS Viya Platform Deployment
Long Update: A new guide is now available that demonstrates how you can describe and record important information about your SAS Viya platform deployment. You can use this information when troubleshooting issues in your deployment

Short Update: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing

The default values have changed for the allowedHeaders

Long Update: A new configuration field lets you manage logout behavior when users log out of a SAS Viya user interface. The performRpInitiatedLogout configuration property instructs SAS Logon Manager to log the user out of the identity provider when the user logs out

Short Update: he Server Contexts documentation is merged with Programming Run-time documentation

Short Update: Enhancement to the SAS Batch Server: option to store the files in a mounted file system

Short Update: Visual Description of the Jobs and Flows Process

Short Update: SAS Logon Manager now includes support for private keys using JSON web tokens (JWT)

Document Link: you can enable the use of JWT authentication with SAS Logon Manager instead of using basic authentication and client secrets. The OIDC standard defines private_key_jwt as a replacement for client secrets. This functionality is available for OIDC with Okta and OIDC with Microsoft Entra ID

Long Update: Point-in-Time-Recovery (PITR) is now available for internal Crunchy Data PostgreSQL and valid for restore-in-place scenarios

Example Link: you can enable the use of JWT authentication with SAS Logon Manager instead of using basic authentication and client secrets. The OIDC standard defines private_key_jwt as a replacement for client secrets

Short Update: Enhancement: Backup and Restore

Short Update: The SAS Viya platform is now integrated with Microsoft Entra ID by means of an enterprise app

Short Update: The files service uses ClamAV (AntiVirus) for scanning uploaded files.

Short Update: Starting in 2023.11
Long Update: the default refresh token expiration is 14 days
Document Link: A few applications and key services override this setting so that the token persists for a maximum of 90 days. These services include the credentials service
Release: and the event monitor. In addition
column8: clients can now have their own refresh token validity. You can change the default setting using SAS Environment Manager.

Short Update: SAS Viya CLI: New Option for job flows list-history Command
Long Update: The --allExecutedInstances option is available as of release 2.6.47 of the job CLI plug-in. You can use this option with the job flows list-history command. The option returns a combined history of flow instances that have been executed (either immediately or via a schedule).

Short Update: SAS/CONNECT Server SASCMD sign-ons always start a server session in a new pod in the Kubernetes cluster by default.
Long Update: The SAS administrator can also choose to re-enable the original functionality of spawning a server session in the same pod where the client process is running.

Short Update: Now you can restrict the ability to run most import actions in SAS Data Explorer
Long Update: Now you can restrict the ability to run most import actions in SAS Data Explorer to a group that includes administrators and other users who retain READ permission to the folder that contains the job definitions used for import. When this option is implemented
Document Link: the only data that is not restricted for import within SAS Data Explorer in this way is local files
Release: and the content in Viya folders.

Short Update: In a SAS Viya 4 to SAS Viya 4 full-system migration
Long Update: a restore CronJob now performs the restore.
Document Link: In a SAS Viya 4 to SAS Viya 4 full-system migration
Example Link: a restore CronJob now performs the restore.

Short Update: Changes to Kubernetes Requirements
Long Update: Support for Kubernetes 1.27.x has been added. Kubernetes 1.24.x is no longer supported. SAS Viya platform 2023.09 supports Kubernetes 1.25.x - 1.27.x.

Short Update: Change to Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) Requirements
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now requires Red Hat OCP 4.12 - 4.14 on VMware vSphere 7.0.1 or later. OCP 4.11 is no longer supported. These versions align with the supported versions of Kubernetes.

Short Update: Change to Ingress Requirements
Long Update: The SAS Viya platform now requires ingress-nginx 1.4.0 or later. This change to the minimum supported version of ingress-nginx was made in order to ensure compatibility with Kubernetes 1.25 - 1.27.

Short Update: CAS Node Scaling Now Available
Long Update: CAS Node Scaling permits CAS to load balance the nodes when workers are added or removed from an MPP CAS configuration. Enabling CAS Node Scaling requires that environment variables be added to the CAS deployment.

Short Update: SAS Intelligent Retail Products Now Available
Long Update: SAS Intelligent Planning Management
Example Link: and SAS Intelligent Pricing Management offerings are now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform.

Short Update: SAS Intelligent Inventory Management Now Available
Long Update: SAS Intelligent Inventory Management is now available for deployment with the SAS Viya platform. This offering includes SAS Allocation

Short Update: SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling Enhancements
Long Update: With the addition of support for deployment on GCP and Anthos Clusters on VMware and on Red Hat OpenShift
Document Link: these products can be deployed on any of the supported cloud platforms.

Short Update: SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling Bundles
Long Update: SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling now has three bundling options: SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling Analyze
Example Link: and SAS Dynamic Actuarial Modeling Premier.

Short Update: SAS Asset and Liability Management Enhancement
Long Update: SAS Asset and Liability Management has added support for deployment on Red Hat OpenShift. The product can now be deployed on any of the supported cloud platforms.

Short Update: Ability to migrate from internal to external PostgreSQL
Long Update: In a SAS Viya 4 to SAS Viya 4 multi-tenant migration
Document Link: you can now migrate from a source environment with internal PostgreSQL to a target environment with external PostgreSQL as long as the source and target use the same cloud provider and SAS Viya version.

Short Update: Ability to increase the OAuth token lifespan obtained from SAS Launcher
Long Update: The lifetime of the OAuth tokens that are obtained from SAS Launcher can now be increased. You can set the Consul property config/launcher/oauth2.client.accessTokenValidity to an appropriate value
Document Link: which represents the token lifetime in seconds. This setting enables processes that are created by SAS Launcher to have a longer OAuth token duration by default
Example Link: overriding the time limit that is defined by SAS Logon Manager.

Short Update: Update to the hashing algorithm for UID and GUID
Long Update: Starting in 2023.06
Document Link: the hashing algorithm used by the identities service to generate UID and GID values was updated. Values that have already been generated remain the same. However
Example Link: newly generated UIDs and GIDs are likely to result in different values. Contact SAS Technical Support if you need assistance adjusting file system permissions as a result of this change.

Short Update: SingleStore: Tuning and Optimization added
Long Update: The SAS Documentation has been enhanced to include Tuning and Optimization considerations

Short Update: SingleStore: Troubleshooting added
Long Update: The SAS Documentation has been enhanced to include a Troubleshooting site

Short Update: SingleStore: Deployment Overview added
Long Update: The SAS Documentation has been enhanced to include architectural diagrams and deyploment overviews

Short Update: CAS supports TLS-encrypted connections between the worker nodes.
Long Update: CAS supports TLS-encrypted connections between the worker nodes.

Short Update: Single Sign-out Parameter for OIDC Providers
Long Update: SAS Logon Manager has been upgraded to a newer version of UAA. As a result
Document Link: a new OIDC parameter is now supported and can be configured in SAS Environment Manager: logoutUrl. This parameter lets you enable single sign-out. When logoutUrl is enabled
Example Link: users' SAS sessions are redirected to the OIDC provider's logout endpoint when they sign out of a SAS user interface.

Short Update: Group-Managed Service Account for Scheduling Job Requests and Job Flows
Long Update: Jobs and Flows now provides a group-managed service account feature. This feature enables members of a scheduling group to execute or schedule a job request or job flow that was created by another member of that group. When executed or scheduled
Document Link: the job request or job flow is initiated by the service account. Replaces the Run As feature

Short Update: Encryption: SAS Viya supports the use of FIPS 140-2
Long Update: SAS Viya supports the use of FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules when executed on Kubernetes nodes running in FIPS mode.

Short Update: Tenant migration is now supported.
Long Update: Tenant migration is the process of re-creating one or more tenants while preserving the tenant-specific configuration and content to a new or existing deployment that differs from the source environment. It is available when migrating from SAS Viya 4. Tenant migration to SAS Viya 4 includes moving content and data from one or more non-provider tenants in a source SAS Viya 4 multi-tenancy environment to another target SAS Viya 4 multi-tenancy environment.

Short Update: iOS: Limit the Visibility of a Report Page
Long Update: You can now choose whether a report page is available to all users or to one or more individual users

Short Update: Android: Limit the Visibility of a Report Page
Long Update: You can now choose whether a report page is available to all users or to one or more individual users

Short Update: Limit the Visibility of a Report Page
Long Update: You can now choose whether a report page is available to all users or to one or more individual users. When visibility is restricted

Short Update: New Options for Report Data Privacy
Long Update: There are new report options that enable you to restrict users who are viewing reports from downloading data and detail data; exporting Microsoft Excel worksheets
Example Link: or report packages; or printing a PDF. You can specify whether the options are always disabled or disabled only if private data is present in a report

Short Update: SSO for Esri services has been added.
Long Update: Administrators can configure single sign-on authorization for Esri services so that SAS Visual Analytics users are not required to log in to your organization's Esri ArcGIS Online and Esri ArcGIS Enterprise accounts.

Long Update: Add support for fileNavigationCustomRootPath/fileNavigationRoot for rest & iom/com connections

Long Update: Add application name to ITC-based (IOM/COM) connections

Long Update: Python: PowerPC is no longer supported

Long Update: Add support for Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE)

Long Update: Python SWAT: Added support for Python 3.11

column8: you can create other folders to store your projects

Long Update: This release introduces a new command line interface to change the ownership of a project. You export the project to your local drive and then run the command to assign a new owner

Short Update: Prior to this release
Long Update: the only way to copy a project was to export it to your hard drive and then import it back into Model Studio. Now there is an option on the project menu to duplicate the project
Example Link: the only way to copy a project was to export it to your hard drive and then import it back into Model Studio. Now there is an option on the project menu to duplicate the project

Short Update: Documentation Enhancement for EXTLANG Package
Long Update: The documentation has been improved to add more clarity and content. For example

Long Update: The ability to duplicate a project

Long Update: The ability to change ownership of a project in Model Studio

Long Update: The Folder field when creating or duplicating a project. This field gives you the ability to specify a destination folder to use to save the new project

Short Update: Ability to Update Keycloak and OAuth2 Proxy in an ESP Standalone Environment
Long Update: Ability to Update Keycloak and OAuth2 Proxy in an ESP Standalone Environment

Short Update: Ability to Update the SAS Event Stream Processing License in an ESP Standalone Environment
Long Update: You can use the update-license workflow of SAS Event Stream Processing Standalone Installer (ESI) to update the SAS Event Stream Processing license in your ESP standalone environment

Short Update: Ability to Update Third-Party Components in an ESP Standalone Environment
Long Update: You can update components that are deployed to namespaces other than the ESP standalone namespace by using the update-external ESI workflow. This workflow updates third-party components that have been deployed using ESI

Short Update: Critical Change: References from a Project Package to Files outside the Project Package No Longer Supported
Long Update: Starting in 2025.07
Document Link: a project package must not reference files that are outside the project package. When you use SAS Event Stream Processing Studio or SAS Event Stream Manager to run a project
Example Link: the Kubernetes pod for that project does not have access to files that are outside the project package and the project might not run. Project containers that you create from the project might not function. You must move referenced files to the project package. This change does not affect project XML files that are not part of a project package

Short Update: Ability to Change the Application Theme
Long Update: You can now select a theme to change the appearance of SAS Event Stream Processing Studio and SAS Event Stream Manager. The themes include a High Contrast theme that can meet the needs of users with low vision. The Dark theme reduces eye strain and supports extended use

Short Update: Ability to Update and Roll Back an ESP Standalone Environment
Long Update: You can now update and roll back your ESP standalone environment by using the update and rollback workflows of SAS Event Stream Processing Standalone Installer (ESI). The update workflow enables you to update SAS Event Stream Processing components

Short Update: Virtual Environments That Contain Python Packages
Long Update: An administrator can now create a virtual environment that specifies a set of Python packages. When a user selects a virtual environment for a project
Document Link: the project runs with the Python packages specified in that virtual environment

Short Update: Critical Change: References from a Project Package to Files outside the Project Package No Longer Supported as of 2025.07
Long Update: Currently
Document Link: it is recommended that a project package not reference files that are outside the project package. Starting in 2025.07
Example Link: a project package must not reference files that are outside the project package. When you use SAS Event Stream Processing Studio or SAS Event Stream Manager to run a project
Release: the Kubernetes pod for that project will not have access to files that are outside the project package and the project might not run. Project containers that you create from the project might not function. Users are encouraged to move referenced files to the project package before this change occurs. This change does not affect project XML files that are not part of a project package

Short Update: Examples That Include Custom Windows
Long Update: The SAS Event Stream Processing Studio GitHub now contains examples that include custom windows. You can access these examples from SAS Event Stream Processing Studio: when you click View example projects on the Projects page
Document Link: a Custom windows category is now available in the SAS Event Stream Processing Examples window

Short Update: Ability to Convert Projects to File-Based Versioning in Bulk
Long Update: Members of the administrator group can now use the Settings page in SAS Event Stream Processing Studio to convert project XML files to use file-based versioning in bulk. A project package is created for each project XML file. Previously

Short Update: Managing Publisher Adapters through Lua Code
Long Update: You now can use a set of Lua functions to manage publisher adapters in order to stream data into projects. Using these functions can be a viable alternative to using the Adapter Connector for the same purpose

Short Update: Enhancement to Running ESP Servers as the Current User
Long Update: On the Settings page in SAS Event Stream Processing Studio

Short Update: Importing and Exporting Project Packages
Long Update: In SAS Event Stream Processing Studio
Document Link: you can now import or export an entire project package. Previously

Long Update: When lightweight SAS Event Stream Processing is deployed

Short Update: New Onboarding Resources
Long Update: A new Welcome page provides access to resources that help you learn about SAS Event Stream Processing and the web-based clients. A tour of the SAS Event Stream Processing Studio interface is also available.

Short Update: Ability to connect SAS IOM clients on Windows is no longer experimental

Long Update: SAS Enterprise Session Monitor now uses Java 17

Long Update: A dedicated API endpoint is added for deleting stored regular expressions

Long Update: The cluster selection in the dashboard is now preserved between browser sessions

Long Update: Additional support for configuring TLS has been added and validation has been performed. The Administrator's Guide has been updated with instructions for enabling TLS for the Swagger and PostgREST endpoints

Short Update: The ability to assign a monthly cost to an individual node has been added
Long Update: The ability to assign a monthly cost to an individual node has been added. This setting enables SAS Enterprise Session Monitor administrators to configure specific nodes to monitor monthly usage costs

Short Update: SAS Enterprise Session Monitor administrator can add an identity provider (IdP) for OIDC or SAML
Long Update: Enabling external authentication in SAS Enterprise Session Monitor enables SAS users to view log files and to manage their own and others' sessions in an authenticated
Document Link: audited workflow. Users can authenticate using their existing Microsoft Active Directory
Release: or SCIM account to perform privileged actions

Short Update: Integration with a ServiceNow CRM system has been added
Long Update: Integration with a ServiceNow CRM system has been added. Alerts from SAS Enterprise Session Monitor can be configured to create ServiceNow incidents automatically

Long Update: New options have been added to the SAS Enterprise Session Monitor Maintenance Utility

Long Update: Documentation of required steps to configure an external PostgreSQL database server on all platforms has been added. The default SAS Enterprise Session Monitor database is still an embedded server that is deployed automatically

Long Update: PostgreSQL 15 is now supported for an external PostgreSQL database server

Short Update: Added support for privileged groups
Long Update: You can now manage groups of privileged users and assign permissions to multiple users simultaneously
Document Link: based on group membership. Groups are synchronized with your LDAP or Active Directory server

Short Update: Added a new table (grid) display for the Nodes view on the Dashboard
Long Update: This new view resolves an issue with slow dashboard loading times when a SAS environment with 200 or more nodes is monitored

Long Update: Added a new /esm/swagger/ endpoint for SAS Enterprise Session Monitor servers that are deployed in a Kubernetes cluster

This information is not currently available in the user interface but is available when you extract data using the Maintenance Utility

Long Update: Support for rotating log files

Document Link: Session level metrics including summary statistics

Turning on this option eliminates the need to connect to Redis in order to execute the published code

Short Update: Update to the Retirement of SAS Drive
Long Update: SAS Drive was originally scheduled to be retired in the 2025.06 release. This change has been postponed to the 2025.12 release

Example Link: and administrators can re-enable SAS Drive until its official retirement in the 2025.06 release

Short Update: SAS Workload Orchestrator is enhanced for performance
Long Update: resilience
Document Link: and efficiency by optimizing database interactions and improving system reliability
Example Link: The improvements address issues with compute sessions and jobs that were slow to start
Release: which were reported in earlier releases. The enhancements deliver a more reliable and responsive experience for the users and ensure smoother operation

Short Update: Host information is no longer displayed to users who are not SAS Workload Orchestrator administrators
Long Update: Host information is no longer displayed to users who are not SAS Workload Orchestrator administrators. This change was required by a security best practice

Short Update: Documentation Enhancments: Host-Type Definition Parameters
Long Update: The default value for Maximum jobs allowed has been clarified

Short Update: SAS Workload Orchestrator can integrate with Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler (CA) to scale your environment.
Long Update: SAS Workload Orchestrator can integrate with Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler (CA) to scale your environment. The CA enables the scaling up of nodes to your cluster when the demand for workload grows and the scaling down of nodes to your cluster when workloads disappear. SAS Workload Orchestrator uses the configuration of scalable host types and non-scalable host types to trigger the use of Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler.

Short Update: Jobs Plug-in: Ability to delete obsolete job objects

Short Update: Enhancement to the Job Plug-In: result saving behavior
Long Update: For information about using the job plug-in to the sas-viya CLI to change how results are saved refer to the documentation

Short Update: Compute Provider Arguments for Use with Job Requests
Long Update: When you define a job request
Document Link: you can specify these arguments that are used by the Compute provider to further control how the job request is processed. These arguments can be specified by using the job plug-in to the sas-viya CLI

Short Update: Jobs and Flows CLI Now Provides an Advanced Help Command
Long Update: The job plug-in to the sas-viya command-line interface (CLI) has added an advanced-help command. The command writes to Stdout the web address of the applicable documentation Jobs and Flows in the SAS Viya Platform Administration Help Center

Long Update: The batch plug-in to the SAS Viya CLI now includes command options that enable reusable batch servers and the use of mounted file systems

Short Update: The sas-viya command-line interface (CLI) is now available in a container image
Long Update: The image contains the sas-viya CLI and related scripts to support the batch operation of the sas-viya CLI in SAS Viya Platform deployments or to function as a standalone container

Short Update: The SAS Audit CLI now consists of four commands
Long Update: All four commands return information from records in the Audit database. Two of the commands return information from database searches. The other two commands return detailed information from a specified record ID. The configuration property sas.audit.record has also been updated. The creation of records is determined by the configuration instances audit.recording.level and activity.recording.level. Each configuration instance now supports the disabled value. Also
Document Link: service.list now forces the creation of records for all READ events that are received from the services that are named in the list

Short Update: New job flows trigger Command
Long Update: The job flows trigger command is now available in the job plug-in to the sas-viya command-line interface (CLI). This command enables the use of a manual trigger
Document Link: which is useful for debugging job flows

Short Update: The QKBs plug-in to the sas-viya CLI is no longer available as of version 2023.10.
Long Update: The QKBs plug-in to the sas-viya CLI is no longer available as of version 2023.10.

Short Update: The job plug-in to the sas-viya command-line interface (CLI) includes the --scheduled input option
Long Update: the --scheduled input option has been added to the job requests show-status command.

Short Update: The job plug-in to the sas-viya command-line interface (CLI) includes the --domain-id input option
Long Update: The --domain-id input option has been added to applicable job requests and job flow commands. This option enables a group-managed service account to use the command.

Short Update: The new listdata plug-in enables you to create
Long Update: read
Release: The new listdata plug-in to the sas-viya command-line interface (CLI) enables you to create

Short Update: The new detection-message-schema plug-in enables you to create
Long Update: apply
Document Link: and retrieve available message schema templates.
Example Link: The new detection-message-schema plug-in to the sas-viya CLI enables you to create
column8: and retrieve available message schema templates.

Short Update: The new detection-definition plug-in creates and retrieves information about organizational hierarchies and organizations.
Long Update: The new detection-definition plug-in to the sas-viya CLI creates and retrieves information about organizational hierarchies and organizations.

Short Update: The new detection plug-in provides access to the SAS Detection Engine
Long Update: The new detection plug-in to the sas-viya CLI provides access to the SAS Detection Engine REST interface in the SAS Viya 4 platform.

Short Update: SAS Viya CLI: new command job flows show-history-tree.
Long Update: The job plug-in to the sas-viya command-line interface (CLI) includes a new command
Document Link: job flows show-history-tree. It is useful for diagnosing problems with job flows.

Short Update: The SAS/CONNECT client can now leverage authentication domains
Long Update: The SAS/CONNECT client can now leverage authentication domains that are maintained by the Credentials microservice in SAS Viya for Spawner sign-ons. By using an authentication domain
Document Link: you do not need to hardcode or manually enter credentials in your SAS programs. This reduces the risk of exposing sensitive information. Administrators can manage and update credentials centrally in the SAS Credential Service
Example Link: making it easier to maintain security and compliance. Using authentication domains ensures consistent credential usage across different applications and users

Short Update: End of Life: SAS Tasks
Long Update: The task functionality reaches end of life in the 2024.12 stable release and in the LTS 2025.03 release. SAS recommends users convert any existing tasks to custom steps as soon as possible

Short Update: Git Profiles: Support for HTTPS Authentication and Password-Protected SSH Keys
Long Update: When you are creating a Git profile
Document Link: you can now configure SAS Studio to store and access HTTPS authentication criteria and password-protected SSH keys using the SAS Environment Manager credential service

Short Update: SAS Auth Browser SDK
Long Update: Add logout function

Short Update: Metadata Clean Up
Long Update: Administrators can run jobs in SAS Environment Manager to clean up unnecessary or broken metadata such as blank or duplicate rows.

Short Update: Changing the Compute Context for Agents
Long Update: Sometimes resources such as tables and libraries are defined and scoped to a specific compute context. The compute context is used to configure and crawl catalog data for your instance of SAS Information Catalog. If the default compute context does not give you access to the resources that you need in your catalog
Document Link: you can select a different compute context.

Short Update: Remote SAS Data Agent now supports deployments involving Security Enhanced Linux.
Long Update: Remote SAS Data Agent now supports deployments involving Security Enhanced Linux.

Short Update: Updates to Content Security Policy
Long Update: SAS administrators must specify 'wasm-unsafe-eval' for users to view SAS Visual Analytics reports in SAS for Microsoft 365. In previous releases

Short Update: SASPy: Support for CA file in connection Statement added
Long Update: added a new Configuration Definition key
Example Link: which can be used to specify the location of the Viya Certificate bundle (the path to that .pem file)
Release: so that HTTP from python will use this certificate to create a Trusted connection.

Short Update: The default limit for the process definition cache size is now 100 definitions.
Long Update: The default limit for the process definition cache size is now 100 definitions.You can change this cache size in the processDefinitionCacheLimit configuration parameter in SAS Environment Manager.

Short Update: Publish Decisions to Databricks Destinations
Long Update: You can publish decisions to Databricks publishing destinations. Decisions that are published to Databricks destinations cannot contain some object types

Short Update: Maximum Lengths for Character Variables
Long Update: In decisions and rule sets that are published to SAS Micro Analytic Service destinations or to container destinations
Document Link: the maximum length for character variables (outside of a data grid)
Release: and for varying-length binary variables is 50 Mb. For other destination types
column8: the maximum length for these variables is 10 Mb. The maximum length for binary variables (not varying-length binary variables) is 8 Mb

Short Update: Compare Node Variables with Decision Variables
Long Update: The Compare node variables option on a decision node enables you to compare the input and output settings for the node's variables with the settings for the corresponding decision variables

Short Update: New Configuration Options: sas.referencedata.activation.skipOfflineCAS
Long Update: Enables lookup tables and global variables to be activated if at least one CAS server is online. Objects are not activated on servers that are offline

Short Update: New Configuration Options: sas.intelligent.decisioning.requirePublishAndLock
Long Update: Requires users to use the Publish and lock button in order to publish decisions and rule sets from the user interface. This button locks and publishes the selected version and creates a new minor version at the same time

Short Update: New Configuration Options: sas.intelligent.decisioning.readOnlyOutcomeCodeFiles
Long Update: Prevents users from manually editing the code in existing outcome code files in a segmentation tree. Users can still view the existing outcome code file

Short Update: Manage Workflow Tasks from the Home Page
Long Update: The Tasks section at the bottom of the home page lists the active workflow tasks to which you or a group of which you are a member have been assigned. You can claim
Example Link: and release tasks from the home page

Short Update: Duplicate a Row of Advanced List Data
Long Update: If you are adding repetitive data to an advanced list
Document Link: the duplicate-row feature combines the abilities to add a row of data and then modify the row's values

Short Update: Segmentation Tree Enhancements
Long Update: In a segmentation tree
Document Link: the Default Associated Value List window for a variable and the Associated Value List window for a tree branch now include the version number of the value list

Short Update: Segmentation Tree Enhancements
Long Update: You can view segmentation trees as a graphical diagram
Document Link: search for named branches and outcomes
Example Link: highlight paths from specific outcomes back to the root of the tree
Release: and more. You can view segmentation trees as a graphical diagram in addition to the tabular view

Short Update: Compare the Contents of Advanced List Revisions
Long Update: This feature enables you to compare the contents of multiple revisions of a specific advanced list. The Show differences only toggle enables you to easily see the difference in data values between revisions

Short Update: Use Custom Workflows to Manage Decision Development
Long Update: You can use custom workflows that you develop in SAS Workflow Manager to manage the development
Example Link: and deployment of decisions in SAS Intelligent Decisioning. A new sample workflow
column10: approving and deploying decisions. You can use this sample workflow
column11: or you can design your own custom workflow

Short Update: Enhancements to Lists of Included Objects
Long Update: The Included Objects Report includes the location of each object that is stored in a folder. Items that are not in checkout-enabled folders are identified by the icon invalid. Items that are not found are identified by the icon error. The Included Objects to be Committed window includes the version number of each object that you have checked out
Document Link: and it includes the latest version of each object. If a new version of an object was created after you checked out the object
Example Link: the object is identified by the warning icon

Short Update: New API endpoint: List Data API
Long Update: The /lists/{listId}/revisions/contents endpoint enables you to retrieve the contents of the revisions for a specified list and compare the contents in each revision

Short Update: Manage List Revisions
Long Update: The list revisions feature has been updated. The most recent version of a list is no longer automatically deployed. Version deployment is combined with list deployment so that when you deploy a list
Document Link: you deploy the most recent version of the list unless you specify to deploy a different version

Short Update: Edit Advanced List Data Inline
Long Update: This feature enables you to easily modify a specific value in an advanced list table that is not a key value or a status. If you are editing multiple values
Document Link: the Show only unsaved changes toggle enables you to review your edits before you save them

Short Update: Enhacened REST Endpoint: List Data API
Long Update: The /lists/{listId}/revisions/ endpoint enables you to create a new list revision
Document Link: return a list of revisions for a specified list
Example Link: retrieve the contents for a specified list revision

Short Update: Create and Manage List Revisions
Long Update: A list owner or an administrator of the application can create revisions of an advanced list
Document Link: view the contents of a revision
Example Link: and set which list revision is deployed

Short Update: You can export the results of a tag comparison to a PDF file
Long Update: You can export the results of a tag comparison to a PDF file

Short Update: Update Versions of Outcome Code Files
Long Update: You can update the versions of the code files that are used as outcome code files in segmentation tree outcomes

Short Update: In the Commit Decision Version window
Long Update: you can click Show included objects to display the list of objects that will be committed together with the decision
Document Link: In the Commit Decision Version window
Example Link: you can click Show included objects to display the list of objects that will be committed together with the decision

Short Update: %DCM_CALCULATE_SAMPLE_SIZE Macro
Long Update: You can use the %DCM_CALCULATE_SAMPLE_SIZE Macro in SAS Intelligent Decisioning: Macro Guide to determine the sample size percentages to specify for each branch of an A/B test node

Short Update: The Checked Out column in the category view for each object type indicates whether the object is checked out
Long Update: The Checked Out column in the category view for each object type indicates whether the object is checked out

Short Update: Compare Tags That Are Associated with Objects
Long Update: You can compare the list of object versions that are associated with two different tags

Short Update: Added macros to retrieve A/B test node results
Long Update: To support retrieving A/B test node results from the subject contacts database
Document Link: the %DCM_GET_SUBJECTCONTACT_HISTORY macro and the %DCM_BUILD_SUBJECTCONTACT_SIM_ABT macro both support the ABTESTS= option

Short Update: Add A/B Test Nodes to Decisions
Long Update: You can use an A/B test node to direct input records into a champion path or a challenger path for testing. Each path includes one or more objects such rule sets

Short Update: General Enhacments: Navigating Segmentation Trees is improved
Long Update: You now have icons to expand/collapse the display of a single branch and can do the same for all of the branches in a tree

Short Update: General Enhacments: Limit for lookup keys & vales increased
Long Update: The limit for lookup keys and values in a lookup table has increased to 256 characters and 512 characters

Short Update: Export and Import Objects from Within SAS Intelligent Decisioning
Long Update: You can export and import objects to and from JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) files from within SAS Intelligent Decisioning. When you export a decision
Document Link: the objects included in the decision are also exported

Short Update: General Enhancements: Additional information available for tagged items
Long Update: The Associated Items window for a tag now includes additional information about each object that is associated with the selected tag

Short Update: Export Decisions from within SAS Intelligent Decisioning
Long Update: You can export decisions to JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) files from within SAS Intelligent Decisioning. The exported file contains the decision and the objects that are included in the decision

Short Update: Edit and Rename Segmentation Tree Objects
Long Update: You can edit and rename boolean expressions in a segmentation tree diagram

Short Update: When you create a new decision version by using tags
Long Update: you can select the Apply tags to all selected decision components option to add the specified version tags to all newly created decision components
Document Link: When you create a new decision version by using tags
Example Link: you can select the Apply tags to all selected decision components option to add the specified version tags to all newly created decision components

Short Update: The Displayed version tags field on an object's Properties tab displays the list of tags that are associated with the displayed version of the object
Long Update: The Displayed version tags field on an object's Properties tab displays the list of tags that are associated with the displayed version of the object

Short Update: Prevent Commit of Invalid Decisions
Long Update: The configuration option sas.intelligent.decisioning.preventCommitWithErrors controls whether users can commit checked-out decisions that generate errors when they are validated

Short Update: Generate a Used By Report for Value Lists
Long Update: You can generate a Used By report for value lists. This report lists the objects that use a selected value list

Short Update: Manage Tags
Long Update: You can use the Tag management category view to create and manage the list of tags that can be associated with SAS Intelligent Decisioning objects. You can designate a tag administrator who can define a specific set of tags for use at your site

Short Update: Enhancement: generate a Used By report for segmentation trees
Long Update: generate a Used By report for segmentation trees

Short Update: Enhancement: Show unmapped variables
Long Update: click Show unmapped variables in the Variable Mappings window for a decision test to filter the list of mappings to show only unmapped decision variables

Short Update: Enhacnement: click Sorted
Long Update: descending or Sorted
Document Link: ascending in the Version column heading in category views to sort the list of object versions
column8: ascending in the Version column heading in category views to sort the list of object versions

Short Update: Use Subject ID Values for Enhanced Error Reporting
Long Update: If your site has enabled enhanced error reporting
Document Link: and if you specify a subject ID variable in a decision's properties
Example Link: then the application writes additional log messages when an error occurs. The messages include the value of the subject ID variable for the current input record
Release: which helps you to identify which input record is being processed when the error occurs

Short Update: Enable Check Out Decision Contents Window
Long Update: The Enable Check Out Decision Contents window setting enables the Check Out Decision Contents window. In this window you can check out the objects in a decision at the same time that you check out the decision

Short Update: Configuration Options for Managing Version Tags
Long Update: The following configuration options control how tags are managed for new object versions: requireTagFromSelection and requireVersionTags

Short Update: %DCM_CREATE_PUBLISH_VALIDATION Macro added.
Long Update: The %DCM_CREATE_PUBLISH_VALIDATION macro enables you to create a publishing validation test for decisions that have been published to any destination type except Git destinations.

Short Update: Enhancement to the published decision report
Long Update: The published decision report now includes information about the Micro Analytic modules that are used in a decision.

Short Update: Generate a Published Decision Report
Long Update: The published decision report documents the content of a published version of a decision. The report includes the decision properties
Document Link: the properties of each object in the decision
Example Link: and a table of the decision's variables. The report also includes the name and URI of the published object
Release: the date on which the decision version was published
column8: the user ID that published the version
column9: and information about the publishing destination.

Short Update: Updated Left Navigation Pane with grouping.
Long Update: The left navigation panel has been updated. Object categories are now grouped according to how the object type is used. For example
Document Link: the rule set and treatment group categories are grouped under the DECISION ELEMENTS section. The custom function and global variable categories are grouped under the GLOBAL ELEMENTS section.

Short Update: Thread Count for Tests for easier debugging.
Long Update: When you specify an input debug variable for a test
Document Link: SAS Intelligent Decisioning automatically sets the maximum number of threads that can be allocated for the test to 1. Setting the thread count to 1 ensures that the variable's values are written to the log in the correct order and are not affected by different threads completing at different times.

Short Update: Specify Model Versions in Decisions
Long Update: either a specific version of latest.
Document Link: In the Properties panel for a model node in a decision
Example Link: you can select the version of the model that you want the decision to use. If you select a specific version
Release: the decision always uses that version
column8: even if newer versions of the model are deployed. If you select latest
column9: the decision always uses the most recently deployed version of the model.

Short Update: SingleStore: Support for Access to a SingleStore Database
Long Update: SAS Container Runtime supports connections to a SingleStore database for a SAS Intelligent Decisioning decision. This means that you can publish a decision that contains database queries that are intended for a SingleStore database to SAS Container Runtime

Short Update: Kaniko is being depercated and replaced with BuildKit
Long Update: Starting with 2025.06
Document Link: the Model Publish service is deprecating the use of Kaniko and replacing it with BuildKit. BuildKit is used by default instead of Kaniko to publish models or decisions to container destinations. You must configure BuildKit for Decisions Runtime Builder service for use with the Model Publish service

Short Update: Improved Execution Error Response Information
Long Update: To assist in debugging issues
Document Link: the SAS Container Runtime REST interface now returns more detailed information when an execution error occurs

Short Update: Amazon Web Services Now Supported for Updating SAS Container Runtime Binary Files in a Published Image
Long Update: You can now update the binary files in a SAS Container Runtime published image that is located on Amazon Web Services.

Short Update: Support for Retrieving Dictionaries from a Python Module Added to the PyMAS Package
Long Update: You can now retrieve dictionaries from a Python module as a data grid via the PyMAS package. Here is the syntax format: rc=py.getDatagrid(argument_name

Short Update: Support for SAS Visual Text Analytics Models
Long Update: SAS Container Runtime now supports the execution of SAS Visual Text Analytics models

Short Update: Google BigQuery: Support has been added
Long Update: SAS Container Runtime supports connections to a Google BigQuery database for a SAS Intelligent Decisioning decision. This means that you can publish a decision that contains database queries that are intended for a BigQuery database to SAS Container Runtime

Short Update: Enhancement to Proc DS2: SERIALIZEMETADATA Method
Long Update: In the datagrid package

Long Update: In the datagrid package
Document Link: a new signature that includes additional arguments

Long Update: You can now input datagrid variables to a Python module via the PyMAS package. Here is the syntax format: rc = py.setDatagrid(argument_name

Short Update: Support for the Python Logging Facility
Long Update: SAS Container Runtime utilizes the logging facility for Python module to incorporate logging in published Python modules

Short Update: Support for Retrieving Request Headers Using Python Module Code
Long Update: You can now retrieve a metadata value with SAS Container Runtime Python module code. To do so
Document Link: you use the masmetadata module getMetadata function to retrieve the Python dictionary that contains the metadata

Short Update: Use Record Contacts Nodes in Container Destinations
Long Update: Record contacts nodes in decisions that are published to container destinations write subject contact information to an intermediate database instead of writing it directly to the subject contacts database

Short Update: Update to the MASParallelExec Package
Long Update: The MASParallelExec package methods now accept the name of the call provided to addCall(). This allows for added call selection by name

Short Update: Support for Updating SAS Container Runtime Binary Files in a Published Image in an Azure Container Registry
Long Update: You can now use a REST API to update the SAS Container Runtime binary files that exist in a published image in an Azure Container Registry. Previously
Document Link: only a private Docker Registry was supported.

Short Update: Support for Access to a Microsoft SQL Server Database
Long Update: SAS Container Runtime supports connections to a Microsoft SQL Server database for a SAS Intelligent Decisioning decision. This means that you can publish a decision that contains database queries that are intended for a Microsoft SQL Server database to SAS Container Runtime.

Short Update: New DS2 SQL Services Loggers
Long Update: SQL services loggers that track information when the SQLSTMT package is used or when creating connections that are used by SQL statements have been added.

Short Update: Configure the Number of Worker Threads
Long Update: By default
Document Link: SAS Container Runtime runs with four core threads and no asynchronous threads. If necessary
Example Link: you can now use the environment variables to modify these values.

Short Update: Allow for user to set custom timeout length for score testing in score_model_with_cas
Long Update: Allow for user to set custom timeout length for score testing in score_model_with_cas

Short Update: Added model versioning methods to model_repository.py to handle model version endpoints
Long Update: Added model versioning methods to model_repository.py to handle model version endpoints

Long Update: allowing for more general usage of the score_model_with_cas task

Long Update: allowing for more flexibility between python environments

Long Update: Added example Jupyter notebook for OpenAI models

Long Update: Python: write_score_code.py refactored to include ability to run batch scoring

Long Update: Python: examples have been updated

Long Update: Python: Updated project creation to automatically set project properties based on contained models

Long Update: Python: Included capability to assess biases of a model using CAS FairAITools

Long Update: Python: Added handling for TensorFlow Keras models

Long Update: Python SASCTL: Examples have been updated.

Long Update: Connections to a SingleStore database are supported via the SingleStore driver that is included with a SAS Micro Analytic Service deployment

Long Update: SAS Micro Analytic Service utilizes the logging facility for Python module to incorporate logging in published Python modules

Short Update: Improved Execution Error Response Information
Long Update: To assist in debugging issues
Document Link: the SAS Micro Analytic Service REST interface now returns more detailed information when an execution error occurs.

Short Update: Cancel Execution Request Functionality Added

Long Update: Connections to a DB2 database are supported via a customer-provided DB2 client environment
