Short Update: Support for Using HTTP Headers as Metadata
Long Update: SAS Micro Analytic Score can include custom HTTP header values of a REST request as metadata. The header data is retrieved as key-value pairs in JSON format. This metadata is available to the DS2 module code via the mdcGetVal function

Short Update: Updates to the MASParallelExec Package
Long Update: The MASParallelExec package methods now accept the name of the call provided to addCall(). This allows for added call selection by name

Short Update: Python Standard Logging Support
Long Update: SAS Micro Analytic Service with SAS Event Stream Processing now supports standard Python logging

Short Update: New MASCall Package Methods: setDatagrid
Long Update: For a specified data grid
Document Link: sets the data grid value to use in the external method execution.

Short Update: New MASCall Package Methods: getDatagrid
Long Update: For a specified data grid
Document Link: retrieves the data grid and delivers it to the local variable.

Short Update: New DS2 SQL Services Loggers
Long Update: SQL services loggers that track information when the SQLSTMT package is used or when creating connections that are used by SQL statements have been added.

Short Update: Module ID Logged for Asynchronous Module Creation and Update
Long Update: The module ID that is created or updated is now logged for all messages that are related to an associated job.

Short Update: Datagrid SUBSET Method Adds the Ability to Define Multicolumn Subset Criteria
Long Update: A new argument is added to the Datagrid package SUBSET method. The dgCriteria argument enables you to specify a data grid to pass in to the operation that defines a multicolumn subset.

Short Update: You can now create a project container for a project that is stored in the Git repository that is internal to SAS Event Stream Processing
Long Update: You can now create a project container for a project that is stored in the Git repository that is internal to SAS Event Stream Processing. Previously
Document Link: you could create a project container only for a project that is stored in a remote Git repository

Short Update: Enhancement to Importing Projects
Long Update: In SAS Event Stream Processing Studio
Document Link: when you import a project that does not have a project package or a remote repository
Example Link: you can now create a project package and a remote repository during importing. Previously you had to import the project first and create a project package and a remote repository later

Short Update: Ability to Create Project Containers
Long Update: You can now use SAS Event Stream Manager to create a project container that includes a project package and the minimal software components that are required to run the project. The project container complies with the Open Container Initiative (OCI) and can be deployed in different environments: in cloud environments

Short Update: New Execution Provider Options for ONNX Models
Long Update: You can now specify configuration parameter values for an execution provider as a parameter-value pair within the <property> element of the Model Reader window

Short Update: Importing SAS Model Manager ZIP Files
Long Update: You can now use SAS Event Stream Processing Studio to manually import a model that you have exported from SAS Model Manager as a ZIP file. The functionality to automatically import a model from SAS Model Manager is also still available when SAS Event Stream Processing is deployed with other SAS products

Short Update: New Performance Information in SAS Event Stream Processing Studio.
Long Update: You can access new performance information when you run a test or when you view the ESP Servers page.

Short Update: New Performance Information in SAS Event Stream Manager
Long Update: You can access new performance information when you monitor a deployment whose type is 'Cluster'
Document Link: and then view details for a specific pod.

Short Update: Configure Databricks Publishing Destination
Long Update: You can configure a Databricks publishing destination. The SAS Viya platform ACCELERATOR procedure supports the AWS Databricks and Azure Databricks data sources. PROC ACCELERATOR is an interactive procedure that provides an interface to external data sources for model publishing and scoring. Models are supported in the form of DATA step code
Example Link: or analytic stores. After a model is published to a Databricks publishing destination
Release: running the model invokes the SAS Embedded Process

Short Update: Control Autoincrementing of Model Versions
Long Update: The autoincrementing of the model version when publishing a model or setting a model as the project champion is now optional. You cannot edit a model version that has been published or that has been set as the project champion. Users can lock a version of a model from editing if they choose to not create a new model version when publishing or setting the champion role. When a user is ready to edit the model
Document Link: they can create a new major or minor version

Short Update: Configure the SAS Viya Platform for Large Analytic Store Files
Long Update: When working with large analytic store models
Document Link: additional resource configurations are necessary to ensure that users can successfully import and process the models in SAS Model Manager. You can adjust CPU and memory resources for SAS Viya Platform services and increase the maximum file size for the Files service to handle the large analytic store models

Short Update: Enhancement to the Performance Monitoring Report: now with support for Fairness Monitoring
Long Update: Users can now see how a model’s performance on fairness and bias changes over time. With this additional information
Document Link: users can now include measures of model bias when making their decision to refresh

Short Update: New quick start tutorial for R available
Long Update: This example walks you through the steps to generate the R model files for the SAS Model Manager Quick Start Tutorial

Short Update: CAS Gateway and External Language Support for Open-Source Models
Long Update: The CAS Gateway action set is now being used instead of PyMAS for running performance monitoring and scoring test jobs that contain open-source models (Python and R) in SAS Model Manager. Therefore
Document Link: you must configure CAS Gateway and external language support

Short Update: Model Card
Long Update: The Model Card feature has been added to help users and teams develop and manage their models

Short Update: New examples added on Scoring ONNX Models with CAS in SAS Viya 4
Long Update: This example aims to show how to score open-source models that use more complicated frameworks
Document Link: such as ONNX models. Due to the language invariant nature of ONNX models
Example Link: the model within SAS Model Manager can use any supported score code type that can send a REST API call. This example uses a Python-centric source

Short Update: Select Specific Model Versions to Monitor for Performance
Long Update: When you create or edit a performance definition you can choose to use the latest version of a model or select a specfic version of a model to run performance on

Short Update: Models CLI Enhancements
Long Update: The --databaseDriver command option has been added to the models plug-in for creating Git desitinations

Short Update: SAS Viya CLI: --userEmail renamed to --gitUserEmail
Long Update: The --userEmail container destination option for the models plug-in to the SAS Viya CLI has been renamed to --gitUserEmail.

Short Update: CLI Command and Options for Setting Model Evaluation Properties
Long Update: The model-evaluation-properties subcommand has been added to the project command of the models plug-in to the SAS Viya CLI. This new subcommand enables you to list and update the model evaluation properties for a project.

Short Update: Enhancement to the models plug-in
Long Update: The --sslSecretName command has been added to the destination options in the models CLI plug-in for creating Azure container destinations

Short Update: Enhancement to the models plug-in
Long Update: python3.11 and python3.12 support has been added for the --resourceCategories command option in the models CLI plug-in for creating container destinations

Short Update: Enhancement to listdata Plug-In
Long Update: The listdata plug-in command-line interface has been updated to add new commands. The revisions contents command enables you to get the contents of a specified advanced list revision. The revisions contents-compare command enables you to compare the contents of multiple revisions for a specified advanced list

Short Update: listdata Plug-In update
Long Update: The listdata plug-in command-line interface has been updated to add the revisions command
Document Link: which enables you to create a new revision for a specified list and deploy a specified revision. The get revisions command enables you to return a list of the revisions for a specified list or retrieve a specified revision

Short Update: Models CLI Enhancements
Long Update: The --resourceCategories command option has been added to the models plug-in for creating Git desitinations and container destinations

Short Update: New documentation page clarifying which models are not supported by In-Database scoring
Long Update: New documentation page clarifying which models are not supported by In-Database scoring

Short Update: Synapse: models can now be stored in SQL server tables (recommended)
Long Update: For model scoring in Synapse
Document Link: you can now publish a model to an SQL server table
Example Link: and this method is recommended. Previously
Release: you could publish a model only to the file system in ADLS in order to run the model in Synapse

Short Update: HDInsight: For model scoring on HDInsight
Long Update: you can now publish a model to a Hive table.
Example Link: you can now publish a model to a Hive table
Release: and this method is recommended. Previously
column8: you could publish a model only to the file system in ADLS in order to run the model in HDInsight.

Short Update: Databricks: you can now publish a model to a Spark table.
Long Update: For Databricks
Document Link: you can now publish a model to a Spark table. Previously for Databricks
Example Link: you could publish a model only to an Amazon S3 or ADLS file system.

Short Update: Teradata: The SAS Embedded Process has a new release.
Long Update: The SAS Embedded Process for Teradata has a new release. The deployment is now delivered from a SAS Viya platform repository.

Short Update: Synapse: The SAS Embedded Process has a new release.
Long Update: The SAS Embedded Process for Synapse has a new release. The Embedded Process has been updated at every recent stable cadence.

Short Update: Single Store: In-database scoring is now supported for SAS SpeedyStore.
Long Update: In-database scoring is now supported for SAS SpeedyStore. Publishing and Running Scoring Models in SingleStore. When you order SAS SpeedyStore
Document Link: installation of SAS Embedded Process is not required as for other data sources. SingleStore is delivered with the SAS Viya platform order
Example Link: and SAS Embedded Process is already installed in SingleStore.

Short Update: Databricks: The SAS Embedded Process has a new release.
Long Update: The SAS Embedded Process for Databricks has a new release. The Embedded Process has been updated at every recent stable cadence.

Short Update: SAS in-database processing supports scoring in Azure HDInsight.
Long Update: Scoring Models can now be published to and scored in Azure HDInsight. This requires a specific version of HDInsight
Document Link: Spark & HDInsight Interactive Query (Apache Hive LLAP) cluster must be configured and the SAS Embedded Process must be installed in the Spark cluster.

Short Update: New Step: Assess Model Step
Long Update: The Assess Model step evaluates the performance of a predictive model by comparing the predicted and actual target values in a scored data set. Based on the type of target

Short Update: New Step: Register Model Step for SAS Studio Analyst and Engineer
Long Update: The Register Model step imports a scoring model from SAS Studio into SAS Model Manager. A scoring model is an analytic object in a CAS table.

Short Update: General Enhancements: Some models now use analytic store (astore) as the model representation
Long Update: Some models now use analytic store as the model representation. If you are promoting content across deployments
Document Link: you might need to include additional tables

Short Update: Beta Release of the SAS Trustworthy AI Life Cycle
Long Update: The Trustworthy AI Life Cycle workflow definition outlines steps to evaluate and deploy a trustworthy AI system via model assessment

Short Update: The Manage Notification Configuration table has a new column named Locale Code.
Long Update: The Manage Notification Configuration table has a new column named Locale Code.

Short Update: You can now create SMS text message notification templates.
Long Update: You can now create SMS text message notification templates.

Short Update: Rename Matrices in Segmentation Trees
Long Update: You can rename a matrix if the matrix has not been added to a segmentation tree

Short Update: Enhancement to Segmentation Trees: You can delete local value lists
Long Update: You can delete local value lists

Short Update: Enhancement to Segmentation Trees: Export reference to local value list
Long Update: When you export a variable that references a local value list from a segmentation tree
Document Link: the reference to the local value list is not included in the exported data. Because the reference is not included in the exported data
Example Link: you can import the variable into other objects or into other segmentation trees without first creating the value list

Short Update: View a List's Estimated Memory and Record Count
Long Update: The following data points are added to the Properties tab for each advanced list: Estimated memory is an estimation of the memory that is used to store the list in Redis. Record count is the number of records in the first version of a list. This count excludes the number of revision records

Short Update: Enhanced Features in Segmentation Trees
Long Update: For each outcome code file in the Manage Outcome Code Files window
Document Link: the application includes a link to the original DS2 code file that was used to create the outcome code file. Click this link to open the original DS2 code file in the code file editor

Short Update: Enhanced Features in Segmentation Trees
Long Update: You can use the Search field in the segmentation tree diagram to search for specific variables
Release: and outcomes in the segmentation tree. SAS Intelligent Decisioning highlights the matching objects in the tree. You can use the arrow keys to move between highlighted objects

Short Update: Enhanced Features in Segmentation Trees
Long Update: You can use a column in a data grid variable to define a Boolean expression
Example Link: or create a variable branch in a segmentation tree. For matrices and variable branches
Release: you must create a data grid reference variable that identifies the specific cell in the data grid whose values you want to process. For Boolean expressions
column8: you can use a previously created reference variable
column9: or you can use data grid functions to process the values

Short Update: Enhanced Features in Segmentation Trees
Long Update: The list of outcome code files in the Manage Outcome Code Files window now displays the code file name and version for each outcome. A bullet bullet appears next to each code file for which newer versions are available

Short Update: Specifying the A/B Test Node Type
Long Update: When you add a new A/B Test node to a decision
Document Link: you can select the node type in the New A/B Test window instead of changing the test node type in the node's properties pane

Short Update: New Feature: Advanced Lists
Long Update: An advanced list is a tabular data set that can have multiple keys and values and can be shared among SAS applications and workflows. The advanced lists features enable you to manage tabular data in your environment and also publish and query that data in a low-latency

Short Update: Enhancement: You can check out and commit decisions that are used a parallel process node in the Properties pane or in the Properties window for the node
Long Update: You can check out and commit decisions that are used a parallel process node in the Properties pane or in the Properties window for the node

Short Update: Enhancement: When you create a cross-branch link
Long Update: you can filter the list of target nodes by node type
Document Link: and you can search for specific nodes by name
Example Link: When you create a cross-branch link
Release: you can filter the list of target nodes by node type
column8: and you can search for specific nodes by name

Short Update: Enhancement: The Import data option is now available in the Choose Data window when you are defining a scoring test
Long Update: The Import data option is now available in the Choose Data window when you are defining a scoring test

Short Update: Use Array Syntax for Data Grid Column Names
Long Update: To test a decision that uses a data grid
Document Link: you can specify an input table that contains columns whose names follow naming conventions similar to how array elements are accessed: columnName[rowNumber]

Short Update: Add Parallel Process Nodes to Decisions
Long Update: You can use parallel process nodes to process multiple decisions in parallel. By default
Document Link: the decisions in a parallel process node are run in parallel in SAS Micro Analytic Service destinations and in the SAS Container Runtime

Short Update: Import Data from Within SAS Intelligent Decisioning
Long Update: You can use the Import data option in SAS Intelligent Decisioning to import data without switching to SAS Data Explorer. This option is available from the actions menu in the Segmentation trees
Example Link: and Value lists category views. Data imported by using this option is available to all objects in SAS Intelligent Decisioning

Short Update: %DCM_CONVERT_DATAGRID_TO_TABLE Macro Enhancement
Long Update: The FIXEDMETADATA parameter for the %DCMCONVERT_DATAGRID_TO_TABLE macro specifies whether all data grids in the input table have the exact same metadata. For large CAS tables
Document Link: if all of the data grids have the same metadata
Example Link: specifying FIXEDMETADATA=YES can improve macro performance.

Short Update: View Published Decisions
Long Update: The Deployments category view displays the list of all decision versions that have been published to any destination within the last six months. The Deployments page also displays metrics such as the total number of decisions published and the number of decision deployed to each destination type.

Short Update: Filter on Multiple Columns with DATAGRID_SUBSETBYVALUE
Long Update: With the DATAGRID_SUBSETBYVALUE function
Document Link: you can use a data grid to specify filter criteria for multiple columns. For a row in the source data grid
Example Link: if all of the criteria specified in the criteria data grid evaluate to true
Release: the row is added to the target data grid.

Short Update: Support for Access to Redis Servers
Long Update: SAS Container Runtime supports connections to Redis servers for a SAS Intelligent Decisioning decision. This means that you can publish a decision that contains queries that are intended for Redis servers to SAS Container Runtime

Short Update: Support for Parallel Processing of Sub-Decisions
Long Update: SAS Container Runtime now provides the ability to perform parallel processing of sub-decisions in SAS Intelligent Decisioning. The MASParallelExec package contains methods that enable a DS2 module to call module methods concurrently

Short Update: Support for Parallel Processing of Sub-Decisions
Long Update: SAS Micro Analytic Service now provides the ability to perform parallel processing. The MASParallelExec package contains methods that enable a DS2 module to call module methods concurrently

Short Update: MASCall getDatagrid and setDatagrid Method Updates
Long Update: The MASCall getDatagrid and setDatagrid methods now support asynchronous calls via the asyncCallModule method
